original: gal te gzhan skyes te de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzhan skyes te de lta na yang /
translated: But even if it were produced from another,

original: de yi yul nyid yod 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de yi yul nyid yod 'gyur gyi //
translated: the object would not exist.

original: gzhan dag myong na gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag myong na gzhan dag ni //
translated: If one thing were experienced by another,

original: dngos po yod par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po yod par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could the existence of one thing be known?

original: myong ba gzhan la rang myong la //
analyzed: myong ba gzhan la rang myong la //
translated: If the experience of one thing is not experienced by another,

original: yid mi chos pa gang gis zlog //üîΩde ni myong yang mi bden par //
analyzed: yid mi chos pa gang gis zlog // de ni myong yang mi bden par //
translated: how can it be denied?üîΩIf it is experienced, how can it be doubted

original: dogs par ci ltar 'gyur ma yin //üîΩlus kyi myong ba mig gis ni //
analyzed: dogs par ci ltar 'gyur ma yin // lus kyi myong ba mig gis ni //
translated: that it is not true?üîΩWhat is the difference between the experience of the body

original: myong ba las khyad ci zhig yod //
analyzed: myong ba las khyad ci zhig yod //
translated: and the experience of the eye?

original: gal te don der tshim zhe na //
analyzed: gal te don der tshim zhe na //
translated: If you are satisfied with the object,üîΩhow can you know that you are satisfied?

original: yongs su tshim par ga las rtog / ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du reg pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yongs su tshim par ga las rtog / ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du reg pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yin te /
translated: Just as visual consciousness does not exist, so also the consciousness of touch does not exist.

original: gnyi ga yang da bang po 'i rnam par shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang da bang po 'i rnam par shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference between the two, since both are simply the consciousness of a sense faculty.

original: rab rib la sogs pas nyams pa srid pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas nyams pa srid pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs te /
translated: The possibility of impairment by cataracts, etc., is the same for both,

original: gnyi ga la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are seen.

original: mkhris pa'i rims skyis nyams pa las dro bar myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rims skyis nyams pa las dro bar myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is experienced as hot due to the degeneration of bile.

original: yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the purpose of complete satisfaction?‚Äù

original: grang ba'i dus su mkhris pa'i rigs kyis nyams pas cha bar myong ba la yang ci ste yongs su tshim pa med /
analyzed: grang ba'i dus su mkhris pa'i rigs kyis nyams pas cha bar myong ba la yang ci ste yongs su tshim pa med /
translated: Then why is there no complete satisfaction even when there is the experience of the middle stage due to the degeneration of bile in the cold season?

original: gzhan yang / myong ba tshad ma yin na ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / myong ba tshad ma yin na ni //
translated: Moreover, if experience is valid cognition,

original: yongs su tshim pa don ci yod //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa don ci yod //
translated: what is the purpose of complete satisfaction?

original: myong ba tshad ma yin na yang //
analyzed: myong ba tshad ma yin na yang //
translated: If experience is valid cognition,

original: yongs su tshim pa don ci yod //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa don ci yod //
translated: what is the purpose of complete satisfaction?

original: gal te myong ba tshad ma yin na de nyid kyi don grub pas yongs su tshim pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te myong ba tshad ma yin na de nyid kyi don grub pas yongs su tshim pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If experience is valid cognition, then since the meaning is established by that alone, what is the purpose of another complete satisfaction?

original: myong bas ma grub gang yin @164a * //
analyzed: myong bas ma grub gang yin @164a * //
translated: What is not established by experience

original: pa ; / yongs su tshim pa brgya yis kyang //
analyzed: pa ; / yongs su tshim pa brgya yis kyang //
translated: is not established by a hundred complete satisfactions.

original: ci ltar 'grub 'gyur gzhan pa yi //
analyzed: ci ltar 'grub 'gyur gzhan pa yi //
translated: How could it be established by another

original: yongs su tshim pa sgrub byed min //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa sgrub byed min //
translated: complete satisfaction that does not establish it?

original: myong bsal gzhan pa'i yongs su tshim pa ci dgos /
analyzed: myong bsal gzhan pa'i yongs su tshim pa ci dgos /
translated: What need is there for another complete satisfaction other than experience?

original: don sgrub par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: don sgrub par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt establishes the meaning,‚Äù

original: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan 'grub /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan 'grub /
translated: how could one thing establish another?

original: 'grel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩ'brel pa gang gis 'grub /
analyzed: 'grel pa'i phyir ro zhe na / 'brel pa gang gis 'grub /
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of the commentary,üîΩwhat is the connection?

original: yongs su tshim pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa las so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of complete satisfaction,

original: der yang 'brel pa grub pa la ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der yang 'brel pa grub pa la ltos par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then that also depends on the establishment of the connection.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba las so zhe na /üîΩde nyid las don grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba las so zhe na / de nyid las don grub pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of experience,

original: yongs su tshim pa don med do //
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa don med do //
translated: then the complete satisfaction is pointless, because the object is established from that itself.

original: de la yang skyon de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la yang skyon de nyid yin no //
translated: And the same error would apply to that.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba las don grub na sngar nyams su myong ba las ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba las don grub na sngar nyams su myong ba las ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: If the object is established from experience, why is it not established from a previous experience?

original: 'dis ni don du mos pa yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don du mos pa yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: This also clarifies the belief in the object.

original: 'di ltar / myong ba las gzhan don du ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / myong ba las gzhan don du ni //
translated: Thus:

original: mos pa don gyi sgrub byed min //
analyzed: mos pa don gyi sgrub byed min //
translated: The belief in the object is not the establishment of the object,üîΩbecause it is different from the experience.

original: mos pa nyams myong nyid yin yang //
analyzed: mos pa nyams myong nyid yin yang //
translated: Even though the belief is the experience,

original: myong nyid don kun sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: myong nyid don kun sgrub byed yin //
translated: the experience itself is the establishment of the object.

original: 'dis ni mngon par 'dod pa dang dran pa dang sdang ba dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon par 'dod pa dang dran pa dang sdang ba dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the desire, memory, aversion, and volition that are the mental factors.

original: gzhan yang nyams su myong ba las mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa yin gyi de dag las ni nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o / ci ste yang nyams su myong ba thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur mod
analyzed: gzhan yang nyams su myong ba las mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa yin gyi de dag las ni nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o / ci ste yang nyams su myong ba thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur mod
translated: If you say that all experience is associated with an object,

original: kho bo cag la chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: we have no fault at all.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ci ltar zhe na /üîΩ'jig rten 'jig rten min don du //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba ci ltar zhe na / 'jig rten 'jig rten min don du //
translated: How is the distinction between valid cognition and invalid cognitionüîΩestablished?üîΩOne is valid cognition for worldly or

original: tshad ma cig shos rnam par gnas //
analyzed: tshad ma cig shos rnam par gnas //
translated: transworldly purposes.

original: rnam byed de ni ci ltar shes //üîΩgnod byed cig shos dang 'brel phyir //
analyzed: rnam byed de ni ci ltar shes // gnod byed cig shos dang 'brel phyir //
translated: How is that instrument of knowledge known?üîΩBecause it is associated with the other, the invalidating cognition.

original: gang gis gnod byed cig shos dag //
analyzed: gang gis gnod byed cig shos dag //
translated: By what is the other, the invalidating cognition,üîΩknown?

original: 'jig rten cig shos nyid du gnas //
analyzed: 'jig rten cig shos nyid du gnas //
translated: It is known by the other, the worldly cognition.

original: gnod dang cig shos srid phyir na //
analyzed: gnod dang cig shos srid phyir na //
translated: Because the invalidating cognition and the other are possible,

original: thug pa med par thal par 'gyur //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal par 'gyur //
translated: the consequence of infinite regress does not follow.üîΩIf you say that the common one is worldly and the other is transworldly,

original: gal te thun mong ba ni 'jig rten pa yin la gzhan du ni cig shos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thun mong ba ni 'jig rten pa yin la gzhan du ni cig shos yin no zhe na /
translated: then we reply:

original: de ni gyi na ste 'di ltar /üîΩgang phyir mngon sum rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: de ni gyi na ste 'di ltar / gang phyir mngon sum rjes dpag gis //
translated: This is not so.üîΩBecause they are not known

original: de dag rig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag rig pa yod ma yin //
translated: By direct perception or inference.

original: mngon sum gyis rig rang nyid kyi //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig rang nyid kyi //
translated: Direct perception does not know itself;

original: rig bya gzhan la de yod min //
analyzed: rig bya gzhan la de yod min //
translated: Nor does it know another object.

original: de la snang ba 'di ni gzhan la yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la mngon sum ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de la snang ba 'di ni gzhan la yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la mngon sum ni mi 'jug go //
translated: In this regard, direct perception does not engage the question of whether this appearance is also present in other [objects].

original: rjes su dpag pas rig pa yin no zhe na /üîΩ'brel pa gzung ba med par ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rig pa yin no zhe na / 'brel pa gzung ba med par ni //
translated: If you say that it is known by inference,üîΩHow can inference arise

original: rjes dpag skye bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes dpag skye bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: Without apprehending the relation?

original: spu ldang sogs 'bras mthong phyir na //
analyzed: spu ldang sogs 'bras mthong phyir na //
translated: Because the effect, such as the bristling of the hairs, is seen,

original: rang nyid mthong la @164b rjes dpag med //
analyzed: rang nyid mthong la @164b rjes dpag med //
translated: There is no inference for one who sees himself.

original: 'bras bu du ba mthong ba las //
analyzed: 'bras bu du ba mthong ba las //
translated: From seeing the effect, such as smoke,

original: me de nyid ces rab sgrub min //
analyzed: me de nyid ces rab sgrub min //
translated: One does not ascertain that it is fire.

original: gang phyir spyi yi yul can gyi //
analyzed: gang phyir spyi yi yul can gyi //
translated: Because inference has a universal as its object,

original: rjes dpag khyad par rig pa min //
analyzed: rjes dpag khyad par rig pa min //
translated: It does not know the particulars.

original: der du tha dad phyir zhe na //
analyzed: der du tha dad phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say that it is because they are different there,

original: spu ldang ba'ang gcig nyid ci //
analyzed: spu ldang ba'ang gcig nyid ci //
translated: How is the bristling of the hairs one?

original: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa ni //
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa ni //
translated: The conception of oneness

original: shes pa las gzhan rig pa med //
analyzed: shes pa las gzhan rig pa med //
translated: Is not knowledge other than consciousness.

original: gal te gang la ngas mig gis bltas pa de nyid la /
analyzed: gal te gang la ngas mig gis bltas pa de nyid la /
translated: If it is the same as that which is seen by my eye,

original: 'dis kyang yin na zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis kyang yin na zhes bya ba'i tha snyad las gcig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is the same as that which is referred to by the expression ‚Äúthis is.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rab rib kyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rab rib kyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This is similar to the strands of hair and so on that are perceived by one with eye disease.

original: de la yang rab rib can gnyis don gcig tu mngon par zhen pas mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la yang rab rib can gnyis don gcig tu mngon par zhen pas mtshungs so //
translated: In that case, two people with eye disease would be similar in that they would both conceive the same object.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar rab rib can dmigs pa 'ga' zhig gis rig pa de ltar gzhan du yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar rab rib can dmigs pa 'ga' zhig gis rig pa de ltar gzhan du yang yin no //
translated: Moreover, just as one with eye disease perceives some objects, so would the other.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa ni thams cad kyi rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that a pot and so on is perceived by all,

original: 'di la tshad ma med do //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma med do //
translated: then it is not a valid object of knowledge.

original: rab rib can gyis bum pa la sogs pa rig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis bum pa la sogs pa rig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: A pot and so on is not perceived by one with eye disease.

original: gal te dbang po nyams pa yin pa'i phyir rig pa yin yang skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po nyams pa yin pa'i phyir rig pa yin yang skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is perceived because the sense faculty is impaired,

original: dbang po nyams pa nyid gang las shes /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa nyid gang las shes /
translated: then from what is it known that the sense faculty is impaired?

original: mi bden pa'i don rig pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don rig pa las so zhe na /
translated: It is known from the perception of an unreal object.

original: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /üîΩnyams pa yin na mi bden par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur te / nyams pa yin na mi bden par 'gyur zhing /
translated: This is the fault of mutual dependence.üîΩIf it is lost, it is not true.

original: mi bden pa yin yang nyams pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa yin yang nyams pa nyid du 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it is not true, it is established as lost.

original: des na gzhan gyis cung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis cung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not at all perceived by another.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that non-perception itself is not established,

original: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas dben pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs par bya bas dben pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba nyid 'gog pa yin no //
translated: the very perception of the nature of the perception of the absence of the perceptibility of another negates the perceptibility of another.

original: gal te gzhan gyi mngon sum ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi mngon sum ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the perception of another cannot be negated because it is not the object of that,

original: 'o na des dmigs par bya ba gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'o ngo bor ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na des dmigs par bya ba gzhan gyis dmigs par bya ba'o ngo bor ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how can that which is perceived by it be the nature of that perceived by another?

original: gal te de'i ngo bo dmigs kyi gzhan gyis dmigs pa nyid du ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo dmigs kyi gzhan gyis dmigs pa nyid du ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that its nature is perceived, but its perceptibility by another is not perceived,

original: de'i ngo bo las gzhan gzhan gyis dmigs pa ni gang zhig yin /üîΩci ste de'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo las gzhan gzhan gyis dmigs pa ni gang zhig yin / ci ste de'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: What is it that is perceived by something other than its own entity?üîΩIf you say that it is its own entity,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du ci ltar ma dmigs /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du ci ltar ma dmigs /
translated: then why is it not perceived as its own entity?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de gzhan gyis dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de gzhan gyis dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is the entity of something else, how could it be perceived by something else?

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyis dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyis dmigs par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is to be perceived be perceived by something else?üîΩIf that which is to be perceived is perceived by something else, then how could it be perceived by something else?

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin gyi don de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di gzhan gyis @165a * //üîΩdmigs pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin gyi don de nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar 'di gzhan gyis @165a * // dmigs pa yin /
translated: If it is the entity of that which is to be perceived that is perceived by something else, then how could it be perceived by something else?

original: gang zhig dmigs par bya ba nyid du dmigs pa yin la de lta na yang don ni gang gis kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs par bya ba nyid du dmigs pa yin la de lta na yang don ni gang gis kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is to be perceived is perceived by itself, but even so, no object is perceived by anyone.

original: rang rang gas dmigs par bya ba phan tshun ldog pa /
analyzed: rang rang gas dmigs par bya ba phan tshun ldog pa /
translated: That which is to be perceived by itself is perceived by itself, and that which is to be perceived by another is perceived by another.

original: 'di dag kho na rang dang gzhan dag gis dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di dag kho na rang dang gzhan dag gis dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir thun mong du dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no object whatsoever that is perceived by both itself and another, because these two are mutually exclusive.

original: dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don yang med pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid yin pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par ltar gzung ba'i rnam par yang rang rig pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don yang med pa'i phyir rang rig pa nyid yin pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par ltar gzung ba'i rnam par yang rang rig pa tsam nyid do //
translated: And because there is no object that is different from the object of observation, it is reflexive awareness itself. Therefore, just as it appears to be the apprehender, it is reflexive awareness itself that appears to be the apprehended.

original: gang zhig nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yod pa nyid yin pa bsam pa phyir rol gyi don zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: gang zhig nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yod pa nyid yin pa bsam pa phyir rol gyi don zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: There is no so-called external object that exists by the characteristic of potentiality.

original: ci ste myong ba nyid phan tshun rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir nus pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste myong ba nyid phan tshun rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir nus pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that because the experiences themselves are mutually cause and effect, the existence by the characteristic of potentiality is established ultimately,

original: de yang mi bden te /üîΩrang rig tsam gyis mngon sum la //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te / rang rig tsam gyis mngon sum la //
translated: that is not so.üîΩHow can there be

original: rjes su dpag pa ga la yod //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ga la yod //
translated: inference in reflexive awareness?

original: lkog min rnam shes mngon sum la //
analyzed: lkog min rnam shes mngon sum la //
translated: Consciousness is not hidden,

original: gang phyir rjes su dpag 'gyur min //üîΩshes gnyis gyur 'bras dngos por yang //
analyzed: gang phyir rjes su dpag 'gyur min // shes gnyis gyur 'bras dngos por yang //
translated: so it is not inferred.üîΩHow can there be

original: ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: a thing that is the effect of two consciousnesses?

original: rang tsam rig phyir de nyid kyi //
analyzed: rang tsam rig phyir de nyid kyi //
translated: Because of mere reflexive awareness,

original: myong ba gnyis su rig ma yin //
analyzed: myong ba gnyis su rig ma yin //
translated: there is no experience of duality.

original: gang tshe rgyu ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: gang tshe rgyu ni rnam par shes //
translated: When the cause is consciousness,

original: de tshe 'bras rig med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de tshe 'bras rig med pa'i phyir //
translated: At that time, the effect is not known.

original: 'bras bu rig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu rig pa med par ni //
translated: Without the effect being known,

original: de rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'dzin //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du ci ltar 'dzin //
translated: How can it be apprehended as the cause?

original: 'bras bu'i dus su'ang de med pas ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus su'ang de med pas ;
translated: Since it does not exist at the time of the effect,

original: /'bras bu nyid du ci ltar 'dzin //üîΩgal te rgyu ni rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: /'bras bu nyid du ci ltar 'dzin // gal te rgyu ni rjes dpag gis //
translated: How can it be apprehended as the effect?üîΩIf the cause is asserted to be known

original: yongs su shes par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: yongs su shes par 'dod na ni //
translated: Through inference,

original: de tshe rjes dpag gis ma shes //
analyzed: de tshe rjes dpag gis ma shes //
translated: Then, since it is not known through inference,

original: da ltar shes par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: da ltar shes par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can it be known now?

original: sngar ni mngon sum gyis shes shing //
analyzed: sngar ni mngon sum gyis shes shing //
translated: If it was previously known through direct perception

original: da ltar rjes dpag las yin na /
analyzed: da ltar rjes dpag las yin na /
translated: And now it is known through inference,

original: shes de da ltar yod min na //
analyzed: shes de da ltar yod min na //
translated: Since that knowledge does not exist now,

original: ji ltar rjes dpag las rig 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes dpag las rig 'gyur //
translated: How can it be known through inference?

original: snga ma nyid du rjes dpag na //
analyzed: snga ma nyid du rjes dpag na //
translated: If it was previously known through inference,

original: mngon sum gyis rig med phyir ro //üîΩde la rjes su dpag pa yis //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig med phyir ro // de la rjes su dpag pa yis //
translated: It is because it was not known through direct perception.üîΩIf it is known through inference

original: rig 'gyur snga nyid bla lhag med //
analyzed: rig 'gyur snga nyid bla lhag med //
translated: In the past, it is no better than nothing.

original: snga ma nyid ni yod min te //
analyzed: snga ma nyid ni yod min te //
translated: The past itself does not exist

original: mngon sum gyis ni gnod phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gnod phyir ro //
translated: Because it is undermined by direct perception.

original: de phyir snga dang phyir mar ni //
analyzed: de phyir snga dang phyir mar ni //
translated: Therefore, the past and the future

original: ji ltar bu yang myong ba med //
analyzed: ji ltar bu yang myong ba med //
translated: And how can it be experienced by another?

original: dran ba tsam zhig der yod de //
analyzed: dran ba tsam zhig der yod de //
translated: It is merely remembered as being there.

original: rang rig phyir na de tshad med //üîΩrang tsam rab tu rig pa yang //
analyzed: rang rig phyir na de tshad med // rang tsam rab tu rig pa yang //
translated: Because it is self-knowing, it is not a valid cognition.üîΩThe mere awareness of itself

original: de rang rig las mngon sum yin //üîΩde phyir gzhan gyi 'bras bur ni //
analyzed: de rang rig las mngon sum yin // de phyir gzhan gyi 'bras bur ni //
translated: Is direct perception, arising from self-knowing.üîΩTherefore, it is not the case

original: des de rig pa yod pa ma yin //
analyzed: des de rig pa yod pa ma yin //
translated: That it is known by another.

original: de phyir shes dang shes bya dag //
analyzed: de phyir shes dang shes bya dag //
translated: Therefore, the knower and the known

original: nus pa nyid du 'grub pa med //
analyzed: nus pa nyid du 'grub pa med //
translated: Are not established as having the capacity to do so.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @165b dngos po 'di //
analyzed: gzhan yang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @165b dngos po 'di //
translated: This entity of cause and effect

original: yod med nyid du rtogs pa med //
analyzed: yod med nyid du rtogs pa med //
translated: Is not understood as existent or nonexistent.

original: med pa rta yi rva nyid las //
analyzed: med pa rta yi rva nyid las //
translated: The nonexistence of the horns of a rabbit

original: rgyu nyid cung zad yod ma yin //üîΩgal te gzhan nas med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu nyid cung zad yod ma yin // gal te gzhan nas med pa'i phyir //
translated: Does not have the slightest cause.üîΩIf it is said that

original: de la rgyu mi 'dod ce na //
analyzed: de la rgyu mi 'dod ce na //
translated: Because it does not exist elsewhere, a cause is not accepted for it,

original: snga na med pa'ang 'bras mi 'gyur //
analyzed: snga na med pa'ang 'bras mi 'gyur //
translated: Then the effect would not exist prior to it,

original: de yang med nyid lan gdab dka' //
analyzed: de yang med nyid lan gdab dka' //
translated: And it would be difficult to respond to that nonexistence.

original: yod na sngon med ci ltar yin //
analyzed: yod na sngon med ci ltar yin //
translated: If it exists, how can it be non-existent prior?

original: de ni med na'ang ci ltar 'dod //üîΩmed par ri bong rva la ni //
analyzed: de ni med na'ang ci ltar 'dod // med par ri bong rva la ni //
translated: If it does not exist, how can it be accepted?üîΩThe non-existence prior to

original: snga ma med pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: snga ma med pa yod ma yin //
translated: The horns of a rabbit does not exist.

original: mthong ba sngon med yin zhe na //
analyzed: mthong ba sngon med yin zhe na //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not seen before,‚Äù

original: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then it would be mutually dependent.

original: ji srid sngon med nyid min pa //
analyzed: ji srid sngon med nyid min pa //
translated: As long as it is not non-existent before,

original: de srid dngos por 'di mi 'grub //üîΩji srid 'di dang snga na med pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa de srid du ni skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de srid dngos por 'di mi 'grub // ji srid 'di dang snga na med pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa de srid du ni skye ba ma yin la /
translated: for that long it is not established as an entity.üîΩAs long as it is not related to non-existence before, for that long it is not arisen.

original: ji srid skye ba ma yin pa de srid du yang snga na med pa nyid de ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid skye ba ma yin pa de srid du yang snga na med pa nyid de ma yin no //
translated: And as long as it is not arisen, for that long it is not non-existent before.

original: gal te 'bras bus stong ba'i rgyu nyid snga na med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bus stong ba'i rgyu nyid snga na med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe cause itself is non-existent before, empty of the effect,‚Äù

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: stong nyid de ni rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: stong nyid de ni rgyu ma yin //
translated: That emptiness is not the cause.

original: gzhan pa dag la'ang med dam ci //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag la'ang med dam ci //
translated: Or does it not exist in other things?

original: des na de dang yang 'bral pas //
analyzed: des na de dang yang 'bral pas //
translated: Therefore, since it is also devoid of that,

original: 'di ni de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur //
translated: it would be the effect of that.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni snga na med pa dang 'brel pas yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni snga na med pa dang 'brel pas yin la /
translated: Being the effect is due to being related to non-existence before.

original: snga na med pa de yang 'bras bus stong pa'i don gzhan yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa de yang 'bras bus stong pa'i don gzhan yin no //
translated: And that non-existence before is the meaning of being empty of the effect.

original: des na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan dag kyang /
analyzed: des na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa las gzhan dag kyang /
translated: Therefore, other than what is asserted as the cause,

original: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be a nature that did not exist previously.

original: de dang yang 'brel pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang yang 'brel pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po ni de'i yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of its connection with that, the entity that is the effect would be the effect of that.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no invariable concomitance with that.

original: 'di la lan brab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lan brab zin to //
translated: We have already responded to this.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzung bar bya ba ni med de /
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gzung bar bya ba ni med de /
translated: There is no such thing as a non-existent entity that is apprehended by a means of valid knowledge such as perception.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig gzung ba yin no //
translated: The nature of the cause and effect is apprehended.

original: gal te snga na med pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snga na med pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the non-existent is the nature of the cause,

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nature of the effect would be like that.

original: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na de yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na de yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the effect is dependent on another, then that would be like that.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa la ltos nas kyang ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa la ltos nas kyang ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: But why would it not be like that in dependence on what is asserted to be the cause?

original: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no such understanding.

original: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i rtogs pa tsam la su yid ches /
analyzed: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i rtogs pa tsam la su yid ches /
translated: Who would believe that mere cognition is not dependent on an object?

original: de phyir tshad yod dngos po yi //
analyzed: de phyir tshad yod dngos po yi //
translated: Therefore, the object is limited to the extent that it is the cause of cognition.

original: rang bzhin sngo sogs 'dzin 'gyur gyi //üîΩde la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin sngo sogs 'dzin 'gyur gyi // de la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa //
translated: The cognition of the nature of blue, etc.,

original: gzhan ni 'dzin pa yod ma yin //üîΩsngon po la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nyid du ni po gang gis gzung ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'dzin pa yod ma yin // sngon po la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nyid du ni po gang gis gzung ba med de /
translated: is not the cognition of anything else, such as an effect.

original: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni rtogs pa med pa'i @166a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni rtogs pa med pa'i @166a * //
translated: There is no cognition of blue, etc., as an effect, because the effect is not different from blue, etc.

original: phyir ro // snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir snga na med pa la sogs pa 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir ro // snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir snga na med pa la sogs pa 'dzin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be a cognition of non-existence prior to the effect, etc.? Direct perception does not operate on prior and subsequent entities.

original: ci ste yang yod pa nyid 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang yod pa nyid 'bras bu yin te /
translated: But if existence is the effect,

original: rgyu rnams kyi byed pa ni 'bras bu yod pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi byed pa ni 'bras bu yod pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of causes is possible only when the effect exists,

original: med na ni yul med pa'i phyir ci ltar byed pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: med na ni yul med pa'i phyir ci ltar byed pa yin zhe na ;
translated: how can there be activity if it does not exist?

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bltas mnyan de ste shes byas nas //
analyzed: bltas mnyan de ste shes byas nas //
translated: When you see and hear, you know.

original: rgyu yis 'bras bu byed dam ci //
analyzed: rgyu yis 'bras bu byed dam ci //
translated: Does the cause make the effect?

original: blun phyir rang bzhin de 'dra ba //
analyzed: blun phyir rang bzhin de 'dra ba //
translated: Because of stupidity, it is like that by nature.

original: rgyu la rag las yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu la rag las yin par 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that it depends on a cause.

original: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin yang //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin yang //
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara is the cause,

original: de ni rgyu yin sbyor byed yin //
analyzed: de ni rgyu yin sbyor byed yin //
translated: he is the cause and the one who employs.

original: gang phyir dbang po las 'das blo //
analyzed: gang phyir dbang po las 'das blo //
translated: Because the mind is beyond the senses,

original: med pa shes par mi 'dod min ;
analyzed: med pa shes par mi 'dod min ;
translated: it is not asserted that the nonexistent is known.

original: /'dir 'bras sngar yod smra ba'am ci //
analyzed: /'dir 'bras sngar yod smra ba'am ci //
translated: Here, is it said that the effect exists prior to it?

original: cig dbang phyug rgyu yin 'gyur //
analyzed: cig dbang phyug rgyu yin 'gyur //
translated: What is the cause of ƒ™≈õvara?

original: ci thams cad thams cad la yod pa zhes bya ba grangs can gyi 'dod pa la brten nas yod pa nyid mthong bar zad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci thams cad thams cad la yod pa zhes bya ba grangs can gyi 'dod pa la brten nas yod pa nyid mthong bar zad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it the case that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs assertion that ‚Äúeverything exists in everything‚Äù is merely the view that existence is seen, and it is not the case that the thing called cause and effect does not exist?

original: ci ga med pa nyid la brten nas 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug gis rgyu rnams so sor nges pa la sbyar //
analyzed: ci ga med pa nyid la brten nas 'gro ba'i rgyu dbang phyug gis rgyu rnams so sor nges pa la sbyar //
translated: Does the cause of the world, ƒ™≈õvara, who is based on nonexistence, employ the individual causes?

original: 'bras bu snga na yod na ci thams cad kyi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba 'chol bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na yod na ci thams cad kyi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gro ba 'chol bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect exists prior to it, since everything would be the object of everything, the world would be in a state of chaos.

original: dmigs par byed pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa so sor nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang gyi na ste /
translated: It is not so, because the object is determined.

original: dmigs par byed pa yang thams cad thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir so sor nges pa ci yod //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa yang thams cad thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir so sor nges pa ci yod //
translated: This is not so, because the object is not always present.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / med pa'i rgyu las 'bras skye'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang / med pa'i rgyu las 'bras skye'am /
translated: Does an effect arise from a cause that is nonexistent?

original: 'on te yod pa las 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te yod pa las 'byung 'gyur //
translated: Or does it arise from a cause that exists?üîΩIt is well established that

original: med pa'i rgyu las 'bras skye zhes //üîΩbya ba legs par gnas pa yin //
analyzed: med pa'i rgyu las 'bras skye zhes // bya ba legs par gnas pa yin //
translated: an effect arises from a cause that is nonexistent.

original: zhig nas med pa dang gtan nas med pa la khyad par ci zhig yod //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa dang gtan nas med pa la khyad par ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the difference between something that has been destroyed and something that has never existed?

original: gal te sngon yod pa myong ba'i dus na rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon yod pa myong ba'i dus na rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a cause is that which was previously nonexistent but now exists,

original: gang gi tshe yod par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyu ma yin la /
translated: then it is not a cause when it exists.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni legs par smras pa yin no //
translated: It is a cause at another time. This is well said.

original: ci ste 'di ltar yang 'gyur te //
analyzed: ci ste 'di ltar yang 'gyur te //
translated: But if it is like this,

original: med pa rgyu nyid yin 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: med pa rgyu nyid yin 'gyur gyi //
translated: then a nonexistent cause would exist.

original: gang zhig yod de rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig yod de rgyu ma yin //
translated: What exists is not a cause.

original: de dang 'di dag rnams la yang ;
analyzed: de dang 'di dag rnams la yang ;
translated: And in these and other ways,

original: / byed par srid pa mthong ba med //
analyzed: / byed par srid pa mthong ba med //
translated: the existence of an agent is not seen.

original: gal te byed pas rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te byed pas rgyu yin na //
translated: If the cause is the agent,

original: byed pa de nyid gang las 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa de nyid gang las 'gyur //
translated: from what does the agent arise?

original: byed can don las yin zhe na //
analyzed: byed can don las yin zhe na //
translated: If you say the agent is for the sake of the object,

original: der ci byed pa gzhan yod dam //üîΩgal te de la'ang byed yod dam //
analyzed: der ci byed pa gzhan yod dam // gal te de la'ang byed yod dam //
translated: is there another agent for that?

original: gal te de la'ang byed yod na //
analyzed: gal te de la'ang byed yod na //
translated: If there is an agent for that,

original: don te chod par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don te chod par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then there is an infinite regress.

original: byed pa nyid las 'bras 'byung na //
analyzed: byed pa nyid las 'bras 'byung na //
translated: If the effect arises from the agent,

original: shi yang 'bras bu skye bar @166b 'gyur //üîΩde ltar de bzhin yun ring du //
analyzed: shi yang 'bras bu skye bar @166b 'gyur // de ltar de bzhin yun ring du //
translated: then the effect would arise even from a dead person.üîΩIn that case, why would the effect not arise

original: lon yang 'bras bu cis mi skye //
analyzed: lon yang 'bras bu cis mi skye //
translated: even after a long time?

original: byed 'phreng 'di ni shin tu ring //
analyzed: byed 'phreng 'di ni shin tu ring //
translated: This chain of agents is very long.

original: de srid bar du su zhig 'tsho //
analyzed: de srid bar du su zhig 'tsho //
translated: Who would live until then?

original: de ste rang bzhin byed pa yin //
analyzed: de ste rang bzhin byed pa yin //
translated: If the agent is by nature an agent,

original: de tshe 'bras bur 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe 'bras bur 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: then the effect would arise at the time of the agent.

original: byed pa'i dus su 'bras yin na //
analyzed: byed pa'i dus su 'bras yin na //
translated: If the effect is at the time of the agent,

original: dus mtshungs par ni thal bar 'gyur //üîΩgal te rgyu yod dus su ni //
analyzed: dus mtshungs par ni thal bar 'gyur // gal te rgyu yod dus su ni //
translated: then it follows that they are simultaneous.üîΩIf you say that the effect does not exist

original: 'bras bu yod pa min zhe na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa min zhe na //
translated: at the time when the cause exists,

original: gang zhig zhig ma thag pa dag //
analyzed: gang zhig zhig ma thag pa dag //
translated: And that which has just ceased

original: de lta yin na khyad med 'gyur //üîΩde yi de ma thag byung ba //
analyzed: de lta yin na khyad med 'gyur // de yi de ma thag byung ba //
translated: In that case, there would be no difference.

original: skye ba'i dus su yod ce na //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus su yod ce na //
translated: If you say that the arising of the effectüîΩIs simultaneous with the arising of the cause,

original: skye ba 'bras bu las gzhan min //
analyzed: skye ba 'bras bu las gzhan min //
translated: Then arising would not be different from the effect.

original: des 'di dus mnyam du 'gyur //
analyzed: des 'di dus mnyam du 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, they would be simultaneous.üîΩSince this refutes the assertion

original: ci yang yin smra sun phyung bas //
analyzed: ci yang yin smra sun phyung bas //
translated: That anything is a cause,

original: phyogs gnyis la yang bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis la yang bzlog pa yin //
translated: The two positions are reversed.

original: brjod par bya ba mang 'gyur ram //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba mang 'gyur ram //
translated: Would there be many things to be said?

original: de phyir da ni 'phro bcad do //
analyzed: de phyir da ni 'phro bcad do //
translated: Therefore, I will now stop this discussion.

original: ci ste yang shes pa'i rgyu ni don yin no zhes rjes su dpag pas sngar ma rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang shes pa'i rgyu ni don yin no zhes rjes su dpag pas sngar ma rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you infer that the cause of consciousness is an object, then you would have to say that consciousness is not non-knowing.

original: de yang mi bden te /üîΩmngon sum la ni snang gyur pa //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te / mngon sum la ni snang gyur pa //
translated: But that is not correct.üîΩThat which appears to direct perception

original: rjes su dpag pas sngar rig pa'i //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas sngar rig pa'i //
translated: Is known by inference prior to that.

original: phan tshun 'dre ba med pa na //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dre ba med pa na //
translated: Since they do not mutually contact each other,

original: de yi 'bras bu ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu ji ltar rtogs //
translated: How can you know their effect?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa sngar byung bar rtogs su bcug kyang //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa sngar byung bar rtogs su bcug kyang //
translated: If you say that you are made to understand that that which is known by inference occurs prior to that which is known by direct perception,

original: de mngon sum gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gang gis rtogs par byed //
analyzed: de mngon sum gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gang gis rtogs par byed //
translated: How does one know that it is the cause of the perception?

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po ni mngon sum gyi rgyu yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference does not know that the thing seen by perception is the cause of perception.

original: nyams su myong ba nyid la ni rjes su dpag pas 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid la ni rjes su dpag pas 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does inference operate on the basis of experience itself.

original: de'i yul ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its object is hidden.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la mngon sum 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la mngon sum 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does perception operate on the basis of inference,

original: de'i yul ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its object is not hidden.

original: rtogs pas gyur pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pas gyur pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that what is understood is hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that what is understood as hidden is hidden,

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: that is not so.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rang gi ngo bo rtogs na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang gi ngo bo rtogs na ni //
translated: If its own nature is understood,

original: 'di la lkog gyur gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: 'di la lkog gyur gzhan ci yod //
translated: what else, hidden, is there here?

original: rnam pa mi gsal snang yin na //
analyzed: rnam pa mi gsal snang yin na //
translated: If it is an unclear appearance,

original: mngon sum de ltar snang mi 'dod //
analyzed: mngon sum de ltar snang mi 'dod //
translated: You do not accept that it appears in that way to perception.

original: rang bzhin gnyis ni rig pa'i tshe //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ni rig pa'i tshe //
translated: When the two natures are cognized,

original: mngon sum gnyis su 'dod pa yin ;
analyzed: mngon sum gnyis su 'dod pa yin ;
translated: then perception is held to be twofold.

original: / dper na ka sogs tshu rol dang // pha rol ngo bor rig tshul gyis //
analyzed: / dper na ka sogs tshu rol dang // pha rol ngo bor rig tshul gyis //
translated: For example, by the mode of cognizing the near side, such as a pillar,üîΩand the far side,

original: gang gi tshe don de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa //
translated: when the object has a nature that is both clear and unclear,

original: de'i tshe de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang gis rig pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang gis rig pa yin na /
translated: then at that time it is cognized by both perception and inference.

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i tshu rol dang pha rol la sogs pa gzung ba @167a * //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i tshu rol dang pha rol la sogs pa gzung ba @167a * //
translated: Just as the near side, such as a pillar, and the far side are apprehended,

original: bzhin du mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur la rag go //
analyzed: bzhin du mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur la rag go //
translated: it would have to be the nature of perception.

original: 'on te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis yin gyi don gyi rang bzhin ni sngon po nyid yin no zhe na /üîΩgal te khyad par tha dad pas //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis yin gyi don gyi rang bzhin ni sngon po nyid yin no zhe na / gal te khyad par tha dad pas //
translated: But if it is said that clarity and unclarity are due to the power of another factor, and the nature of the object is just blue,üîΩthen if the nature is cognized as different

original: rang bzhin gzhan du rig 'gyur na //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du rig 'gyur na //
translated: due to the difference in the factor,

original: rang gi rang bzhin rig med phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin rig med phyir //
translated: then because its own nature is not cognized,

original: kun tshe mngon sum nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: kun tshe mngon sum nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not be perception at all.

original: ci ste sngo sogs rig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci ste sngo sogs rig pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that it is direct perception because it perceives blue, etc.,

original: mngon sum nyid du brjod na ni //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du brjod na ni //
translated: then inference would also be direct perception,

original: rang gi rang bzhin rig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin rig pa'i phyir //
translated: because it perceives its own nature.üîΩIf you say that inference is not direct perception because it is devoid of the sense faculties,

original: rjes dpag nyid kyang mngon sum 'gyur //üîΩdbang po dang ni bral bas na //
analyzed: rjes dpag nyid kyang mngon sum 'gyur // dbang po dang ni bral bas na //
translated: then inference would not be inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties.üîΩIf you say that inference is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,

original: rjes dpag mngon sum min zhe na //üîΩdbang po dang ni ldan pas yang //
analyzed: rjes dpag mngon sum min zhe na // dbang po dang ni ldan pas yang //
translated: then how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?

original: rjes su dpag pas ces mi dpog / dbang po dang bral ba nyid kyis mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ces mi dpog / dbang po dang bral ba nyid kyis mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you say that it is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?üîΩIf you say that it is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,üîΩthen how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?

original: 'on te dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang 'du ba med do zhe na /üîΩdngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang 'du ba med do zhe na / dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you say that it is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,üîΩthen how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?üîΩIf you say that it is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,

original: med do zhe na yang rjes su dpag pas dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'dzin /
analyzed: med do zhe na yang rjes su dpag pas dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar 'dzin /
translated: then how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?üîΩIf you say that it is not inference because it is devoid of the sense faculties,

original: ci ste dbang po dang 'brel par rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dbang po dang 'brel par rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then how could it be inference, since it is devoid of the sense faculties?

original: 'dis ni 'jug par mi byed pas //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jug par mi byed pas //
translated: But since it does not engage,

original: rjes su dpog pa do ma med yin //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa do ma med yin //
translated: it is not a means of valid cognition.

original: blta min reg par bya min pa //
analyzed: blta min reg par bya min pa //
translated: It is not visible, nor is it tangible;

original: de la 'jug pa don med nyid //üîΩmkho ba don du gnyer ba rjes su dpag pa'i don la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa don med nyid // mkho ba don du gnyer ba rjes su dpag pa'i don la 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: to engage with it would be pointless.üîΩIf you say that the purpose of inference is to engage with the object of inference,

original: 'jug par byed pa yang tshad ma nyid de /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yang tshad ma nyid de /
translated: then the means of engagement is a means of valid cognition.

original: des na 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Therefore, that which does not engage

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: cannot be a means of valid cognition.

original: ci ste phyis dbang po dang 'brel par 'gyur ba rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste phyis dbang po dang 'brel par 'gyur ba rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that it is the subsequent connection with the sense faculty that is inferred,

original: des ni de'i tshe dbang po dang 'brel pa med pas mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des ni de'i tshe dbang po dang 'brel pa med pas mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then at that time, since there is no connection with the sense faculty, it is not a direct perception.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: 'brel par 'gyur ba dpog na ni //
analyzed: 'brel par 'gyur ba dpog na ni //
translated: If you infer a subsequent connection,

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas //üîΩrgyu nyid du ni mi rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pas // rgyu nyid du ni mi rtogs pa'i //
translated: since the prior nature is not understood,üîΩthe inference would be pointless,

original: rjes su dpag pa don med yin //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa don med yin //
translated: since the cause is not understood.üîΩAt that time, the object to be measured

original: de nyid tshe na gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed ngo bor yod ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid tshe na gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed ngo bor yod ma yin //
translated: and the measuring instrument do not exist as entities.

original: de tshe nyid kyi gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed da ltar byung bar brjod //
analyzed: de tshe nyid kyi gzhal bya dang // 'jal byed da ltar byung bar brjod //
translated: At that time, the object of the cognition and the cognition itself are said to be present.

original: de'i tshe rang gi ngo bor snang ba las gzhan da ltar byung ba nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi ngo bor snang ba las gzhan da ltar byung ba nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: At that time, the present is not something other than the appearance of its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang ba nyid da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: The appearance of its own nature is the present.

original: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang bas da ltar byung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang bas da ltar byung ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not present because it appears as the nature of the past, etc.,

original: @167b rjes su dpag pas 'das pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: @167b rjes su dpag pas 'das pa'i rang bzhin nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
translated: how can you infer that it has the nature of the past by means of inference?

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis sum gyis ma rtogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //üîΩmngon sum yang 'das pa'i rang bzhin la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis sum gyis ma rtogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no // mngon sum yang 'das pa'i rang bzhin la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference does not operate in regard to that which is not perceived by direct perception.üîΩDirect perception does not operate in regard to the nature of the past.

original: gang gi tshe de mngon sum gyis mthong ba de'i tshe ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de mngon sum gyis mthong ba de'i tshe ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med do //
translated: When it is seen by direct perception, it is not perceived as having the nature of the past.

original: gal te da ltar 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is present, having the nature of the past,

original: 'o na ni de gzhan nyid skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni de gzhan nyid skyes pa yin la /
translated: then it is produced as something else.

original: de la yang mngon sum med pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog gang yang phyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i skabs med par mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la yang mngon sum med pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog gang yang phyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid du mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpag pa'i skabs med par mtshungs so //
translated: Since it does not exist in the present, how can it be inferred? And if it is later perceived, it is not the nature of the element, since it is not perceived. Therefore, it is the same as the other, in that it cannot be inferred.

original: gal te 'di ci khyed la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: gal te 'di ci khyed la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam //
translated: But is it not the same for you?

original: gzhan la yang mngon sum las de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i rnam par snang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la yang mngon sum las de ltar rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i rnam par snang zhe na /
translated: And how can it appear in that way, since it is not understood in that way from perception?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not the same.

original: de ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis de ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis de ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: It appears in that way due to the power of latent potentialities.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: des na / don la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: des na / don la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on the object,

original: de yi ngo bo rjes byed phyir //üîΩde ni cha 'ga' zhig gis ni //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo rjes byed phyir // de ni cha 'ga' zhig gis ni //
translated: because it is the nature of the object,üîΩit is different from the other

original: gzhan las kyang ni tha dad 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ni tha dad 'gyur // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: in part, in part.

original: des na shes pa de ni rgyud nas don las skyes pa yin la //
analyzed: des na shes pa de ni rgyud nas don las skyes pa yin la //
translated: Therefore, that consciousness is indirectly produced from the object.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pas ni rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba yin te /
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pas ni rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba yin te /
translated: And because of the connection with the latent impressions, it appears in another form.

original: dper na rab rib la sogs pas zla ba gnyis la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib la sogs pas zla ba gnyis la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of two moons and so on due to eye disease and so on.

original: des na 'das pa'i dus nyid kyi rang bzhin las 'ongs pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid du zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'das pa'i dus nyid kyi rang bzhin las 'ongs pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid du zhen pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it comes from the nature of the past itself, it is conceived as past.

original: des na 'das pa'i dus nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid yin zhing de yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'das pa'i dus nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid yin zhing de yang med pa yin no //
translated: And because it grasps the past itself, it is past, and that does not exist.

original: de ni da ltar ba nyid la ni tshad ma ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ni da ltar ba nyid la ni tshad ma ma yin no ;
translated: It is not a valid cognition of the present itself.

original: /'on na de ji ltar 'thob //
analyzed: /'on na de ji ltar 'thob //
translated: But how is it obtained?

original: yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists.

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid yin //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid yin //
translated: How does it exist?

original: mthong ba'i rtags des rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rtags des rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established by the sign of seeing.

original: de'i sgo nas shes pa yang der 'jug par byed pa yin pas tha snyad rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas shes pa yang der 'jug par byed pa yin pas tha snyad rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: And because it causes the cognition to engage with that, the convention is complete.

original: gal te shes pas don ma rtogs na ji ltar 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te shes pas don ma rtogs na ji ltar 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na ;
translated: If the object is not cognized by the cognition, how does it cause engagement?

original: ma 'khrul ba nyid las so //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba nyid las so //
translated: From non-error itself.

original: gal te du ba 'ba' zhig kyang rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro zhen //
analyzed: gal te du ba 'ba' zhig kyang rnam par 'jog par byed par 'gyur ro zhen //
translated: If it is argued that the mere presence of smoke is what establishes the fire,

original: ji ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin par mthong ba de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas klan ka med do //üîΩgzhan yang // shes pa de ni rang bzhin dang // 'brel @168a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin par mthong ba de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pas klan ka med do // gzhan yang // shes pa de ni rang bzhin dang // 'brel @168a * //
translated: then we reply that the mere presence of smoke is what establishes the mere presence of fire, but not that it is hot.üîΩBut if it is argued that the mere presence of smoke is what establishes the mere presence of fire, then we reply that the mere presence of fire is what establishes the mere presence of smoke.üîΩMoreover,üîΩthat cognition is not a different kind of engagement

original: phyir 'jug byed gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: phyir 'jug byed gzhan ma yin //
translated: because of its intrinsic nature and its connection.

original: de la don du zhen pa ni //
analyzed: de la don du zhen pa ni //
translated: The attachment to the object

original: nges par bag chags stobs kyis yin //
analyzed: nges par bag chags stobs kyis yin //
translated: is certainly due to the power of the latent impressions.

original: de'i phyir snga ma nyid du rtogs pa de ni da lta yod pa yin no zhes bya bar ni shes pa des mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma nyid du rtogs pa de ni da lta yod pa yin no zhes bya bar ni shes pa des mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the past does not cognize that the object exists in the present.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig da ltar yod pa de mi mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig da ltar yod pa de mi mthong ba nyid do //
translated: That intrinsic nature which exists in the present is not seen.

original: des na mi mthong ba nyid ni lkog tu 'gyur ba yin la de ni lkog tu gyur to zhes //
analyzed: des na mi mthong ba nyid ni lkog tu 'gyur ba yin la de ni lkog tu gyur to zhes //
translated: Thus, the non-seeing itself is hidden, and that is said to be hidden.

original: rtogs pa med pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The very non-cognition is cognized as hidden.

original: lkog gyur don gyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: lkog gyur don gyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: If it is the nature of the hidden object,

original: yin na de ni mngon sum nyid //üîΩde la rjes dpag 'jug min zhing //
analyzed: yin na de ni mngon sum nyid // de la rjes dpag 'jug min zhing //
translated: then it is perception itself.üîΩInference does not operate there,

original: the tshom 'brel pa'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: the tshom 'brel pa'ang yod ma yin //
translated: nor is there any connection with doubt.

original: zhig na rnam pa de lta bu'i ;
analyzed: zhig na rnam pa de lta bu'i ;
translated: When it is destroyed,

original: / shes pa de la 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: / shes pa de la 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: such a cognition does not arise.

original: shes don dag kyang gcig nyid min //
analyzed: shes don dag kyang gcig nyid min //
translated: The object of cognition is also not one,

original: de phyir don de yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir don de yod ma yin //
translated: therefore that object does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gal te rjes su dpag pa don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin na mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin par 'gyur bas mngon sum gyi don nyid rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur la //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rjes su dpag pa don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin na mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin par 'gyur bas mngon sum gyi don nyid rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur la //
translated: Therefore, if inference has the nature of apprehending an object, then even what is connected to the eye and so on would be what is to be inferred, so the object of perception itself would become what is to be inferred.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //üîΩdes na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no // des na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.üîΩTherefore, cognition with a hidden object does not have the nature of apprehending an object.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rgyu'i dngos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rgyu'i dngos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is realized by inference is not the actual cause.

original: de'i phyir na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the entity of cause and effect does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: gal te thams cad nus med na //
analyzed: gal te thams cad nus med na //
translated: if everything is without causal efficacy,

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: this is stated.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni //üîΩsa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni // sa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
translated: The explanation of this is:üîΩThe capacity of seeds, etc.

original: nus mthong zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nus mthong zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: with regard to sprouts, etc. is seen.

original: 'di ltar sa bon las ni myu gu skye ba mthong zhes rnam par dbye ba med par 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon las ni myu gu skye ba mthong zhes rnam par dbye ba med par 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa yin //
translated: Thus, the worldly understanding is that a sprout arises from a seed, without any analysis.

original: de nyid phyir na mthong ba yin //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na mthong ba yin //
translated: For this very reason, it is seen.

original: gang la 'di ni bdag gis mthong ba'o snyam du rtogs pa de nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'di ni bdag gis mthong ba'o snyam du rtogs pa de nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That very understanding is seen, thinking, ‚ÄúI see this.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di bdag gis mthong ngo zhes lhag par mos pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di bdag gis mthong ngo zhes lhag par mos pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: There is also the conviction, ‚ÄúI see this entity of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: des na gnod pa med pa'i lhag par mos pa srid pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur bar dgos par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod pa med pa'i lhag par mos pa srid pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur bar dgos par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because unimpaired conviction is possible, it is not necessary to make it otherwise.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / dngos ; di bdag gis dran snyam las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos ; di bdag gis dran snyam las //
translated: I remember this entity.

original: mos pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod min //
analyzed: mos pa'i rnam pa gzhan yod min //
translated: There is no other form of belief.üîΩAnd there is no realization

original: dran pa dngos dang 'brel par ni //üîΩrtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dngos dang 'brel par ni // rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: that is connected with the actual memory.

original: re zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, there is no realization through perception,

original: dran pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because memory is not perception.

original: rang rig pas ni dran pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam mngon @168b du byed pa yin gyi //
analyzed: rang rig pas ni dran pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam mngon @168b du byed pa yin gyi //
translated: Through reflexive awareness, only the nature of memory itself is perceived,

original: dngos po dang 'brel par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not its connection with an object.

original: sngar gyi mngon sum yang dran pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi mngon sum yang dran pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: And the previous perception is not remembered,

original: des na gang las 'brel par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na gang las 'brel par 'gyur //
translated: so how could there be a connection between them?

original: 'di bdag gis dran no snyam pa'i shes pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di bdag gis dran no snyam pa'i shes pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: There is also the thought, ‚ÄúI remember this,‚Äù which is not a different consciousness.

original: de'i phyir lhag par mos pa nyid thams cad du rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi sgrub byed yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag par mos pa nyid thams cad du rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi sgrub byed yin no //
translated: Therefore, belief is the proof for all the presentations.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that as conventional,

original: bsam pa ni //
analyzed: bsam pa ni //
translated: then the thought

original: dngos po'i de kho na rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma med na /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na rnam par 'jog pa'i tshad ma med na /
translated: is that if there is no valid cognition that determines the thatness of things,üîΩthen there is no way to posit the two truths.

original: thog ma med pa'i tha snyad goms pa las byung ba'i lhag par mos pa tsam gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kho na'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i tha snyad goms pa las byung ba'i lhag par mos pa tsam gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kho na'o //
translated: That which is merely a special belief arising from the habit of the convention of beginningless [samsara] is only the superficial.

original: kun rdzob kyi don ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi don ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i yin no //
translated: The meaning of the superficial is that which is pleasing when not investigated.

original: dper na lha sbyin la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ma mthong yang mthong bar rlom pa de ni rnam par dpyad pas ldog pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin la sogs pa 'ga' zhig ma mthong yang mthong bar rlom pa de ni rnam par dpyad pas ldog pa de bzhin du //
translated: For example, although one does not see Devadatta and so on, one assumes that one sees them. That is reversed by analysis.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'di don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then this is not the ultimate.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad kyang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad kyang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because all worldly conventions are just like that,

original: thams cad kun rdzob tsam yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kun rdzob tsam yin no //
translated: everything is only the superficial.

original: tshad ma med par rtogs par rlob pa tsan ni kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med par rtogs par rlob pa tsan ni kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere assumption of understanding without valid cognition is the superficial.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa ni //
translated: The understanding of cause and effect

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las yin //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las yin //
translated: is from positive and negative concomitance.

original: mngon sum de bzhin rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: mngon sum de bzhin rjes dpag gis //
translated: Direct perception and inference

original: tshad ma de la yod ma yin //
analyzed: tshad ma de la yod ma yin //
translated: are not valid cognitions in that [superficial].

original: mngon sum mi dmigs pa dag las //
analyzed: mngon sum mi dmigs pa dag las //
translated: From direct perception and non-perception

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa rtogs pa gang //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa rtogs pa gang //
translated: What is the realization of the forward and reverse sequences?

original: gal te rjes dpag las yin na //
analyzed: gal te rjes dpag las yin na //
translated: If it is from inference,

original: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: there would be mutual dependence.üîΩInference is not a means of valid knowledge, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mngon dum 'ba' zhig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin par brjod do zhe na /üîΩde ni ma 'brel ba ste /üîΩphan tshun rten pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mngon dum 'ba' zhig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa yin par brjod do zhe na / de ni ma 'brel ba ste / phan tshun rten pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no /üîΩ'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu rnam pa ni mngon sum gyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no / 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu rnam pa ni mngon sum gyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.

original: gnyis 'dzin pa tsam gyi bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di'i de ma thag tu mthong ba 'di ni 'di las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis 'dzin pa tsam gyi bya ba can yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di'i de ma thag tu mthong ba 'di ni 'di las byung ba yin no //
