translated: It is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon sum yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon sum yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the nature of things.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the nature of things, because it is not a means of knowing the

original: 'di ltar 'di nyid las 'byung ba'am 'di las 'byung ba nyid dam //üîΩ'di las kyang 'byung ba zhes 'di tsam zhig 'dir rnam par brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di nyid las 'byung ba'am 'di las 'byung ba nyid dam // 'di las kyang 'byung ba zhes 'di tsam zhig 'dir rnam par brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: In this case, the meaning of the expression ‚Äúarising from itself‚Äù is to be analyzed as follows:
‚Äúarising from this very thing‚Äù or ‚Äúarising from this‚Äù or ‚Äúarising from this itself.‚Äù

original: gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for there to be another object.

original: gal te 'di nyid las 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid las 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na ni //
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúarising from itself‚Äù is that it arises from this very thing,

original: shugs kyis gzhan las mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis gzhan las mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then the meaning of this expression is that it does not arise from another.

original: de la yang rnam par rtogs pa gnyis te //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par rtogs pa gnyis te //
translated: In this case, there are two possibilities:

original: de'i tshe'am 'on te gzhan gyi tshe yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe'am 'on te gzhan gyi tshe yin //
translated: either it arises at that time or it arises at another time.

original: gal te de'i tshe 'di nyid las yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe 'di nyid las yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that it arises at that time,

original: 'on ni gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on ni gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that it arises from another at another time.

original: da ltar yang yul gzhan du gzhan las mi 'byung ngo zhes gang las yin //
analyzed: da ltar yang yul gzhan du gzhan las mi 'byung ngo zhes gang las yin //
translated: But how do you know that it does not arise from another at another place?

original: de lta bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: This is not the relation of cause and effect,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty.

original: 'di las 'byung ba nyid do zhes nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las 'byung ba nyid do zhes nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it is definitely the case that something arises from this,

original: dus gzhan du res 'ga' mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du res 'ga' mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes it does not arise at another time.

original: des na mngon sum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, cause and effect are not understood by perception.

original: 'di las kyang 'byung la gzhan las kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba phyogs 'di la ni rang nyid kho nas 'khrul pas khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'byung la gzhan las kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba phyogs 'di la ni rang nyid kho nas 'khrul pas khas blangs pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, since error is committed by the opponent himself, the position that something arises from this and also arises from another is not a cause and effect.

original: des na phyogs 'di yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs 'di yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this position is not tenable.

original: ci ste de med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes mi dmigs pa la rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes mi dmigs pa la rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is understood from nonapprehension, because it does not exist if that does not exist,

original: de ltar gyur na yang gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa yod do //
translated: then even if that were so, the error of mutual dependence would exist.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gcig mi dmigs pa mngon sum las //üîΩgzhan nam de bzhin gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig mi dmigs pa mngon sum las // gzhan nam de bzhin gzhan ma yin //
translated: From the nonapprehension of one thing,üîΩanother is apprehended, or not, by perception.

original: mngon sum las ni gzhan min na //
analyzed: mngon sum las ni gzhan min na //
translated: If it is not different from perception,

original: ming tsam sgrub byed yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: ming tsam sgrub byed yin par 'gyur //
translated: would be a mere nominal proof.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid du ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid du ni //
translated: If it were inference itself,

original: rtogs pa 'jug pa med 'gyur te //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'jug pa med 'gyur te //
translated: then the operation of cognition would be impossible,

original: gang phyir rjes 'gro ldog pa yis //
analyzed: gang phyir rjes 'gro ldog pa yis //
translated: because of the concomitance and the reverse concomitance,

original: 'brel la rjes su dpog phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel la rjes su dpog phyir ro //
translated: since the inference is from the connection.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa mngon sum nyid yin na ni mngon sum la brjod pa'i skyon de nyid do //
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa mngon sum nyid yin na ni mngon sum la brjod pa'i skyon de nyid do //
translated: If non-apprehension is perception itself, then the fault already mentioned in regard to perception applies.

original: de ste rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ste rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: If it is inference,

original: de'i 'brel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las 'jug pa yin te /
translated: then its connection is with the concomitance and the reverse concomitance.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'dzin ba dang ldog ba 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'dzin ba dang ldog ba 'dzin pa med la /
translated: Therefore, if there is no inference, there is no apprehension of the concomitance and the reverse concomitance.

original: de med na yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And if that is absent, then the inference does not operate.

original: rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the inference would be endless.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas de med na med par 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas de med na med par 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the non-existence is apprehended by the valid cognition of the non-existence of a thing, then it is apprehended as non-existent.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is also not tenable.

original: de las kyang //
analyzed: de las kyang //
translated: For, from that,

original: yul dang dus nye ba can dag gis dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus nye ba can dag gis dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are close in time and place to the non-existent thing will understand it.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni dpyod pa'i tshad mas rtogs @169b par bya ba yin no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni dpyod pa'i tshad mas rtogs @169b par bya ba yin no zhes smra ste /
translated: Others say: The nature of cause and effect is to be understood by the valid cognition of investigation.

original: 'brel pa mthong ba med par lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba med par lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The definition of investigation is: the understanding of something hidden without seeing a connection.

original: 'di ltar me dang du ba dag gis nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni de yod na yod par dmigs pa las yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar me dang du ba dag gis nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni de yod na yod par dmigs pa las yin na /
translated: Thus, the nature of cause and effect is understood from the observation of existence when one exists, by the definite characteristics of fire and smoke.

original: de yod na yod pa de dang rgyu dang bras bu 'brel par ni dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa de dang rgyu dang bras bu 'brel par ni dmigs pa med do //
translated: But the observation of the connection between cause and effect when one exists is not observed.

original: gang gi phyir de las 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it arises from that, therefore the world understands that this is its effect.

original: des na de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa ni dpyod pas yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa ni dpyod pas yin no //
translated: Thus, the understanding of its effect is by investigation.

original: yang na don gyis go bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is understood by implication, and so it is understood to be the result of that.üîΩIf it is not the result of that, then it is not tenable that it arises from that.

original: gal te 'di de'i 'bras bu ma yin na ni de las 'byung ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di de'i 'bras bu ma yin na ni de las 'byung ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, understanding a meaning that is not seen is understanding by implication.

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu yin //
translated: If it is the result of a cause,

original: rtogs pa'ang mthong ba yod na ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa'ang mthong ba yod na ni //
translated: then understanding would exist if seeing existed.

original: dpyod pa'ang don gyis go ba las //
analyzed: dpyod pa'ang don gyis go ba las //
translated: Also, analysis would be understanding by implication.

original: rtogs so zhes ni mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtogs so zhes ni mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: But it would be seen that understanding arises from that.

original: de las 'byung ba ma rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba ma rtogs pa'i //
translated: But without understanding that it arises from that,

original: rgyu 'bras nyid ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras nyid ni mthong ba med //
translated: the state of being a cause and result is not seen.

original: de la'ang skyon ni sngar brjod do //
analyzed: de la'ang skyon ni sngar brjod do //
translated: The error in that has been stated previously.

original: nges par 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i yul srid ni //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i yul srid ni //
translated: If it is possible that the object of understanding is the state of being a cause and result,

original: dpyod pa'am gzhan las de rtogs par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: dpyod pa'am gzhan las de rtogs par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: then it would be understood through analysis or from another.

original: de ni de las yod pa las rang bzhin gzhan brtson pa dang ldan pas kyang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de ni de las yod pa las rang bzhin gzhan brtson pa dang ldan pas kyang rtogs pa med do //
translated: But it is not perceived by one who is diligent in seeking out the nature of that which is other than that.

original: nges par de las 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar ni gang las kyang rtogs pa med de //
analyzed: nges par de las 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar ni gang las kyang rtogs pa med de //
translated: And it is not perceived from anywhere that it definitely arises from that.

original: dus de srid tsam zhig de las 'byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de srid tsam zhig de las 'byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is perceived that it arises from that for just that long.

original: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin no //üîΩgal te nges pa ni dpyod pa'am //
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin no // gal te nges pa ni dpyod pa'am //
translated: And it is not the case that it is the state of being a cause and effect.üîΩIf it is ascertained by analysis,

original: don gyis go ba las rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba las rtogs pa yin te /
translated: or by implication,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i de ma thag par dmigs pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi tshe yang 'di ni de nyid las yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de'i de ma thag par dmigs pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi tshe yang 'di ni de nyid las yin te /
translated: then it is perceived that it is that immediately after it is perceived in that way, and therefore at another time it is also from that itself.

original: de lta ma yin na de nyid kyi tshe yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de nyid kyi tshe yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be at that time either.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is also not tenable.

original: gal te ltar de las dmigs su chug kyang gzhan gyi tshe yang yin no zhes bya bar ga las yin te /
analyzed: gal te ltar de las dmigs su chug kyang gzhan gyi tshe yang yin no zhes bya bar ga las yin te /
translated: Even if it were perceived from that in that way, how could it be that it is also at another time?

original: de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is perceived in just that way.

original: 'o na bum pa yang snam bu'i de ma thag tu dmigs pa de'i phyir de la yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na bum pa yang snam bu'i de ma thag tu dmigs pa de'i phyir de la yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then, since a pot is perceived immediately after a cloth, the same would hold for a pot.

original: de la ni 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni 'di nyid kyis de la yang yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na / 'o na ni 'di nyid kyis de la yang yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But the pot is perceived in error, since it is not the cause of the visual consciousness.

original: @170a * // yid mi ches pa'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩring po mthong ba ma yin pa rnams kyi de ni yang nas yang du mthong ba las yin no //
analyzed: @170a * // yid mi ches pa'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na / ring po mthong ba ma yin pa rnams kyi de ni yang nas yang du mthong ba las yin no //
translated: But then, since it is perceived in error, it cannot be a cause.üîΩBut the pot is not perceived in error, since it is perceived as it is.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na /üîΩnus pa kun rdzob tu rtogs zhes //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni de lta bu nyid yin no zhe na / nus pa kun rdzob tu rtogs zhes //
translated: But the pot is not perceived as it is, since it is not perceived as impermanent.

original: bya ba de nyid 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: bya ba de nyid 'ongs pa yin //
translated: The pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.

original: de nyid don ni ma brtags pas //üîΩrtogs pa kun rdzob yin par 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid don ni ma brtags pas // rtogs pa kun rdzob yin par 'dod //
translated: But the pot is not perceived as it is, since it is perceived as permanent.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.

original: ci ste dus gzhan du de'i 'bras bu de ni 'di nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pa las snga ma nyid 'bras bur rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste dus gzhan du de'i 'bras bu de ni 'di nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pa las snga ma nyid 'bras bur rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The pot is perceived as it is, since it is perceived as a pot.üîΩThe pot is perceived as it

original: de lta ma yin na ngo shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ngo shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be a recognition.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: ngo shes sngar gyi mthong ba dang // 'brel pa 'di ni gang du mthong //
analyzed: ngo shes sngar gyi mthong ba dang // 'brel pa 'di ni gang du mthong //
translated: Where is the connection between the recognition and the previous seeing?

original: dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba las //
analyzed: dpyod pa'am don gyis go ba las //
translated: If you say it is from the analysis or the understanding of the meaning,

original: zhe na sngar 'di sun phyung zin //
analyzed: zhe na sngar 'di sun phyung zin //
translated: we have already refuted that.

original: ci ste dran pa las yin te //
analyzed: ci ste dran pa las yin te //
translated: If you say it is from memory,üîΩit is like this:

original: 'di ltar / kho bo sa mthong ba de nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kho bo sa mthong ba de nyid ni //
translated: I remember that I saw that.

original: dran zhes de ltar rtogs phyir ro / dran pa'am nyams su myong ba dang // 'brel pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran zhes de ltar rtogs phyir ro / dran pa'am nyams su myong ba dang // 'brel pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not asserted that there is a connection between memory and experience.

original: dran pa ni chad ma ma yin pas de grub pa ni kun rdzob tu grub pa yin zhes /üîΩde ltar dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dran pa ni chad ma ma yin pas de grub pa ni kun rdzob tu grub pa yin zhes / de ltar dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Since memory is not a direct perception, its establishment is established conventionally.

original: gal te de kun rdzob /üîΩ'dod na ci lta de ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te de kun rdzob / 'dod na ci lta de ltar 'gyur //
translated: Fearing that this might be thought,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said:üîΩIf you assert that it is conventional,üîΩit is just as we have said.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'khrugs pa med pa ni de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'khrugs pa med pa ni de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: The conventional usage of the world is not disturbed in this way.

original: don dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la nye bar sbyar ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la nye bar sbyar ba ma yin te /
translated: The ultimate is not applied to the conventional usage of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la skur bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la skur bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a denial of worldly convention.

original: mos pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyis nges pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyis nges pa grub pa yin te /
translated: The establishment of the truth of the conventional is by mere assent,

original: rmi lam gyi tha snyad nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tha snyad nges pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the assent to the convention of a dream.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu ni thog ma med pa nges pa'i bag chags 'ba' zhig lus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu ni thog ma med pa nges pa'i bag chags 'ba' zhig lus pa yin te /
translated: The cause of worldly convention is the mere residue of the beginningless latent impressions of error.

original: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byed pa thams cad mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par byed pa thams cad mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, all the differentiations of cognition, whether with an object or without an object, would be impossible.

original: yang gang dag kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhing /
analyzed: yang gang dag kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhing /
translated: Now, what is this so-called conventional?

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang gang yin /üîΩbden na kun rdzob de ji ltar //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa yang gang yin / bden na kun rdzob de ji ltar //
translated: What is the truth of the conventional?üîΩIf it is true, how can it be a falsehood?

original: log pa yin na bden gang lags //üîΩbrdzun don dam pa'i don dag la //
analyzed: log pa yin na bden gang lags // brdzun don dam pa'i don dag la //
translated: If it is false, how can it be a truth?

original: bden nyid thun mong yod ma yin //
analyzed: bden nyid thun mong yod ma yin //
translated: The meaning of the ultimate is not the meaning of the false,üîΩnor is the meaning of the false the meaning of the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob kyang yin la bden pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyang yin la bden pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: It is contradictory to say that something is both the conventional and the truth.

original: de la brjod pa //
analyzed: de la brjod pa //
translated: To this, we reply:

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas mos pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas mos pa tsam yin no //
translated: What is called ‚Äúconventional‚Äù is a mere belief based on a conceptual cognition that arises from beginningless predispositions.

original: des na don ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags @170b kyi stobs las byung ba 'ba' zhig snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na don ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags @170b kyi stobs las byung ba 'ba' zhig snang ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that only what arises from the power of beginningless predispositions appears.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni rmi lam snang ba bzhin du bden pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni rmi lam snang ba bzhin du bden pa ma yin la /
translated: Blue and so on are not real, like appearances in a dream.

original: rnam par shes pa yang de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang de las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not different from them.

original: des na de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not reality.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad chad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the conventional reality of the world repudiated.

original: des na nye bar mkho bas na bden ba yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar mkho bas na bden ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is true because it is necessary.

original: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in calling it ‚Äúconventional truth.‚Äù

original: des na don dam par na bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don dam par na bdag nyid thams cad dben pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate truth, all selves are void.

original: phyir rol gyi don dang ni shes pa lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa med kyi //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi don dang ni shes pa lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa med kyi //
translated: There is no apprehension of external objects and consciousness as coexistent and successive.

original: 'on kyang bag chags nyid kyi rgyu yin par rmi lam gyi snang ba rtogs pa yin pas //
analyzed: 'on kyang bag chags nyid kyi rgyu yin par rmi lam gyi snang ba rtogs pa yin pas //
translated: However, the cause is the latent impressions themselves, as is the case with the appearance in a dream.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it would be the same for you.

original: de'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have that nature.

original: yang na skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: yang na skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kun rdzob yin te /
translated: Or else, arising, etc., themselves are the superficial reality,

original: tshad mas yongs su bcad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su bcad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not ascertained by a valid cognition.

original: de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa ni tshad mas yongs su ma bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun rdzob tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa ni tshad mas yongs su ma bcad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, what is called ‚Äúarising superficially‚Äù means that arising, etc., are not ascertained by a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: ci ste kun rdzob ces bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad den pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa yin la //
analyzed: ci ste kun rdzob ces bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad den pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa yin la //
translated: But if you say that the so-called superficial is powerless because it is all false,

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa yin pas 'di ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa yin pas 'di ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi bden te /
translated: and that arising is powerful, this is contradictory. This is not a good argument.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni don dam par nus pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni don dam par nus pa med pa yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù means that which is powerless with respect to the ultimate.

original: de ltar ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case with arising.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang bral ba'i phyir grags pa tsam du nus pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang bral ba'i phyir grags pa tsam du nus pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù means that which is powerless, because it is merely renowned, since it is devoid of valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni skye ba yin pa kho na'o /
analyzed: de ltar ni skye ba yin pa kho na'o /
translated: But that is precisely what arising is.

original: skye ba skye'o zhes bya ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba skye'o zhes bya ba'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the error of ‚Äúarising arising‚Äù does not occur,

original: rang bzhin gang gi skyes pa de kho nas nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gi skyes pa de kho nas nus pa yin no //
translated: because that very nature which has arisen is powerful.

original: gang gi rang bzhin du skyes she na /
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin du skyes she na /
translated: With respect to what nature does it arise?

original: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It arises with respect to the conventional, not with respect to the ultimate.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob ming tsam byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob ming tsam byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the conventional is not merely a name, because it is powerless.

original: tshad mas rtogs pa la de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa la de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not the case, because it is expressed in that way with respect to what is realized by valid cognition.

original: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba de la //
analyzed: gang yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba de la //
translated: And with respect to what you said earlier, namely, ‚ÄúThe cause and effect are the same,‚Äù

original: rgyu las ni 'bras bu skad cig gnyis pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'byin pa de yang mi bden te /üîΩ'das pa nyid du ni 'das nas yun ting du lon pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu las ni 'bras bu skad cig gnyis pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'byin pa de yang mi bden te / 'das pa nyid du ni 'das nas yun ting du lon pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause does not give rise to the effect in the second instant, because the past is not different from the distant past.üîΩThe distant past does not exist at the time of arising.

original: 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni skye ba'i dus na med pa'i phyir la //üîΩ'das ma thag pa ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro @171a * //
analyzed: 'das nas yun ring du lon pa ni skye ba'i dus na med pa'i phyir la // 'das ma thag pa ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro @171a * //
translated: The immediately past does not exist at the time of arising.

original: zhe na ; skye ba'i dus te gang yin /
analyzed: zhe na ; skye ba'i dus te gang yin /
translated: What is the time of arising?

original: gal te 'byung ba'i dus yin na ni de'i tshe 'byung ba 'byung ba po las tha mi dad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mtshungs pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i dus yin na ni de'i tshe 'byung ba 'byung ba po las tha mi dad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mtshungs pa de nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the time of origination, then at that time origination is not different from the originator, so cause and effect are simultaneous.

original: 'on te 'byin pa'i dus na yod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byin pa'i dus na yod pa yin na /
translated: But if it exists at the time of giving rise,

original: 'byin pa de ni 'byin par byed pa po'i byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byin pa de ni 'byin par byed pa po'i byed pa yin te /
translated: then that giving rise is the activity of the originator.

original: des na 'byin par byed pa'i dus zhes byas pa de'i tshe rgyu'i dus na yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'byin par byed pa'i dus zhes byas pa de'i tshe rgyu'i dus na yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, at the time of giving rise, it is called existing at the time of the cause.

original: de'i phyir chod pa yang rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chod pa yang rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the object of the act would be the cause.

original: de yang rang gi dus na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi dus na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that exists at the time of the act.

original: skad cig gis dngos po thams cad kyang de'i tshe yod pas rgyur thal bas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gis dngos po thams cad kyang de'i tshe yod pas rgyur thal bas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since all things exist at that time, it follows that they are the cause.

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But they are not the cause because they are of a different continuum.

original: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin na rgyud tha dad pa yin yang /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa nyid yin na rgyud tha dad pa yin yang /
translated: If they are not the cause, they are of a different continuum.

original: rgyud tha dad pa nyid yin na yang rgyu ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa nyid yin na yang rgyu ma yin pa yin no //
translated: If they are of a different continuum, they are not the cause.

original: rgyu yang yin la rgyud tha dad pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu yang yin la rgyud tha dad pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that they are the cause and they are of a different continuum.

original: ma brtags pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhes gang bshad pa yang /
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhes gang bshad pa yang /
translated: And it was explained that the meaning of conventional is the meaning of the unexamined.

original: brtags pa ni tshad ma la brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa ni tshad ma la brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But examination is said to be valid knowledge, not a conceptual consciousness.

original: des na tshad ma grags pa'i don yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na tshad ma grags pa'i don yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of conventional is the meaning of what is renowned to valid knowledge.

original: sgyu ma'i don yang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don yang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the meaning of ‚Äúillusion.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the meaning of ‚Äúwhat is accepted in the world,‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yin te des na skyon med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba yin te des na skyon med do //
translated: what is accepted in the world is what is delightful when not investigated. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: bstan bcos byed pa'i grags pa ni tha snyad du byed pa ma yin pas de ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa'i grags pa ni tha snyad du byed pa ma yin pas de ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: But what is accepted in treatises is not what is accepted conventionally, and so it is not accepted here.

original: 'di skad du yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad du yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this way, it is said that ‚Äúwhat is conventional truth?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is whatever is accepted in the world.‚Äù

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang kun rdzob kho na ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang kun rdzob kho na ste /
translated: The distinction between valid cognition and invalid cognition is also conventional,

original: 'di ltar tshad ma ni slu ba med pa can yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma ni slu ba med pa can yin la /
translated: because valid cognition is nondeceptive.

original: mi slu ba yang nye bar bstan pa'i don thob pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slu ba yang nye bar bstan pa'i don thob pa yin no //
translated: And nondeceptive means obtaining the object that is presented.

original: thob pa yang nyams su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: thob pa yang nyams su myong ba nyid do //
translated: And obtaining means experiencing.

original: gal te don nyams su myong ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te don nyams su myong ba yin na /
translated: If it is the experience of an object,

original: phyis kyang de nyid yin pas ci'i phyir thob pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang de nyid yin pas ci'i phyir thob pa don du gnyer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is that very [object] later as well, why would one strive to attain it?

original: des na blo thams cad tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na blo thams cad tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all cognitions would be non-valid cognitions.

original: 'on te phyis rtogs pa de ni gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'on te phyis rtogs pa de ni gzhan yin te /
translated: But if that later realization is different,

original: des bstan pa ni ma yin pas na /
analyzed: des bstan pa ni ma yin pas na /
translated: and it is not taught by that [earlier cognition],

original: de thob pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de thob pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the attainment of that [later realization] would be a valid cognition.

original: de ltar na thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, everything would be a valid cognition.

original: ci ste nye bar bstan pa la cung zad nye bar ma bstan pa yod de des na de thob pas tshad @171b ma nyid do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: ci ste nye bar bstan pa la cung zad nye bar ma bstan pa yod de des na de thob pas tshad @171b ma nyid do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
translated: But if there is something not at all taught by the teaching, then by attaining that [teaching], it is a valid cognition, then that is also not correct,

original: ma bstan pa la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bstan pa la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because with respect to what is not taught, it is not a valid cognition.

original: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is just babbling.

original: de'i phyir don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar yin du zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar yin du zad do //
translated: Thus, since ultimately nothing exists at all, it is just as it is conventionally.

original: 'di tsam gyis kyang tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin pas kho bo cag la chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis kyang tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin pas kho bo cag la chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Since this much is a presentation of valid and invalid cognitions, we are not nihilists in the least.

original: khyod kyi phyogs na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: In your system, our assertions are the same as yours.

original: des na dngos po'i de kho na nyid las 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: des na dngos po'i de kho na nyid las 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to transcend the reality of things.

original: gal te don byed nus pa kun rdzob tu yin na /
analyzed: gal te don byed nus pa kun rdzob tu yin na /
translated: If the capacity to perform a function is the conventional,

original: spyi la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it also present in universals?

original: des na mtshan nyid ha cang khyab ches pa'i skyon yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid ha cang khyab ches pa'i skyon yin no zhe na ;
translated: Therefore, the definition is too broad.

original: bshad pa / gal te kun la de yod na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te kun la de yod na //
translated: If it is present in all,

original: spyi yi mtshan nyid rjes 'gro ldog / blo la ma mthong phyir min te //
analyzed: spyi yi mtshan nyid rjes 'gro ldog / blo la ma mthong phyir min te //
translated: it is not because the universal is not seen to follow and reverse,

original: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of eye and form.

original: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi yul la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the cognitions of eye and form and so on follow and reverse in accordance with the object of the objective condition and the dominant condition.

original: spyi'i blo dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i blo dag ni ma yin te /
translated: However, the cognitions of universals are not like that.

original: spyi'i blo ni sngon mthong ba'i 'bad rtsol tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i blo ni sngon mthong ba'i 'bad rtsol tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The general idea arises from the mere exertion of seeing something before.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni mig la sogs pa med par nang gi byed pa tsam las 'byung ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / gal te dngos po de nyid du //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i blo ni mig la sogs pa med par nang gi byed pa tsam las 'byung ba ma yin no // 'di ltar / gal te dngos po de nyid du //
translated: Thus, the idea of form, etc. does not arise from the mere internal activity without the eye, etc.üîΩThus,üîΩIf the thing is not seen before,

original: sngar yod mthong ba ma yin yang //
analyzed: sngar yod mthong ba ma yin yang //
translated: even though it exists,

original: 'on kyang ldog pa mthong ba las //
analyzed: 'on kyang ldog pa mthong ba las //
translated: but is seen when it is present,

original: yod do zhes ni nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: yod do zhes ni nges par 'gyur //
translated: one can ascertain that it exists.

original: gal te bden pa'i ka ba'i tshogs su snang ba yul la mi ltos par mig tsam las 'byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bden pa'i ka ba'i tshogs su snang ba yul la mi ltos par mig tsam las 'byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If the appearance of a collection of real pillars, etc. arose from the eye alone, without depending on the object,

original: gang dang gang du mig bltas pa de dang der 'byung bar 'gyur te rab rib can gyis skra shad la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang du mig bltas pa de dang der 'byung bar 'gyur te rab rib can gyis skra shad la sogs pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: it would arise wherever the eye looks, like the appearance of hair, etc. to one with an eye disease.

original: de dang bral ba'i phyogs su 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i phyogs su 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It would not arise in a place free from that.

original: des na ka ba la sogs pa sngar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ka ba la sogs pa sngar yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pillar, etc. exist before.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir na de la snam bu la sogs pa'i blo skye ba na snam bu la sogs pa'i nus pa khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir na de la snam bu la sogs pa'i blo skye ba na snam bu la sogs pa'i nus pa khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the relation of concomitance and reverse concomitance, when the cognition of cloth, etc. arises, the potency of cloth, etc. is understood.

original: spyi'i blo ni de lta ma yin te nang gi byed pa tsam las 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i blo ni de lta ma yin te nang gi byed pa tsam las 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of the universal is not like that, because it arises from mere internal activity.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig gang tshogs pa tsam las 'byung ba de ni de las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig gang tshogs pa tsam las 'byung ba de ni de las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever effect arises from the mere assemblage of causes does not indicate the potency of a thing that is different from that assemblage,

original: mig la sogs pa tsam gyi tshogs pa las byung ba'i mig gi sems @172a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tsam gyi tshogs pa las byung ba'i mig gi sems @172a * //
translated: because the cognition of the eye, etc. arises from the mere assemblage of the eye, etc.

original: kyi rna ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kyi rna ba bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of the ear.

original: ba lang nyid kyi blo rta la mi skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi blo rta la mi skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But the cognition of cowhood does not arise from the cognition of horsehood.

original: des na ldog pa ci ltar med ce na /
analyzed: des na ldog pa ci ltar med ce na /
translated: So how can there be reverse concomitance?

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩrta la ba lang nyid med phyir //
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / rta la ba lang nyid med phyir //
translated: That is not correct.

original: ba lang blo mi skye ba min //
analyzed: ba lang blo mi skye ba min //
translated: The cognition of cow is not non-existent because of the non-existence of cowhood in horse.üîΩBut the cognition of cow is not non-existent because of the non-existence of cowhood in horse.

original: bag chags sad byed de min phyir //
analyzed: bag chags sad byed de min phyir //
translated: Because that is not the awakener of the latent impressions.

original: de la ba lang blor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la ba lang blor mi 'gyur //
translated: But the cow is not the idea of the horse.

original: rta de ni ba lang nyid kyi bag chags sad par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rta de ni ba lang nyid kyi bag chags sad par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the idea of the cow is not the awakener of the latent impression of the horse.

original: de la ba lang gi blo med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ba lang gi blo med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the idea of the cow does not exist in the horse.

original: ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda ni de nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba'i brda ni de nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The convention ‚Äúcow‚Äù is established in that very [cow], not in the non-existence of cow-ness.

original: ba lang nyid med pa las ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de 'dra ba'i 'dus byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid med pa las ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de 'dra ba'i 'dus byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not because of the non-existence of cow-ness, but rather because of the non-existence of such a compounded thing.

original: gang gis de yod dam 'on te ma yin zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba spyi'i rnam pa gsal ba las tha dad pa ni de la rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis de yod dam 'on te ma yin zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba spyi'i rnam pa gsal ba las tha dad pa ni de la rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no cognition of that [universal] apart from the manifestation, which is to be established as either existent or non-existent.

original: de'i phyir spyi ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar grags pa tsam yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar grags pa tsam yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is merely a pleasing fiction when unexamined, but not ultimately real.

original: gal te don dam pa ma yin na ba lang nyid dang / rta nyid phan tshun ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa ma yin na ba lang nyid dang / rta nyid phan tshun ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not ultimately real, how can cow-ness and horse-ness be mutually exclusive?

original: phan tshun ldog pa ni rtogs pa nyid dam gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun ldog pa ni rtogs pa nyid dam gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Mutual exclusion is precisely cognition or manifestation.

original: gal te gsal ba med kyang brdar rtsol ba tsam las thams cad la spyi'i blo 'byung ba ma yin na ni de'i tshe ldog pa las spyi nus pa med par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba med kyang brdar rtsol ba tsam las thams cad la spyi'i blo 'byung ba ma yin na ni de'i tshe ldog pa las spyi nus pa med par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If the cognition of universals did not occur in all things merely through the exertion of a convention, then at that time the universal would not be powerless with regard to the excluded.

original: spyi ni khyab pa yin te des na thams cad du spyi'i blo skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ni khyab pa yin te des na thams cad du spyi'i blo skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is pervasive and therefore the cognition of the universal occurs in all things,

original: rab rib can gyis nye bar dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang de lta bu kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis nye bar dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa yang de lta bu kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the hairs and so on perceived by one with eye disease would be just like that.

original: gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because they are not seen by others,

original: spyi yang de'i rtsol ba la sogs pa dang bral bas mi rtogs pa /
analyzed: spyi yang de'i rtsol ba la sogs pa dang bral bas mi rtogs pa /
translated: then the universal is not perceived because it is devoid of exertion and so on.

original: de la yang skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The same error would apply to that.

original: de yod na dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: de yod na dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te ;
translated: It is not logical to say that it exists because it is perceived,

original: skra shad la sogs pa yang rab rib yod na gzhan gyis ci ltar mi dmigs /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa yang rab rib yod na gzhan gyis ci ltar mi dmigs /
translated: because if one has eye disease, why is it not perceived by others?

original: rab rib kyis nyams pa'i phyir de kho na ma yin pa dmigs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib kyis nyams pa'i phyir de kho na ma yin pa dmigs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because of the impairment of the eye, that it is the apprehension of what is not real,üîΩwhat is this that is called ‚Äúwhat is not real‚Äù?

original: de kho na ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhig / dbang po nyams pas dmigs par bya ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhig / dbang po nyams pas dmigs par bya ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object of the impaired eye,

original: ci ltar nyams pa yin ;
analyzed: ci ltar nyams pa yin ;
translated: how is it impaired?

original: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la dmigs par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin pa la dmigs par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the apprehension of what is not real,

original: 'di ni phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: this is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: gzhan yang spyi yang phyin ci log gi bag chags sad pas nyams par byas pa'i nang gi byed bas dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshungs so //üîΩgal te khyab byed yin pa'i @172b phyir ;
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi yang phyin ci log gi bag chags sad pas nyams par byas pa'i nang gi byed bas dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshungs so // gal te khyab byed yin pa'i @172b phyir ;
translated: Moreover, this is similar because the universal is also the object of the internal activity that is impaired by the activation of the latent impressions of error.üîΩIf you say that the universal is not reversed

original: / spyi mi ldog pa nyid ce na //üîΩrab rib can gyi rnam shes kyi //
analyzed: / spyi mi ldog pa nyid ce na // rab rib can gyi rnam shes kyi //
translated: because it is the pervader,üîΩit would be the object of understanding or the pervader

original: rtogs bya'am khyab byed nyid du 'gyur //üîΩgal te dbang po nyams pa yis //
analyzed: rtogs bya'am khyab byed nyid du 'gyur // gal te dbang po nyams pa yis //
translated: of the consciousness of the one with eye disease.üîΩIf the fly is not real

original: 'dzin phyir sbrang bu mi bden na //
analyzed: 'dzin phyir sbrang bu mi bden na //
translated: because it is grasped by the impaired sense faculty,

original: mi bden pa nyid ma grub par //
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid ma grub par //
translated: the unreality itself is not established.

original: nyams pa rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //üîΩnyams pa bden pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: nyams pa rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur // nyams pa bden pa ma yin pas /
translated: The non-establishment of the universal is not established.üîΩIf you say that the non-establishment of the universal is not true,

original: don byed grub pa min zhe na //
analyzed: don byed grub pa min zhe na //
translated: and therefore the establishment of the object‚Äôs function is not true,

original: de yi 'dzin byed nyams pa 'di //
analyzed: de yi 'dzin byed nyams pa 'di //
translated: then the non-establishment of the apprehender

original: spyi la'ang mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: spyi la'ang mtshungs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: would be the same as that of the universal.

original: des na spyi ni don byed nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na spyi ni don byed nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the universal is not able to perform a function,

original: shes pa tsam la'ang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde brda rtsol ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: shes pa tsam la'ang nus pa med pa'i phyir ro // de brda rtsol ba la sogs pa //
translated: because even mere consciousness is not able to perform a function.üîΩThe universal is explained to be

original: nang gi yan lag rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: the internal cause of the application of names, effort, and so on.

original: bum pa la 'degs spyi dang ni //
analyzed: bum pa la 'degs spyi dang ni //
translated: The universal of lifting and the universal of number and so on

original: grangs sogs blos ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: grangs sogs blos ni bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained to be the object of the mind.

original: gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa'i rten bum pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa'i rten bum pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas so //
translated: The substance that is the part of the pot that is the basis of form, taste, smell, and touch.

original: 'degs pa ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'degs pa ni bya ba'o //
translated: Lifting is the action.

original: grangs ni yon tan no //
analyzed: grangs ni yon tan no //
translated: Number is a quality.

original: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo ni 'du ba'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo ni 'du ba'i yul can yin te /
translated: The mind that thinks ‚Äúin this‚Äù is the subject that unifies.

original: de'i gzung ba ni 'du ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gzung ba ni 'du ba'o //
translated: Its object is the composite.

original: de dag gi blo gang yin pa de yang brda rtsol ba la sogs pa nang gi rgyu tsam la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi blo gang yin pa de yang brda rtsol ba la sogs pa nang gi rgyu tsam la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind that thinks ‚Äúin this‚Äù is dependent on the internal cause alone, the application of names, effort, and so on.

original: yul ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The object does not follow the concomitance and reverse concomitance.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gzugs sogs las ni tha dad par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs sogs las ni tha dad par //
translated: Apart from form and so on,

original: rdzas zhes bya ba yod min te //
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba yod min te //
translated: a substance does not exist.

original: bum pa'i bdag la bum pa'i blo //
analyzed: bum pa'i bdag la bum pa'i blo //
translated: The awareness of a pot

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa yod ma yin //
translated: does not follow the concomitance and reverse concomitance of a pot.

original: mig la sogs pa'i blos ni gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dmigs te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blos ni gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dmigs te /
translated: The awareness of the eye and so on only observes form and so on.

original: des na de ma dmigs pas sad par byas pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mtshan nyid rang gi rgyu kho na las 'di bum pa'o snyam du gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i blo skye bar skye bos nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de ma dmigs pas sad par byas pa thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mtshan nyid rang gi rgyu kho na las 'di bum pa'o snyam du gcig nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i blo skye bar skye bos nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the awareness that arises from its own cause alone, the characteristic of beginningless latent propensities activated by that, arises as the conception of a single thing, thinking ‚Äúthis is a pot.‚Äù This is experienced by people.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan ni yongs su brtags na rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan ni yongs su brtags na rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But a substance such as a pot, which is a different entity, does not exist at all when thoroughly investigated.

original: gal te rdzas ni mthong ba'am reg pas yongs su gcod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rdzas ni mthong ba'am reg pas yongs su gcod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIs not a substance ascertained by seeing or touching?‚Äù

original: rdzas ni rnam pa gnyis te blta bar bya ba dang reg pa bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ni rnam pa gnyis te blta bar bya ba dang reg pa bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: Substance is twofold: that which is seen and that which is touched.

original: de yang mi rigs te ;
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te ;
translated: That is also illogical.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rdzas de gzugs las gzhan min pa'am //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rdzas de gzugs las gzhan min pa'am //
translated: Substance is not different from form,

original: 'on te bzlog par 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: 'on te bzlog par 'dzin pa yin //
translated: Or else it is apprehended as the opposite.

original: gzhan ma yin pas 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pas 'dzin na ni //
translated: If it is apprehended as not different,

original: gzugs nyid gzugs ldan yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs nyid gzugs ldan yod ma yin //
translated: Form itself does not exist as possessing form.

original: gzhan du rig pa yin na blo //
analyzed: gzhan du rig pa yin na blo //
translated: If it is known as different,

original: rnam pa gnyis su myong 'gyur na //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su myong 'gyur na //
translated: The mind would experience two aspects.

original: rnam pa gnyis su snang bar ni //üîΩmig @173a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su snang bar ni // mig @173a * //
translated: The appearance as two aspects

original: shes tsam las 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: shes tsam las 'gyur ba min //
translated: Does not occur from mere eye consciousness.

original: ci ste bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa'o snyam pa'i blo ni /
translated: If the mind that thinks ‚ÄúThis is a pot‚Äù

original: gzugs so snyam pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs so snyam pa ma yin na /
translated: Is not the mind that thinks ‚ÄúThis is form,‚Äù

original: des na rig pa tha dad pa ci ltar med /
analyzed: des na rig pa tha dad pa ci ltar med /
translated: How can the cognition be nondistinct?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / bum pa'am snam bu dmar snyam pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bum pa'am snam bu dmar snyam pa'i //
translated: The mind that thinks ‚ÄúA pot‚Äù or ‚ÄúA red cloth‚Äù

original: blo ni 'khrul pa med pa yin //
analyzed: blo ni 'khrul pa med pa yin //
translated: Is not mistaken.

original: don 'jig byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang //
analyzed: don 'jig byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang //
translated: The reason for the activity of an object

original: rig pa las gzhan yod ma yin //
analyzed: rig pa las gzhan yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist apart from cognition.

original: gal te gzugs tsam rig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs tsam rig pa yin na ni /
translated: If mere form is cognition,

original: dmar po'i snyam pa kho nar 'gyur gyi bum pa'o snyam pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmar po'i snyam pa kho nar 'gyur gyi bum pa'o snyam pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is only the thought of red, not the thought of pot.

original: de yang mi bden te /üîΩdmar po dang ni mi dmar ba'i //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te / dmar po dang ni mi dmar ba'i //
translated: This is not correct.

original: don la bum par tha snyad byed //üîΩbum pa dang ni bum min pa'i //
analyzed: don la bum par tha snyad byed // bum pa dang ni bum min pa'i //
translated: The pot is designated in dependence on the object that is red and not red.

original: don yang dmar po'i sgra yis brjod //üîΩdes na rjes 'gro ldog pa las //
analyzed: don yang dmar po'i sgra yis brjod // des na rjes 'gro ldog pa las //
translated: The object that is not a pot is also expressed by the word ‚Äúred.‚Äù

original: tha dad yongs su brtags nas ni //
analyzed: tha dad yongs su brtags nas ni //
translated: Therefore, having imagined the difference between the positive and negative concomitances,

original: tha dad don du ston byed kyi //
analyzed: tha dad don du ston byed kyi //
translated: the difference is taught as the referent.

original: dngos po de bzhin gnas ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po de bzhin gnas ma yin //
translated: But the thing does not exist in that way.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan du dpyad zin to //üîΩci ste gal te yan lag can med par gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan du dpyad zin to // ci ste gal te yan lag can med par gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig yin la /
translated: This has been analyzed elsewhere.üîΩBut if the whole does not exist, then how could the mere aggregates of form and so on be the referent of the thought that conceives the body?

original: gang la gzugs yod pa de nyid la reg pa yod do zhes bya ba'i blor ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la gzugs yod pa de nyid la reg pa yod do zhes bya ba'i blor ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how could the thought ‚Äúwhere there is form there is contact‚Äù occur?

original: de yang gyi na ste /üîΩtshogs pa gcig la rag las dang // 'bras bu gcig la mkho ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang gyi na ste / tshogs pa gcig la rag las dang // 'bras bu gcig la mkho ba'i phyir //
translated: This is also untenable.üîΩBecause they are dependent on the same collection and are required for the same effect,

original: tshogs pa gcig tu rab brtags pas //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig tu rab brtags pas //
translated: they are imagined to be the same collection.

original: gang la de la zhes byar rtogs //
analyzed: gang la de la zhes byar rtogs //
translated: But how can there be a collection of things that are not already collected?

original: dmag gang la glang po che la sogs pa yod pa de la skyes bu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang na pa la sha la sogs pa yod pa'i nags de nyid la seng seng la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med dam ci /
analyzed: dmag gang la glang po che la sogs pa yod pa de la skyes bu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang na pa la sha la sogs pa yod pa'i nags de nyid la seng seng la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad med dam ci /
translated: Is it not the case that the expression ‚Äúan army‚Äù is used when there are elephants, etc., and the expression ‚Äúa forest‚Äù is used when there are ≈õirƒ´·π£a trees, etc.?

original: skyes bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dmag gam //
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dmag gam //
translated: But an army that is different from the elephants, etc.,

original: pa la sha la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i nags ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa la sha la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i nags ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and a forest that is different from the ≈õirƒ´·π£a trees, etc., do not exist.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid dam 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi pan tshun ma bral ba la brten pa na skye bos de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid dam 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi pan tshun ma bral ba la brten pa na skye bos de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when there is dependence on a single collection or a single effect, people use the expression ‚Äúa collection‚Äù or ‚Äúa forest,‚Äù even though there is no real whole.

original: gal te de lta na ni phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i lus su gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid yan lag can yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i lus su gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid yan lag can yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the collection of things that are not different from each other, such as form, etc., would be the possessor of the parts.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not different from them, like a pot, pillar, etc., which are different from form, etc.

original: yan lag can ni nags tshal la sogs pa ltar tha snyad tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can ni nags tshal la sogs pa ltar tha snyad tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The possessor of parts is not like a forest, etc., which are mere conventions.

original: de'i yan lag ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las brtags pas de ltar @173b bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las brtags pas de ltar @173b bzhag pa yin no //
translated: Its parts are posited as such by imputation, from the point of view of their being present or absent.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yul tha mi dad par yang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yul tha mi dad par yang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: For example, when one sees something, one says, ‚ÄúI touch it,‚Äù and so on, and one understands the object without any difference.

original: gzugs kyi yul spangs nas reg pa'am myangs par rtogs pa'i blo ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul spangs nas reg pa'am myangs par rtogs pa'i blo ni med do zhe na /
translated: There is no cognition that understands the touch or taste apart from the object of form.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gal te gzugs sogs phan tshun du //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sogs phan tshun du //
translated: If form, etc., were not different

original: rang bzhin tha dad med gyur na //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad med gyur na //
translated: from each other in their intrinsic natures,

original: gzugs sogs dbye ba gang las yin //
analyzed: gzugs sogs dbye ba gang las yin //
translated: from what would the divisions of form, etc., arise?

original: de nyid gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could they be different from each other?

original: de nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: They are not different from each other,

original: snang ba tha mi dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha mi dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that their appearance would not be different.

original: 'on te gcig po de nyid dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba'i phyir tha dad pa lta bur rtogs pa yin te mig gi dbang pos rtogs na ni gzugs nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te gcig po de nyid dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba'i phyir tha dad pa lta bur rtogs pa yin te mig gi dbang pos rtogs na ni gzugs nyid yin la /
translated: If it is understood by the eye sense faculty, it is form.

original: lus kyis rtogs na ni reg bya nyid dang lces rtogs pa na ni ro nyid yin no zhe na //
analyzed: lus kyis rtogs na ni reg bya nyid dang lces rtogs pa na ni ro nyid yin no zhe na //
translated: If it is understood by the body, it is tactility. If it is understood by the tongue, it is taste.

original: de ni mi bden te /üîΩ'dzin pa'i dbye bas gcig pa yi //
analyzed: de ni mi bden te / 'dzin pa'i dbye bas gcig pa yi //
translated: That is not true.üîΩHow can the nature of one thing

original: dngos nyid gzhan du rtogs sam ci //
analyzed: dngos nyid gzhan du rtogs sam ci //
translated: be understood as different due to the difference in grasping?

original: 'on te tha dad rtogs pa'i lam du gnas pa tha dad nyid /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad rtogs pa'i lam du gnas pa tha dad nyid /
translated: Or, if it abides as the path of understanding difference, it is different.

original: re zhig gcig nyid do zhes bya ba la ni tshad ma med do //
analyzed: re zhig gcig nyid do zhes bya ba la ni tshad ma med do //
translated: First, there is no valid cognition of oneness.

original: gcig nyid ni 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Oneness is not understood as different due to the difference in grasping, because it would absurdly follow that it is mistaken.

original: ci ste gzhan du 'dzin pa med pas rten med pa de nyid ma 'khrul bar brjod do zhe na /üîΩde ni de ltar don dam nyid //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du 'dzin pa med pas rten med pa de nyid ma 'khrul bar brjod do zhe na / de ni de ltar don dam nyid //
translated: If it is said that it is non-mistaken because there is no other grasping without a basis,

original: yin par ci yi phyir mi rtog //
analyzed: yin par ci yi phyir mi rtog //
translated: then why is that not understood to be ultimate reality?

original: tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: tha mi dad par rtogs pa ni //
translated: The realization of non-difference

original: med pa'i phyir na rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir na rtogs ma yin //
translated: is not a realization because of non-existence.

original: ci ste yang tha dad pa yul gcig pa dang / mi 'brel ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang tha dad pa yul gcig pa dang / mi 'brel ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if they are different, how can they have the same object?

original: de ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ltar /
translated: This is easily understood.

original: de las gzhan du snang med phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan du snang med phyir //
translated: Because there is no appearance of it as different,

original: yul ni yul can las gzhan min ;
analyzed: yul ni yul can las gzhan min ;
translated: the object is not different from the subject.

original: / yul can snang bar tha dad phyir //
analyzed: / yul can snang bar tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the appearance of the object is different from the appearance of the subject,

original: gang las tha dad med pa yin //
analyzed: gang las tha dad med pa yin //
translated: from what is it non-different?

original: yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The so-called object is not different from form, etc.

original: de de dag la tha dad pa yang /
analyzed: de de dag la tha dad pa yang /
translated: And its difference from them

original: tha dad par snang ba nyid las yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba nyid las yin gyi /
translated: is due to the appearance of difference,

original: yul tha dad pas ni ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad pas ni ma yin te thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: not due to the difference of the object, because that would lead to an infinite regress, and there would be no realization.

original: rang gi ngo bos tha dad na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos tha dad na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: If they were different by intrinsic identity, form, etc. would also be different.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the intrinsic nature of the appearance is not different from the intrinsic nature of the object.

original: snang ba yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: snang ba yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: The appearances are different.

original: gzugs snang ba nyid ni de snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs snang ba nyid ni de snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of form is not the appearance of that.

original: dbang po gzhan don med par @174a * //üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba dang snang ba tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan don med par @174a * // thal bar 'gyur ba dang snang ba tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that the other sense faculties would be useless.üîΩAnd it follows that the appearances would not be different.

original: dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are different because the sense faculties are different,

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: dbang po tha dad kyang tha mi dad pa tha dad par snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad kyang tha mi dad pa tha dad par snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the sense faculties are different, they are not different in the sense that they appear to be different.

original: de ltar yin na ni tha dad pa lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni tha dad pa lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
translated: If that were the case, they would be different only in a hidden way.

original: yan lag can ni gzugs la sogs pa tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can ni gzugs la sogs pa tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows that the possessor of the parts would be form and so on.

original: gal te dbang po'i mthu las gzhan du gyur pa'i don yang rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yin na ni mig ser can la dung ser por snang ba bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i mthu las gzhan du gyur pa'i don yang rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yin na ni mig ser can la dung ser por snang ba bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object that is different from the power of the sense faculty is understood to be different, then it would be mistaken, just like the appearance of a yellow conch to one with jaundice.

original: ci ste mi slu ba'i phyir ma 'khrul ba nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste mi slu ba'i phyir ma 'khrul ba nyid do snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not mistaken because it is not deceptive,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That also is not a logical reason.

original: mi slu ba yang snang ba nyid yin pas de yang dbang po'i khyad par nyid las snang ba'i rnam pa de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir na de yang 'khrul pa kho na yin pas ji ltar ma grub pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang snang ba nyid yin pas de yang dbang po'i khyad par nyid las snang ba'i rnam pa de ltar 'gyur ba de'i phyir na de yang 'khrul pa kho na yin pas ji ltar ma grub pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Because even the nondeceptive is just an appearance, and that also is just a special sense faculty, and the aspect of appearance is like that because of it, therefore, that also is just an error.

original: mi slu ba'am gzhan gyi snang ba ni dbang pos byas pa yin pa na don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir don zhes bya ba med pas yan lag can gyi sgrub par byed pa ni legs pa khoüîΩna zhig go //
analyzed: mi slu ba'am gzhan gyi snang ba ni dbang pos byas pa yin pa na don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir don zhes bya ba med pas yan lag can gyi sgrub par byed pa ni legs pa kho na zhig go //
