translated: If the nondeceptive or the appearance of another is produced by a sense faculty, then the ascertainment that it conforms with and reverses the object is absent. Because the so-called object does not exist, the proof of the whole is only good.

original: don med par sgrub par byed pa ni yan lag can gyi sgrub byed ma yin te /
analyzed: don med par sgrub par byed pa ni yan lag can gyi sgrub byed ma yin te /
translated: The proof of the nonexistence of the object is not the proof of the whole.

original: de ni don gyi khyad par nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don gyi khyad par nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is asserted to be a particular object.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i byed pa las ni gcig du mar snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i byed pa las ni gcig du mar snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of one or many is not from the activity of the sense faculty.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni du ma nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni du ma nyid do //
translated: However, form and so on are many.

original: de'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa ni nang gi byed pa la rag las pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig tu rtogs pa ni nang gi byed pa la rag las pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of unity is dependent on an internal activity.

original: 'degs pa'i rtogs pa yang lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig yul gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'degs pa'i rtogs pa yang lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig yul gzhan dang gzhan du skye ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of lifting is the arising of a series of moments of the hand, etc., in different places.

original: 'degs so snyam pa ni nang gi byed pa nyid las de'i tshogs pa 'ba' zhig la rtogs pas sgro 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'degs so snyam pa ni nang gi byed pa nyid las de'i tshogs pa 'ba' zhig la rtogs pas sgro 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI lift‚Äù is a superimposition on the mere collection of those moments, due to an internal activity.

original: yul gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise by the power of an object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig rnams kyis gsal bar bya ba'i las nyid 'degs pa'i shes pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig rnams kyis gsal bar bya ba'i las nyid 'degs pa'i shes pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the object of the cognition of lifting is the action of the prior and subsequent moments that are to be clarified.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal is clarified by the particulars.

original: las nyid kyi spyi ni las kyi gsal ba rnams kyis gsal bar bya ba yin gyi don gyi skad cig rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las nyid kyi spyi ni las kyi gsal ba rnams kyis gsal bar bya ba yin gyi don gyi skad cig rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal of action is clarified by the particulars of action, but not by the moments of the object.

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i gsal ba la brten pa'i las kyi gsal @174b ba gzhan ni yod pa'am dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma'i gsal ba la brten pa'i las kyi gsal @174b ba gzhan ni yod pa'am dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: But the manifestation of the action based on the manifestation of the hand and so on is not perceived to be another.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang spyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang spyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And the manifestation of the universal is not manifested by another manifestation.

original: 'on te las nyid kyi rigs lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gis gsal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te las nyid kyi rigs lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gis gsal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the universal of action is manifested by the hand and so on, which are momentary,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: skad cig re res gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: skad cig re res gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not manifested by each moment.

original: /'degs pa nyid la sogs pa'i skad cig gcig gis gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: /'degs pa nyid la sogs pa'i skad cig gcig gis gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not manifested by one moment of action, such as lifting.

original: skad cig dang po kho nar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig dang po kho nar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that it would be perceived in the first moment alone.

original: 'on te las nyid kyi rigs ni dus cig car du gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te las nyid kyi rigs ni dus cig car du gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But the universal of action is not manifested simultaneously.

original: brda sprod pa bas ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'jug par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brda sprod pa bas ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'jug par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The grammarians should not necessarily follow the tenets of others.

original: kho bo cag gi lta ba rnam par gnas pa ni 'di kho na'o snyam na de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi lta ba rnam par gnas pa ni 'di kho na'o snyam na de ni mi bden te /
translated: We think that this alone is the correct view, but that is not so.

original: gal te rigs re res gsal ba ma yin na 'o na ni spyis gsal bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rigs re res gsal ba ma yin na 'o na ni spyis gsal bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If a universal is not manifested by each individual, then it is manifested by the universal itself,

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other way.

original: goms pa las gcig gis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: goms pa las gcig gis gsal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: If you say that it is manifested by one through habituation,

original: 'o na ni goms pa nyid nang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir shes pa de yul gyi stobs kyis byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni goms pa nyid nang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir shes pa de yul gyi stobs kyis byung ba ma yin no //
translated: then that cognition does not arise through the power of the object because habituation itself is the internal cause.

original: de bzhin du ldan pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ldan pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the cognition that distinguishes possession.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe number, the possessor of the number,üîΩthe nature of the possessor,

original: grangs ldan pa la sogs pa dang // de ldan rang gi ngo bo dang // brjod pa las ni tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: grangs ldan pa la sogs pa dang // de ldan rang gi ngo bo dang // brjod pa las ni tha dad pa'i //
translated: and the expression are not different

original: ngo bo blo la snang ba med //
analyzed: ngo bo blo la snang ba med //
translated: from the entity that appears to the mind.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: And:üîΩThe number, the possessor of the number,üîΩthe nature of the possessor,üîΩand the expression are not differentüîΩfrom the entity that appears to the mind.

original: gal te don byed par mi nus pa zhes bya ba spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin nam des na skra shad la sogs pa yang don byed mi nus pa'i phyir spyir thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don byed par mi nus pa zhes bya ba spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin nam des na skra shad la sogs pa yang don byed mi nus pa'i phyir spyir thal lo zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the definition of a universal that it cannot perform a function? Therefore, it follows that even such things as a double moon are universals, because they cannot perform a function.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: 'di ltar / skra shad sogs ni spyi min te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skra shad sogs ni spyi min te //
translated: Thus, such things as a double moon are not universals,

original: don du zhen pa med phyir ro ;üîΩ/ shes byar 'dzin phyir med pa la //
analyzed: don du zhen pa med phyir ro ; / shes byar 'dzin phyir med pa la //
translated: because they do not exist as objects.

original: nyes pa dag tu thal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nyes pa dag tu thal mi 'gyur //
translated: But it is not the case that the errorsüîΩof nonexistence and so on follow for us.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi don nyid spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na spyi yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi don nyid spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na spyi yin no //
translated: When the nature of an object that exists by way of its intrinsic character is understood as a universal, it is a universal.

original: gal te 'di rang gi mtshan nyid yin na don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di rang gi mtshan nyid yin na don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi yin te /
translated: But if it has intrinsic character, how can it be a universal, because it performs a function?

original: spyi ni don bya ba byed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni don bya ba byed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A universal does not perform a function.

original: don byed pa med pa ni don du yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don byed pa med pa ni don du yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: And how can something that does not perform a function be an object?

original: don byed pa nyid kyis don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa nyid kyis don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an object is that which performs a function.

original: don byed pa byed pa dang / cig shos gnyi ga ni gcig la yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don byed pa byed pa dang / cig shos gnyi ga ni gcig la yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not possible for both to exist in one thing.

original: 'di ni 'thad par dka' ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩdngos su don byed mi nus dang // brgyud pa yis ni nus @175a * //üîΩpa'i phyir // de ni spyi dang don nyid dang // nus pa dang ni nus med nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni 'thad par dka' ba ma yin pa'i phyir te / dngos su don byed mi nus dang // brgyud pa yis ni nus @175a * // pa'i phyir // de ni spyi dang don nyid dang // nus pa dang ni nus med nyid //
translated: This is not difficult to establish,üîΩbecause the universal is not a real object,üîΩbut the particular is a real object.

original: spyi ni don du zhen pa'i phyir //üîΩdon yin te /üîΩdon dam par ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyi ni don du zhen pa'i phyir // don yin te / don dam par ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: The universal is not a real object,üîΩbecause it is not a real object ultimately.üîΩThe particular is a real object,üîΩbecause it is a real object ultimately.

original: 'di'i don nyid ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don nyid ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: The particular is a real object,

original: brgyu nas don gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyu nas don gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the effect of a real object.

original: 'o na ji ltar sgra'i yul spyi yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgra'i yul spyi yin te /
translated: But how can the universal be the object of a word?

original: chu klung gi 'gram na kha ra'i phung po yod do zhes bya ba ni brgyud nas kyang don byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chu klung gi 'gram na kha ra'i phung po yod do zhes bya ba ni brgyud nas kyang don byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the statement ‚ÄúThere is a heap of cowdung on the bank of the river‚Äù does not refer to a real object even indirectly.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: This is not so,

original: de spyi min mod nged pa ni //üîΩchad pa ci yod sgra rnams ni //
analyzed: de spyi min mod nged pa ni // chad pa ci yod sgra rnams ni //
translated: because the universal is not a real object.üîΩWhat is the harm?

original: tshad ma min par sgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshad ma min par sgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because we establish that words are not valid cognitions.

original: mchog tu legs par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: mchog tu legs par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: It is the best, the most excellent.

original: 'di ltar spyi ni kho bo cag tshad ma'i yul du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni kho bo cag tshad ma'i yul du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, we accept that a universal is the object of a valid cognition.

original: gal te de yang tshad ma'i yul yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de yang tshad ma'i yul yin na ni /
translated: If it is the object of a valid cognition,

original: sgra tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then sound is a valid cognition.

original: 'o na ji ltar sgra'i yul spyi yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgra'i yul spyi yin par brjod ce na /
translated: But how can you say that the object of sound is a universal?

original: spyi kho na sgra'i yul yin no zhes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi kho na sgra'i yul yin no zhes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that a universal alone is the object of sound.

original: 'o na ci zhe na spyi ni sgra'i yul kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na spyi ni sgra'i yul kho na yin gyi /
translated: But what is it? A universal is the object of sound,

original: yul ma yin pa ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and there is no object that is not a universal.

original: sgra'i yul nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa nyid mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i yul nyid kyis ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam pa nyid mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The fact that it is the object of sound indicates that it is a universal.

original: de bzhin du yul ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid zhes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid zhes te /
translated: In the same way, a particular is not the object of sound.

original: skra shad la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A particular is not a universal, like a hair in the eye,

original: sgra 'ga'i'ang yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra 'ga'i'ang yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a particular is not the object of any sound.

original: 'dir yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul ma yin pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yul ma yin pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Here, it is not that the intrinsic identity is not the object, but rather that the intrinsic identity is just not the object.

original: sgra'i yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sgra'i yul ma yin pa /
translated: It is not the object of words.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The cognition that has sound as its object is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
translated: Thus,

original: shes pa spyi yi mtshan nyid ni //üîΩbya ste yul gyi dbye ba yis //üîΩde la tha dad sgrub pa yin //
analyzed: shes pa spyi yi mtshan nyid ni // bya ste yul gyi dbye ba yis // de la tha dad sgrub pa yin //
translated: The definition of a valid cognitionüîΩIs a cognition that is nondeceptive.üîΩIt is established as differentüîΩBy the difference of its object.

original: de yi yul nyid tha dad pa //
analyzed: de yi yul nyid tha dad pa //
translated: Its object itself is

original: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa yin //üîΩdes na tshad ma'i yul min pa //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa yin // des na tshad ma'i yul min pa //
translated: Accepted as the object of attainment.

original: yul nyid du ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: yul nyid du ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how could that which is not the object of a valid cognitionüîΩBe an object?

original: gal te don nyid spyi yin na dngos po med pa ni spyi nyid du mi 'gyur te don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te don nyid spyi yin na dngos po med pa ni spyi nyid du mi 'gyur te don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object itself is the universal, then a nonentity would not be a universal, because it is empty of object.

original: de ni yul ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yul ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not an object,

original: mi dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of nonapprehension.

original: spyi'i ngo bo yang yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo yang yin te /
translated: It is also the universal nature.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the distinctions ‚Äúnonexistent previously‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent after having been existent‚Äù and so on pervade it.

original: de ni dang po med pa dang / de ltar med pa zhes gsal bas khyab par byed pa @175b yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dang po med pa dang / de ltar med pa zhes gsal bas khyab par byed pa @175b yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is pervaded by the terms ‚Äúnonexistent from the beginning‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent in that way.‚Äù

original: de la yang lan du /
analyzed: de la yang lan du /
translated: To that, the response is:

original: shes byar 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: shes byar 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Because it is the object of the apprehension of nonentity.

original: dngos po med pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis shes bya nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis shes bya nyid yin no //
translated: Nonentity is an object of knowledge in some way.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin la de yang don bya ba byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin la de yang don bya ba byed pa kho na'o //
translated: The tenet that the mere absence of an entity is nonentity is also an object that performs a function.

original: yang na de yang tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba nyid do //üîΩdgos pa yod pa'i phyir nus pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yang na de yang tshad mas yongs su gcad par bya ba nyid do // dgos pa yod pa'i phyir nus pa yang yin no //
translated: Or, it is an object that is completely ascertained by valid knowledge.üîΩIt is also possible because it has a purpose.

original: dngos po med pas kyang dgos par 'gyur ba nyid de dogs pa med par 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang dgos par 'gyur ba nyid de dogs pa med par 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonentity also has a purpose because it is the object of the activity of going without fear.

original: des na de la don du mos pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni rang gi ngo bos don kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de la don du mos pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni rang gi ngo bos don kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since one is disposed to take it as an object, the non-existent is an object by its very nature.

original: skra shad la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But not so with the hairs, etc.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes bya nyid du yongs su dpyod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te skra la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe 'di lta bur gyur pa'i skra la sogs pa 'di ni mi bden no zhe'am /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes bya nyid du yongs su dpyod pa'i phyir ro // gal te skra la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe 'di lta bur gyur pa'i skra la sogs pa 'di ni mi bden no zhe'am /
translated: For they are thoroughly analyzed as being the objects of an erroneous cognition.üîΩBut when one knows that the hairs, etc. are like this, i.e., that these hairs, etc. are not true,

original: bden pa'i skra dang 'dra ba'o zhes shes pa de'i tshe de la yang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i dgos pa mi bden pa'i rgyu mtshan can gegs med par 'gro ba la sogs pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: bden pa'i skra dang 'dra ba'o zhes shes pa de'i tshe de la yang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i dgos pa mi bden pa'i rgyu mtshan can gegs med par 'gro ba la sogs pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: or that they are like true hairs, then at that time, is there not a purpose for them, which is in accordance with their nature, i.e., the non-true reason, the absence of obstruction to going, etc.?

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang tshad ma'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang tshad ma'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they too would be the objects of valid cognition.

original: ci ste de ltar yongs su bcad pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin kho na snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar yongs su bcad pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin kho na snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that such a determination is only the nature of the universal,

original: de lta na ni gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal bar snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be the appearance of the particular.

original: gsal par snang ba nyid kyis don yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gsal par snang ba nyid kyis don yin na ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: If it is the object because it appears clearly, then it is the intrinsic identity.

original: de'i shes pa don med pa can du ma'i 'gyur ba'i phyir ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i shes pa don med pa can du ma'i 'gyur ba'i phyir ma 'khrul bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it would be non-mistaken because its cognition would be meaningless.

original: bshad pa / de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos //
analyzed: bshad pa / de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Their nature is also like that.

original: bkag med gsal bar snang nyid //
analyzed: bkag med gsal bar snang nyid //
translated: They are clearly apparent without being blocked.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo'i don nyid phyir //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo'i don nyid phyir //
translated: Because they are the object that is the nature of consciousness,

original: skra sogs zhes bya'i blo dag ni //
analyzed: skra sogs zhes bya'i blo dag ni //
translated: The cognitions called ‚Äúhairs‚Äù and so on

original: spyi yi spyod yul can yin la //
analyzed: spyi yi spyod yul can yin la //
translated: Have universals as their objects.

original: skra snang don med can yin no //
analyzed: skra snang don med can yin no //
translated: The appearance of hairs is meaningless.

original: gal te rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa yang mi bden par yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra la sogs pa yang mi bden par yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If those with diseased vision completely understand that the hairs and so on that they observe are not real,

original: mi bden pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the meaning of the term ‚Äúnot real‚Äù?

original: don byed pa'i shes pa'am skyes bu gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa'am skyes bu gzhan gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not observed by a consciousness that performs a function or by another person,

original: des dmigs par rung ba nyid med par yongs su bcad pas na dngos po med par gzhal bya nyid yin no //
analyzed: des dmigs par rung ba nyid med par yongs su bcad pas na dngos po med par gzhal bya nyid yin no //
translated: they are ascertained to be unreal because they are not suitable to be observed. Therefore they are objects of comprehension that are nonthings.

original: des na dngos po med pa nyid du gzhal bar bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid du bkag pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa nyid du gzhal bar bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid du bkag pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the object of cognition as non-existent is not denied as a universal.

original: yang gang gi tshe 'di ni skra la sogs pa gzhan dang 'dra ba yin no snyam pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang bzhi la 'dra bar tha snyad @176a * //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe 'di ni skra la sogs pa gzhan dang 'dra ba yin no snyam pa de'i tshe shes pa'i rang bzhi la 'dra bar tha snyad @176a * //
translated: Moreover, when one thinks that this is similar to another, such as hair, then, because the nature of consciousness is designated as similar,

original: byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is a universal.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul nyid yin pas skra la sogs pa gzhal bya nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul nyid yin pas skra la sogs pa gzhal bya nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is the very object of an inference based on a real particular, hair, etc. are objects of cognition.

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: But how can a universal appear as a manifestation?

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis don yin pa'i phyir na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis don yin pa'i phyir na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: Since the nature of consciousness is the object, it is a particular itself.

original: de ltar na mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, it would be perception.

original: 'gyur ba kho na ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is just that, because it is the object of reflexive awareness perception.

original: ci ltar spyi'i rang nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar spyi'i rang nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: How is it a universal itself?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis sngar gyi sgra la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis sngar gyi sgra la sogs pa dang 'dra bar yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other conceptual consciousnesses apprehend the sound, etc., as similar to the previous one.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rab rib can shes rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rab rib can shes rtogs bya ba //
translated: The consciousness of one with eye disease

original: skra sogs bden min sngon chad ni //
analyzed: skra sogs bden min sngon chad ni //
translated: is not true to the hairs, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because it apprehends them as such.

original: yang na tshul mthun phyir 'dra yin //
analyzed: yang na tshul mthun phyir 'dra yin //
translated: Or, it is similar because it is similar to that.

original: bden pa las bzlog pa'am /
analyzed: bden pa las bzlog pa'am /
translated: The opposite of truth or

original: 'dra ba nyid ni sngon rang bzhin gyis rjes su 'brang ba med na mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid ni sngon rang bzhin gyis rjes su 'brang ba med na mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: similarity is the absence of natural concomitance in the past.

original: des na 'dra ba dang mi bden pa dag ni rnam par rtogs pas gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba dang mi bden pa dag ni rnam par rtogs pas gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, similarity and untruth are to be eliminated by conceptualization.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not nonconceptual to engage in the nature of the former and latter.

original: des na ldog tu gyur pa nyid kyis spyi yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog tu gyur pa nyid kyis spyi yin no //
translated: Thus, it is a universal because it is the opposite.

original: 'o na don med pa'i shes pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don med pa'i shes pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, what is a consciousness that is meaningless?

original: skrar snang ba'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: skrar snang ba'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: The sensory consciousness to which the hair appears is without an object.

original: bsam pa ni rang rig pa la ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni rang rig pa la ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: The intention is that the reflexive awareness is direct perception,

original: skra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang / dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang / dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: and the conceptual consciousness that has the nature of hair, etc., is inference, and the sensory consciousness is without an object. This is the analysis.

original: de nyid dbang po'i shes pa yin la de nyid rang rig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid dbang po'i shes pa yin la de nyid rang rig pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it just the sensory consciousness that is reflexive awareness?

original: rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan dbang po'i shes pa ni med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan dbang po'i shes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no sensory consciousness other than reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa de nyid dbang po la brtan nas skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa de nyid dbang po la brtan nas skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that reflexive awareness itself arises in dependence on the sense faculty.

original: don la de ni dbang shes yin /
analyzed: don la de ni dbang shes yin /
translated: It is a sensory consciousness with respect to the object,

original: don med na ni 'khrul par 'dod //
analyzed: don med na ni 'khrul par 'dod //
translated: but without an object, it is held to be an error.

original: rang rig dbang po las min te //
analyzed: rang rig dbang po las min te //
translated: Reflexive awareness is not from the sense faculty,

original: de med par yang 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yang 'jug phyir ro //
translated: because it occurs even when the sense faculty is absent.

original: gang zhig med kyang gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ni de ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig med kyang gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ni de ma yin no //
translated: If something occurs even when something else is absent, then the latter is not the cause of the former.

original: dbang po med na rang rig pa yongs su gsal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po med na rang rig pa yongs su gsal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if there is no sense faculty, wouldn‚Äôt reflexive awareness be completely unclear?

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang rig pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa thams cad ni rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin no //
translated: All reflexive awareness is intrinsically clear.

original: gang zhig gang la rang gi ngo bo dngos su byed pa'i rnam par snang ba de gsal ba @176b yin no /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rang gi ngo bo dngos su byed pa'i rnam par snang ba de gsal ba @176b yin no /
translated: That which appears to itself in a certain way is clear.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rang gi rang bzhin yang dngos su snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi rang gi rang bzhin yang dngos su snang ba yin no //
translated: The nature of all consciousnesses is to appear directly.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin te rang gi ngo bo med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin te rang gi ngo bo med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is not hidden, because it would follow that it would have no nature.

original: de'i phyir mi gsal ba thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi gsal ba thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all that is unclear is hidden.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa dbang po med kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa dbang po med kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Even though there is no sense faculty in a dream consciousness, it is clear by nature.

original: des na dbang po ni don nyid la 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na dbang po ni don nyid la 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the sense faculty is what engages the object.

original: de med na ni don med pa can nyid do //
analyzed: de med na ni don med pa can nyid do //
translated: If it does not exist, there is no object.

original: des na skra'i shes pa ni don med pa can yin te /
analyzed: des na skra'i shes pa ni don med pa can yin te /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of a hair is without an object.

original: de la skra thob pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la skra thob pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not the case that the hair is obtained.

original: de'i phyir don la ltos nas don med pa can yin no zhes bya bar gdeng ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don la ltos nas don med pa can yin no zhes bya bar gdeng ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the unreal is in dependence on the real.

original: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin na spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / gsal bar snang bar thal ba'i phyir 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin na spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / gsal bar snang bar thal ba'i phyir 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If the object is the nature of consciousness, then it follows that the universal appears as the particular and the manifestation, and so there is a contradiction.

original: mi 'gal te /
analyzed: mi 'gal te /
translated: There is no contradiction.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te spyi ni shes ngo bos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te spyi ni shes ngo bos //
translated: If the universal is the nature of consciousness,

original: don nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then there is the consequence.

original: de ltar 'dod phyis skyon yod min //üîΩdon gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod phyis skyon yod min // don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi //
translated: But there is no fault in asserting that,üîΩbecause the universal is the nature of the object.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal bar snang ba ni spyi la yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal bar snang ba ni spyi la yod pa nyid do //
translated: The universal is the nature of consciousness, and it appears as the particular and the manifestation.

original: de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i gsal bar snang ba nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: Its appearance as the manifestation is just like that.

original: don ni mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: don ni mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The object is not the manifestation,

original: gzhan la ltos nas gzhan mi gsal bar snang ba nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas gzhan mi gsal bar snang ba nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as the manifestation of another in dependence on another.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa ni de nyid yin te /
translated: The form of consciousness is just that.

original: gang la ltos nas de mi gsal ba nyid du brjod par 'byung /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas de mi gsal ba nyid du brjod par 'byung /
translated: In dependence on what is it said to be unclear?

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo gsal bar snang ba'i phyir mi gsal ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo gsal bar snang ba'i phyir mi gsal ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can it be unclear, since its own nature appears clearly?

original: rnam pa thams cad snang ba gang yin pa 'di nyid gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad snang ba gang yin pa 'di nyid gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: The appearance of all forms is just clarity.

original: don gyi rang bzhin ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of the object is different.

original: de mi snang na mi gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de mi snang na mi gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: When it does not appear, it appears as unclear.

original: 'o na de ji ltar de spyi nyid dang / mi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar de spyi nyid dang / mi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be a universal and appear unclear?

original: bshad pa phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa phyi rol gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi nyid do //
translated: It is a universal because of the nature of the external object.

original: dpyad pas na ngo bo ste nges par brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdon du nges par brtags pas spyi nyid dang / don mi gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dpyad pas na ngo bo ste nges par brtags pa zhes bya ba'o // don du nges par brtags pas spyi nyid dang / don mi gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
translated: It is a form because it is investigated.üîΩIt is a universal because it is investigated as an object, and it appears as an unclear object.

original: de mi gsal ba nyid dang spyi'i rnam pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: de mi gsal ba nyid dang spyi'i rnam pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis yin no //
translated: It is unclear and has the form of a universal because it is hidden.

original: 'di ltar / kun la ngo bo mtshungs phyir dang // de ldog pa la brten phyir ro //üîΩrno ba dang zhan pa dang drag pa dang / tsam dan gyi la sogs @177a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / kun la ngo bo mtshungs phyir dang // de ldog pa la brten phyir ro // rno ba dang zhan pa dang drag pa dang / tsam dan gyi la sogs @177a * //
translated: Because they are the same in nature with regard to all, and because they are based on the exclusion of that.

original: pa thams cad la ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa thams cad la ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: All things, such as sharp, dull, strong, fragrant, and so on, are the same in nature.

original: snang ba dang brtags pa'i don gcig tu byas pa'i phyir gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas de thun mong nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang brtags pa'i don gcig tu byas pa'i phyir gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas de thun mong nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are conceived as one by the conception of oneness, which is the unification of the object of appearance and the object of conception.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo yin pas ni de spyi nyid du nye bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo yin pas ni de spyi nyid du nye bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the nature of the similar, it is understood as a universal.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa yang gsal ba de'i rang bzhin du zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa yang gsal ba de'i rang bzhin du zhen pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of consciousness is also conceived as the nature of that clarity.

original: khra bo la sogs pa gsal ba mtha' dag la gnas pa nyid kyis spyi'i rnam par gyur pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du gyur pa ni kun rdzob tu spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa gsal ba mtha' dag la gnas pa nyid kyis spyi'i rnam par gyur pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du gyur pa ni kun rdzob tu spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The aspect of consciousness that is the transformation of the universal, which is based on all the individual things such as the variegated, is the relative universal nature.

original: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conceived in that way.

original: de la de las skyes pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu ni bag chags kyi khyad par yang yin no zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de las skyes pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu ni bag chags kyi khyad par yang yin no zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: The cause of the special attachment that arises from that is a special latent impression.

original: de ni ldog pa'i khyad par de la brtan nas byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ldog pa'i khyad par de la brtan nas byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is without fault, because it arises in dependence on the special exclusion.

original: de ni brgyud nas ldog pa'i don la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa'i don rnams la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brgyud nas ldog pa'i don la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa'i don rnams la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it arises in dependence on the object of exclusion indirectly, and because it causes engagement with the objects of exclusion.

original: ldog pa de nyid ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa de nyid ni spyi yin te /
translated: That exclusion itself is the universal.

original: ldog pa nyid ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa dang 'brel pas don gyi rnam pa yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid ni thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa dang 'brel pas don gyi rnam pa yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because exclusion itself is undifferentiated with respect to all, and because the aspect of the object that is related to exclusion has the nature of exclusion.

original: ci ltar rnam pa spyi yin /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa spyi yin /
translated: How is the aspect a universal?

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid khyad par med pas rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul gyi spyi ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid khyad par med pas rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul gyi spyi ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the object of inference because it is undifferentiated with respect to form and so on?

original: gsal ba gzhan ma spangs pa'i gsal ba nyid spyir brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan ma spangs pa'i gsal ba nyid spyir brjod pa yin te /
translated: The universal is stated to be the individual itself, which does not exclude other individuals.

original: gsal ba mtha' dag spangs nas ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba mtha' dag spangs nas ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you reject all instances of clarity, it follows that inference is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad mar khas len pas ni gdon mi za bar mtshon zin pas mtshon pa nyid kyis gsal ba yul nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad mar khas len pas ni gdon mi za bar mtshon zin pas mtshon pa nyid kyis gsal ba yul nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos kyi /
translated: Therefore, those who accept inference as a valid cognition must accept that the object of inference is a particular, because it is necessarily indicated by the indicative.

original: rnam pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the object of inference is merely a universal.

original: 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that the indicative would not be an engaging cause.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa la yang skyon 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa la yang skyon 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This same fault applies to the apprehension of a mere universal.

original: de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don spyir smra ba rnams kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi don spyir smra ba rnams kyi /
translated: Therefore, those who advocate that the object is of the nature of consciousness

original: shes pa'i rnam pa de las gsal ba rjes su dpag pa'i phyir spyi'i rjes su dpag pas gsal ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa de las gsal ba rjes su dpag pa'i phyir spyi'i rjes su dpag pas gsal ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: infer a particular from the aspect of consciousness, so the object of inference is a particular.

original: de la spyis kyang gsal ba dpog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la spyis kyang gsal ba dpog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A universal does not infer a particular.

original: de la yang spyi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i don med @177b pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang spyi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i don med @177b pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since the universal is perceived, it is not the object of inference, because it does not cause one to engage in activity.

original: spyi brgyud pa de tsam du zad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi brgyud pa de tsam du zad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The universal is not merely a succession of particulars,

original: spyi las spyi rjes su dpog cing de las kyang spyi gzhan dpog pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi las spyi rjes su dpog cing de las kyang spyi gzhan dpog pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the universal is inferred from the universal, and from that another universal, and so on, ad infinitum.

original: de'i phyir mthar yang gsal ba rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsal ba nyid spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar yang gsal ba rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsal ba nyid spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because the particular is ultimately understood, the particular is the universal.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar / brjod pa nyid phyir te dngos min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brjod pa nyid phyir te dngos min //
translated: Because it is expressed, it is not a thing.

original: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because the sense faculties and so on have results.

original: ming sogs brjod na 'chad pa po //
analyzed: ming sogs brjod na 'chad pa po //
translated: When names and so on are expressed,

original: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel phyir //
analyzed: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel phyir //
translated: the speaker and the hearer are related to the expressed meaning.

original: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa can //
analyzed: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa can //
translated: Without a connection with names and so on,

original: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one cannot engage with the meaning.

original: spyi'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni spyi'i shes pas rtogs pa'i spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni spyi'i shes pas rtogs pa'i spyi ma yin no //
translated: The universal form and so on is not a universal that is understood by a consciousness of a universal.

original: gzugs la sogs pa re re'am mtha' dag spyi'i shes pas rtogs grang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa re re'am mtha' dag spyi'i shes pas rtogs grang /
translated: Is it understood by a cognition of each individual form and so on, or is it understood by a cognition of the totality?

original: gal te mtha' dag rtogs na ni de'i tshe dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mtha' dag rtogs na ni de'i tshe dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is understood by the totality, then the collection of sense faculties would be pointless.

original: sgra las skyes pa'i spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa des gsal ba'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sgra las skyes pa'i spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa des gsal ba'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because the cognition of the totality that arises from sound would understand all the individual natures.

original: / mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rtogs ni gsal ba rtogs pa'i don du 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: / mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rtogs ni gsal ba rtogs pa'i don du 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If the understanding of the sense faculties such as the eyes is asserted to be for the purpose of understanding the individual natures,

original: gsal ba de ni mig la sogs pa dang bral yang rtogs pa'i phyir dbang pos ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gsal ba de ni mig la sogs pa dang bral yang rtogs pa'i phyir dbang pos ci zhig bya /
translated: then since that individual nature is understood even without the eyes and so on, what would the sense faculties do?

original: dbang po ni bde ba'i don du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni bde ba'i don du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are asserted to be for the purpose of pleasure.

original: 'di ltar dbang po la brten nas 'gyur ba'i bde ba de ni gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po la brten nas 'gyur ba'i bde ba de ni gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus the pleasure of change that arises in dependence on the sense faculties does not occur elsewhere.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is also not true.

original: de yang sgra nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po med par sgra las ni //
analyzed: de yang sgra nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro // dbang po med par sgra las ni //
translated: That is also understood from sound itself.üîΩWithout the sense faculties,

original: bde skye ma yin bde skye bar //
analyzed: bde skye ma yin bde skye bar //
translated: pleasure does not arise from sound.

original: rtogs tsam yin na sgra las kyang //
analyzed: rtogs tsam yin na sgra las kyang //
translated: If it were merely a cognition, then

original: bde ba de nyid skye ba yin //
analyzed: bde ba de nyid skye ba yin //
translated: pleasure would arise from words.

original: gal te de yang rtogs sam las //
analyzed: gal te de yang rtogs sam las //
translated: If it is a cognition, then

original: bde ba skye ba med ce na //üîΩbde ba skye ba'i ngo bor ni //
analyzed: bde ba skye ba med ce na // bde ba skye ba'i ngo bor ni //
translated: pleasure would not arise.

original: rtogs pa ci ltar de ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa ci ltar de ma yin //
translated: How could a cognitionüîΩnot have the nature of the arising of pleasure?

original: gal te bde ba skye ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs kyang de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba skye ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs kyang de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure is a cognition, but does not have the nature of the arising of pleasure,

original: de ltar gyur na ni rtogs pa gzhan la yang ci zhig yid brten du yod /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni rtogs pa gzhan la yang ci zhig yid brten du yod /
translated: then what can one rely on in the case of other cognitions?

original: rtogs par gyur pa kho na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur pa kho na yod pa yin no //
translated: It is only a cognition that exists.

original: 'on te dbang po'i tshogs don med pa yin yang las kyi dbang gis skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i tshogs don med pa yin yang las kyi dbang gis skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But even if the collection of sense faculties is useless, it is produced by the power of karma.

original: skyes su chug mod mig zhar yang bzhugs mthong bas de 'bras bu med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur dgos na /
analyzed: skyes su chug mod mig zhar yang bzhugs mthong bas de 'bras bu med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur dgos na /
translated: Even if it is produced, since one sees that the eye is useless, it must be understood that it is useless.

original: de lta na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba nyid sgra las rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba nyid sgra las rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the manifestation of sound is not understood from sound.

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni spyi ma @178a * //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni spyi ma @178a * //
translated: Therefore, the nature of form, etc. is not a universal.

original: yin no // de lta na ni 'o na ming la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin pas dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // de lta na ni 'o na ming la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin pas dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since they would be the intrinsic nature of names, etc., the collection of faculties would not be fruitless.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is also untenable.

original: mi ldan 'du byed 'chad po dang // nyan po'am don dang 'brel pa'am //
analyzed: mi ldan 'du byed 'chad po dang // nyan po'am don dang 'brel pa'am //
translated: The speaker, the listener, the meaning, the connection,

original: 'brel med 'chad po la sogs dang ; /'brel na don la 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel med 'chad po la sogs dang ; /'brel na don la 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: the speaker, etc., without a connection, the connection, the engagement with the meaning.

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rtogs na don rtogs pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rtogs na don rtogs pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If the name and the sign that are connected to the speaker and the listener are understood, the meaning is not understood.

original: ma rtogs pa'i don la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i don la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How can one engage with a meaning that is not understood?

original: ma rtogs pa la yang 'jug na ni thams cad la 'jug par thal ba'i phyir dang rtogs pa don med par thal pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la yang 'jug na ni thams cad la 'jug par thal ba'i phyir dang rtogs pa don med par thal pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one engages with what is not understood, then it follows that one would engage with everything, and it follows that understanding would be pointless. That is illogical.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du mtshan ma gang yin pa don gang yin pa de gnyis ni tshul 'dra ba'i phyir gcig rtogs pas kyang gzhan la 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du mtshan ma gang yin pa don gang yin pa de gnyis ni tshul 'dra ba'i phyir gcig rtogs pas kyang gzhan la 'jug pa yin /
translated: But if you think that the sign and the object are similar in aspect, and that by understanding one, the other is also understood,

original: dper na tsitra aa ga da dang / sna tshogs brtson 'grus zhes bya ba'i mtshe ma gnyis las gcig brjod pas der gzhan la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na tsitra aa ga da dang / sna tshogs brtson 'grus zhes bya ba'i mtshe ma gnyis las gcig brjod pas der gzhan la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not the case that by mentioning one of a pair of twins, such as Citraka and Atagada, or Visoka and Visachitra, that the other is also mentioned.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is also untenable.

original: der 'khrul 'dir ni ma 'khrul yin //üîΩ'khrul na dngos po rig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: der 'khrul 'dir ni ma 'khrul yin // 'khrul na dngos po rig mi 'gyur //
translated: There is error there, but not here.üîΩIf there is error, one would not understand the object.

original: 'khrul kyang dngos po rig ces pa //
analyzed: 'khrul kyang dngos po rig ces pa //
translated: If one understands the object, there is no error.

original: 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin //
translated: This is mutually contradictory.

original: gal te ming dang mtshan ma snang ba yin na blo de ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: gal te ming dang mtshan ma snang ba yin na blo de ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
translated: If the name and sign appear, how is that mind erroneous?

original: 'khrul pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say it is erroneous,

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
translated: then it is just without an object.

original: de ltar gyur na ni ming dang / mtshan ma rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni ming dang / mtshan ma rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, one would not understand the name and sign.

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of names and signs does not appear.

original: de la yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if another name and sign were to be understood, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir mtshe ma dag las 'khrul par shes pa la yang ming dang mtshan ma snang ba nyid yin pas dpe ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshe ma dag las 'khrul par shes pa la yang ming dang mtshan ma snang ba nyid yin pas dpe ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the appearance of names and signs is also in the cognition that understands the twins, the example is not established.

original: der yang de rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ji ltar don la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir dpe ni bsgrub bya'i phyogs su bzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: der yang de rtogs pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ji ltar don la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir dpe ni bsgrub bya'i phyogs su bzhag pa nyid do //
translated: And since the cognition engages that very object by understanding it, the dispute ‚ÄúHow does it engage the object?‚Äù also exists there, so the example is just as in the case of the probandum.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni //
translated: Even if one accepts that, it is said:

original: gal te don la tshul 'dra las //
analyzed: gal te don la tshul 'dra las //
translated: If the cognition engages the object through similarity,

original: 'khrul 'jug 'gyur na dus kun dang // yul la 'khrul min shes pa la //üîΩmtshungs min rnam pa de 'dra'i blo //
analyzed: 'khrul 'jug 'gyur na dus kun dang // yul la 'khrul min shes pa la // mtshungs min rnam pa de 'dra'i blo //
translated: then it would always be mistaken, and the cognition would not be non-mistaken with regard to the object.

original: skye phyir gzhan la de med de //
analyzed: skye phyir gzhan la de med de //
translated: Because a cognition of that kind does not arise in others,

original: blo ni khas len med phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni khas len med phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no acceptance of cognition.

original: phyi rol don du snang ba can //
analyzed: phyi rol don du snang ba can //
translated: The cognition that appears as external objects

original: khas len na yang rnam shes @178b las //
analyzed: khas len na yang rnam shes @178b las //
translated: If you accept that, then it follows, absurdly, that consciousness is not a product.üîΩ

original: tha dad pa ni tshad can min //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni tshad can min //
translated: If you accept that, then it is not limited to consciousness.

original: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no established difference.

original: gal te gzhan rtogs kyang phyi rol la 'jug pa 'di tshul 'dra bas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu can yin na de'i tshe dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan rtogs kyang phyi rol la 'jug pa 'di tshul 'dra bas bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu can yin na de'i tshe dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the case that, although it cognizes something else, it is mistaken with respect to external objects because it is produced in a similar way, then it would not be so at all times.

original: mtshe ma dag gcig rtogs pa na dus thams cad du gzhan kho na la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshe ma dag gcig rtogs pa na dus thams cad du gzhan kho na la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When one twin is cognized, at all times the other is not cognized.

original: de la yang 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that it is cognized in that case also.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i tshul 'dra ba yang med de mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yod na yang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa'i tshul 'dra ba yang med de mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro // de yod na yang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed du mi 'gyur te /
translated: And there is no similarity between the embodied and the nonembodied because there is no commonality.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were, it would not be a nonassociated compositional factor because it would be included in the aggregate of form by its very nature of being form.

original: gzhan yang yul 'di nyid du rtogs so zhes yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yul 'di nyid du rtogs so zhes yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it would not be mistaken with respect to its object, thinking, I cognize this very object.

original: de dang gzhan gyi yul dag gi tshul 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang gzhan gyi yul dag gi tshul 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: But the object is not like that.

original: 'on te yul yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yul yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And if the object is not understood by way of its own nature,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: de yang de ming dang mtshan ma 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de ming dang mtshan ma 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is understood by way of the name and the sign, which are confused.

original: de lta na ni 'o na yul zhes bya ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir yul gyi khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na yul zhes bya ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir yul gyi khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then there is no understanding of what is called the object, and so there is no engagement with the particulars of the object.

original: yul med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rtogs pas ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rtogs pas ni yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors that do not have an object do not engage any object, such as form, that is related to the particulars of the object.

original: gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they engage by way of a single conception,

original: gcig tu zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ming dang mtshan ma la 'jug pa'i yul gyi don du yin par rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ming dang mtshan ma la 'jug pa'i yul gyi don du yin par rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: what is this so-called single conception? It is understood to be the object that is the engagement of the name and the sign.

original: ji ltar gzhan la gzhan du rtogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la gzhan du rtogs te /
translated: How is it understood as something else?

original: bum pa ni snam bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: bum pa ni snam bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa med do //
translated: A vase is not understood as having the nature of a woolen cloth.

original: de'i rang bzhin der lhag par zhen par byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin der lhag par zhen par byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the nature of that which is the object of the adherence.

original: 'o na ni lhag par zhen par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi ming dang mtshan ma ni dri tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni lhag par zhen par byas pa gang yin pa de nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi ming dang mtshan ma ni dri tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: But if that is so, then it is just the adherence that is the object of understanding, and not even the mere odor of the name and the sign.

original: gang lhag par zhen par byas pa de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur gyi phyi rol gyi don la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang lhag par zhen par byas pa de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur gyi phyi rol gyi don la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is just the adherence that is the object of engagement, not the external object.

original: ci ste de la ming dang mtshan mar lhag par zhe na pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de la ming dang mtshan mar lhag par zhe na pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the adherence is to the name and sign,üîΩthen since it is just the name and sign that are the object of understanding, how can there be engagement with the external?

original: de ltar yin na ming dang mtshan ma nyid rtogs pa yin pas ci ltar phyi rol la 'jug / nya phyis la dngul du zhen pa ni ji ltar nya phyis la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ming dang mtshan ma nyid rtogs pa yin pas ci ltar phyi rol la 'jug / nya phyis la dngul du zhen pa ni ji ltar nya phyis la 'jug ce na /
translated: How can the adherence to mother-of-pearl as silver be engagement with mother-of-pearl?

original: nya phyis kyang de na yod pa'i phyir dang / yul de yang mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩming dang mtshan ma'i @179a * //
analyzed: nya phyis kyang de na yod pa'i phyir dang / yul de yang mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i phyir ro // ming dang mtshan ma'i @179a * //
translated: Because the mother-of-pearl is there, and that object is apprehended by direct perception.

original: yul ni yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul ni yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the name and sign is not apprehended.

original: yul yongs su 'dzin pa ni yul na gzhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul yongs su 'dzin pa ni yul na gzhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object is grasped as something other than the object.

original: de ni gzhi'i don gyi yul yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzhi'i don gyi yul yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that this is the object of the meaning of the basis, it is not so,

original: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no distinction.

original: nya phyis kyi yul yin gyi dngul gyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nya phyis kyi yul yin gyi dngul gyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as the object is a mother-of-pearl, not silver, so it is here.

original: ma yin te dngul ni med pa'i phyir yul med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin te dngul ni med pa'i phyir yul med pa yin gyi /
translated: It is not so, because silver does not exist, the object does not exist.

original: ming dang mtshan ma ni yul med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma ni yul med pa ma yin no //
translated: But the name and the sign do not not exist as objects.

original: dngul ni mthong bas sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngul ni mthong bas sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Silver is a superimposition of vision.

original: ming dang mtshan ma ni mthong ba med de /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma ni mthong ba med de /
translated: The name and the sign are not seen.

original: de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i dus nyid kyi tshe mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i dus nyid kyi tshe mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen at the time of the superimposition itself.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sgro btags pas 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sgro btags pas 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not an engagement by superimposition.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la mer rtogs pa bzhin du blo 'khrul pas gzung ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la mer rtogs pa bzhin du blo 'khrul pas gzung ba nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not the apprehension by a deluded mind, like the apprehension of a boy as a ghost.

original: shin tu goms pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not because of complete familiarity.

original: shin tu goms so zhes bya ba 'di ga la rtogs te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu goms so zhes bya ba 'di ga la rtogs te tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can you understand the statement ‚ÄúI am very familiar with it‚Äù? Because there is no valid cognition.

original: tshad mas rtogs na de ltar tha snyad bya ba yin gyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs na de ltar tha snyad bya ba yin gyi gzhan du na ma yin no //
translated: If you understand it through valid cognition, then you can make such statements, but not otherwise.

original: gzhan du ni tha snyad 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni tha snyad 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is not tenable to make such statements.

original: de nyid kyis brtag par bya ba yin pa de ni tshad ma med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis brtag par bya ba yin pa de ni tshad ma med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because it is to be investigated, it is not without valid cognition,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de lta ma yin yang tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because we will explain that even if it is not so, it is still designated.

original: gang gi sgra las don la reg pa med pa can rang gi rnam par nyid kyis shes pa skye ba de'i ltar na don la 'jug ce na /üîΩshes ste shes pa'i rnam par brjod par bya ba yin pa la ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi sgra las don la reg pa med pa can rang gi rnam par nyid kyis shes pa skye ba de'i ltar na don la 'jug ce na / shes ste shes pa'i rnam par brjod par bya ba yin pa la ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the word is not in contact with the object, and cognition arises from its own form, then how does it engage the object?

original: 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the same in the case of the expression ‚ÄúI know,‚Äù because a mistaken cognition arises.

original: bag chags kyi stobs kyis de ltar skye ba na rang gi ngo bo nyid la khyad par can gyi yul na gnas pa'i don du rlom pas tha snyad 'dogs pa po 'jug par byed pa'i phyir 'di la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs kyis de ltar skye ba na rang gi ngo bo nyid la khyad par can gyi yul na gnas pa'i don du rlom pas tha snyad 'dogs pa po 'jug par byed pa'i phyir 'di la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: When it arises by the power of habitual tendencies, it causes the person who imputes the conventions to engage in the object that is qualified by its own nature. Therefore there is not the slightest contradiction here.

original: 'di ltar ci srid rang gi ngo bo la don du sgro btags pas 'jug pa byed pa de tsam gyis 'di yi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci srid rang gi ngo bo la don du sgro btags pas 'jug pa byed pa de tsam gyis 'di yi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: As long as one engages in imputing a meaning to one‚Äôs own nature, the convention is complete in that respect. What is the use of anything else?

original: ming dang mtshan ma don du rlom pa la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma don du rlom pa la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of conceptual thoughts that conceive names and signs as real things.

original: rtogs nas don gyi rnam pa nyid du lhag par zhen par byed dam /
analyzed: rtogs nas don gyi rnam pa nyid du lhag par zhen par byed dam /
translated: Having realized them, one conceives of them as the aspects of objects.

original: 'on te ma rtogs par gal te sgra'i rnam par shes pas ming dang mtshan ma rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs par gal te sgra'i rnam par shes pas ming dang mtshan ma rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin na /
translated: Or, without realizing them, if the consciousness of a word realizes the nature of a name and a sign,

original: ji ltar de don du rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de don du rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how could it realize them as real things?

original: rang gi ngo bo la rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam par lhag par zhen @179b par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam par lhag par zhen @179b par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The realization of its own nature is not said to be the excessive adherence to the form of another.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni de ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni de ma yin te /
translated: It is not in another form,

original: rnam pa tha dad pa kho na tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa kho na tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a different form is precisely different.

original: de'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, name and sign are not the conceptualization of the object.

original: rnam pa 'di ni don gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni don gyi ma yin te /
translated: This form is not of the object,

original: de la don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object there.

original: ming dang mtshan ma yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma yang ma yin te ;
translated: It is not name and sign,

original: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable.

original: rnam pa de ni shes pa nyid kyi yin pa de mchog yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de ni shes pa nyid kyi yin pa de mchog yin no //
translated: That form is of consciousness itself, and that is the highest.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa de nyid don nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi bar gyi sha lhag pa'i ming dang mtshan mas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa de nyid don nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi bar gyi sha lhag pa'i ming dang mtshan mas ci zhig bya /
translated: That form of consciousness is understood to be the object itself. What is the use of the excessive name and sign in between?

original: shes pa ni brgyud nas de las skyes pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rigs na ;
analyzed: shes pa ni brgyud nas de las skyes pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rigs na ;
translated: Consciousness is said to possess the form of the object because it arises from that indirectly.

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i don gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i don gyi rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin don gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid la ni tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no /
translated: How do you know that the form of the object is the name and the sign? There is no valid cognition at all that the form of the object is associated with the name.

original: ci ste don gyi rnam pa ni ming dang mtshan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste don gyi rnam pa ni ming dang mtshan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the form of the object is the name and the sign,

original: 'o na ni de nyid don yin pas dbang po'i tshogs pa don med pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste yang de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid don yin pas dbang po'i tshogs pa don med pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro // ci ste yang de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pas na /
translated: then that itself is the object, so the collection of sense faculties is not purposeless.

original: dbang po'i tshogs ni don bya ba byed pa 'dzin pa'am 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs ni don bya ba byed pa 'dzin pa'am 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the collection of sense faculties apprehends or has a result that is the performance of the object‚Äôs function,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: don bya ba byed pa ma bzung ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa ma bzung ba'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the performance of the object‚Äôs function is not apprehended, it would not be the cause of engagement.

original: lhag par sgro btags pa las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that engagement is due to superimposition,

original: lhag par sgro btags pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa de ni shes pa'i rnam pa nyid do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained that superimposition is just the form of consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na ni der yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni der yang ming dang mtshan ma gzhan yin la /
translated: If it were not so, then the name and the sign would be different,

original: de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas lan du mi rung ngo //
