translated: and since they would be different from that, there would be an infinite regress, and that is not a satisfactory answer.

original: de la yang 'khrul pa nyid du 'dod na ni ming dang mtshan ma la tshad ma med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'khrul pa nyid du 'dod na ni ming dang mtshan ma la tshad ma med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you accept that it is error itself, then name and sign would not be valid cognitions.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ni don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ni don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
translated: An erroneous cognition does not establish an object.

original: rnam pa yang de nyid don rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa yang de nyid don rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the aspect itself establishes the object.

original: ma yin te ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no exclusion.

original: mdo sde pa bzhin du ming dang mtshan mar sgrub pa la ni ldog par grub pa med de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa bzhin du ming dang mtshan mar sgrub pa la ni ldog par grub pa med de /
translated: As in the case of the Sautrantikas, there is no established exclusion in the establishment of name and sign,

original: ming dang mtshan ma'i yul can du 'dod pa'i blo ni yid la byed pa la sogs pa tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma'i yul can du 'dod pa'i blo ni yid la byed pa la sogs pa tsam las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the awareness that is asserted to have name and sign as its object arises from mere attention and so on.

original: shes pa don gyi rnam pa can du khas len na ni de don gyi rnam pa nyid na par rigs so //
analyzed: shes pa don gyi rnam pa can du khas len na ni de don gyi rnam pa nyid na par rigs so //
translated: If you accept that consciousness has the aspect of an object, then it is reasonable that it is the aspect of that object.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa mi gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa mi gsal zhe na /
translated: Why is the aspect not clear?

original: ma yin @180a * //
analyzed: ma yin @180a * //
translated: It is not so,

original: te ; tshogs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa cha 'ga' zhig skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; tshogs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa cha 'ga' zhig skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates a certain part of the aspect of the collection.

original: gang las rnam pa gang 'gyur ba de bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las rnam pa gang 'gyur ba de bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: That which is the aspect of something does not become that thing in all ways,

original: cha 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba'i bu bzhin no //
analyzed: cha 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba'i bu bzhin no //
translated: but it is like a son who is similar in some ways.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad don gyi rnam nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad don gyi rnam nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the aspect of all consciousnesses is not the entity of the object,

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa de ni don nyid yin no //
translated: then that which appears as the aspect of blue and so on is the entity of the object.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni don yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni don yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In that case, all aspects of blue and so on are objects but not consciousness.

original: des na shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin gyi rang gi rnam pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir gang las 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: des na shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin gyi rang gi rnam pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir gang las 'khrul pa yin /
translated: Therefore all consciousnesses are endowed with objects, but since there is no aspect at all that is not consciousness, from what is there error?

original: rnam pa 'di ni shes pa ma yin te phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni shes pa ma yin te phyi rol gyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This aspect is not consciousness because it appears as an external entity.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: shes kun don ldan phyir zhe na //
analyzed: shes kun don ldan phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say that all consciousnesses have objects because they are consciousnesses,

original: 'thad min rmi sogs rnam gzhan du //
analyzed: 'thad min rmi sogs rnam gzhan du //
translated: That is not so, because in dreams and so on, consciousnesses occur without objects.

original: mthong phyir 'du byed las kyang min //
analyzed: mthong phyir 'du byed las kyang min //
translated: Nor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,

original: sngo la sogs pa snang phyir ro //
analyzed: sngo la sogs pa snang phyir ro //
translated: Because blue and so on appear.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause blue and so on are not mental factors.

original: thog med phyir na sngo sogs min //
analyzed: thog med phyir na sngo sogs min //
translated: Nor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,

original: rung yul gnas pas mi shes pa //
analyzed: rung yul gnas pas mi shes pa //
translated: Because they are not known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,

original: rang nyid shes phyir de shes yin //üîΩdes ni ming sogs brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rang nyid shes phyir de shes yin // des ni ming sogs brjod pa yin //
translated: Because they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,

original: shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa ga las yin /üîΩmdun na gnas pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba tsam gyis ni don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa ga las yin / mdun na gnas pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba tsam gyis ni don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.

original: de lta yin no zhe na ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin no zhe na ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,

original: mtha' dag dmigs pa dang bcas bas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag dmigs pa dang bcas bas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.üîΩNor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition of the object.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin yang don bya ba mi 'thob pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du tha snyad bye do zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin yang don bya ba mi 'thob pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du tha snyad bye do zhe na /
translated: Nor can you say that they have objects because they are mental factors,üîΩBecause they are known by the cognition

original: de ltan 'o na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin yang don bya ba thob pas thad mar tha snyad bya bar ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin yang don bya ba thob pas thad mar tha snyad bya bar ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: If that is so, then why not accept that even though there is no object, one can still conventionally speak of the attainment of the object‚Äôs function?

original: 'di la de kho na nyid ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la de kho na nyid ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is reality here?

original: dmigs pa med pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the nonexistence of the nonexistent object.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa dag na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin yang mdun na gnas pa 'dzin pa mthong ba'i phyir na gzhan du yang de mthong ba las dmigs pa dang bcas par ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa dag na dmigs pa med pa nyid yin yang mdun na gnas pa 'dzin pa mthong ba'i phyir na gzhan du yang de mthong ba las dmigs pa dang bcas par ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, even though there is no object in dreams and so on, since one sees the apprehension of something present in front, one cannot accept that there is an object in other cases either, because one sees it.

original: bzlog par ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog par ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
translated: The response, ‚ÄúWhy not reverse it?‚Äù is also not a response,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of an object is not established.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni 'gar yang grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni 'gar yang grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The existence of an object is not established anywhere.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is the waking state,‚Äù

original: 'o na ni gnas skabs de bzhin du med @180b pa'i phyir der shes pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnas skabs de bzhin du med @180b pa'i phyir der shes pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it does not exist in that way, consciousness would have no object in that state.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is not established.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na rnam pa gzhan du myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na rnam pa gzhan du myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in dreams and so on, the object is experienced in a different way.

original: ci ste rmi lam gyi shes pa yang ming dang mtshan ma la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam gyi shes pa yang ming dang mtshan ma la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that even the consciousness in a dream has a name and sign as its object,

original: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: then it is not established that the consciousness in a dream is without an object.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni ming dang mtshan ma la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa ni ming dang mtshan ma la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness in a dream does not have a name and sign as its object,

original: sngon po'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ming dang mtshan ma ni rnam pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir dang / ming dang mtshan ma ni rnam pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it observes the aspect of blue, and because a name and sign do not have that aspect.

original: der sngon po la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: der sngon po la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to say that blue and so on are the observed objects there,

original: rnam pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de ni sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that aspect is not compatible with blue and so on.

original: bden pa'i sngon po la gos pa de la ni thogs pa med pa nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bden pa'i sngon po la gos pa de la ni thogs pa med pa nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The real blue that is clung to there does not exist without obstruction,

original: rmi lam gyi sngon po ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi sngon po ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the blue of a dream is the opposite of that.

original: de ltar yangs phyogs shin tu dog par yang glang po che'i khyu mchog mthong ba'i phyir dang / gang gi nang na gnas pas mthong ba der ni glang po che'i khyu'i go skabs med pa'i phyir dang / bcad pa'i nang nas phyir 'gro ba'i yang nus pa me pa'i phyir dang lang po che'i khyu'i 'bras bu kha bad bshig pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yangs phyogs shin tu dog par yang glang po che'i khyu mchog mthong ba'i phyir dang / gang gi nang na gnas pas mthong ba der ni glang po che'i khyu'i go skabs med pa'i phyir dang / bcad pa'i nang nas phyir 'gro ba'i yang nus pa me pa'i phyir dang lang po che'i khyu'i 'bras bu kha bad bshig pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the elephant herd is seen in a very small place, because there is no room for the elephant herd in the place where it is seen by those who are inside, because it is impossible for it to come out from the inside of the cut, and because the result of the elephant herd, such as the dung, is not seen.

original: me'i 'bras bu tshig pa la sog pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu tshig pa la sog pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the result of fire, such as burning, is not seen.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa thogs pa med par de lta bur gyur pa kho na skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa thogs pa med par de lta bur gyur pa kho na skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If form and so on arise in that way without obstruction,

original: de lta yin na ni der sad pa thams cad kyis ci'i phyir ma mthong ba de la de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni der sad pa thams cad kyis ci'i phyir ma mthong ba de la de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: then why is it not seen by all who are awake? Because the assembly of conditions is not similar.

original: rmi lam gyi gzhug sla sogs pa mthong bar rgyu ni gnyid tshogs pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gzhug sla sogs pa mthong bar rgyu ni gnyid tshogs pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of seeing the dream objects such as water is sleep,üîΩthen why is it not seen by all who are asleep?

original: gal te gnyid tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin na thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gnyid tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin na thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If sleep were a collection, then everyone would see the same dream.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: yul de nyid du gnyid log pa rnams kyis rmi lam gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de nyid du gnyid log pa rnams kyis rmi lam gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who fall asleep in the same place see different dreams.

original: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ni 'du byed kyi khyad par gyis yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba ni 'du byed kyi khyad par gyis yin te /
translated: The difference in the way things are seen is due to the difference in the way things are formed.

original: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na gang gis 'du byed pa yod pa de lta bu nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na gang gis 'du byed pa yod pa de lta bu nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyis thams cad mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that everyone sees everything, because in the waking state, one sees only what one‚Äôs karmic formations cause one to see.

original: 'du byed ni 'dus byas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las tha dad pa gzhan med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'dus byas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las tha dad pa gzhan med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But karmic formations are not different from the stream of consciousness that is being formed, are they?

original: des na de las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pas yul nye bar @181a * //
analyzed: des na de las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pas yul nye bar @181a * //
translated: Therefore, since consciousness arises from that stream, it follows that consciousness would perceive everything that is near it,

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir nye ba thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir nye ba thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: because it would arise from everything that is near it.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa na nye ba rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig 'dzin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa na nye ba rnams las kyang 'ga' zhig 'dzin par ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: When visual consciousness and so on arise, it is not tenable that they apprehend some things that are near and others that are not.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam du ni 'ga' yang skyes pa med de rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam du ni 'ga' yang skyes pa med de rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in dreams, nothing arises because they apprehend different aspects.

original: sngon gyi rang bzhin ma mthong ba la ni rnam pa tha dad par 'thad pa yin te /üîΩsngon mthong ba gang gis 'du byed yod pa de nyid des mthong ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ni sngon med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi rang bzhin ma mthong ba la ni rnam pa tha dad par 'thad pa yin te / sngon mthong ba gang gis 'du byed yod pa de nyid des mthong ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ni sngon med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is tenable that different aspects are apprehended by one who does not see the previous nature.

original: mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: That very one who sees the existence of formations through previous seeing sees them at that time, but not through another, because that does not exist previously.

original: 'o na ni phyin ci log tu snang ba yin te /üîΩsngon gyi dus de nyid de'i dus su mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni phyin ci log tu snang ba yin te / sngon gyi dus de nyid de'i dus su mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it is an erroneous appearance,üîΩbecause that previous time is seen at that time.

original: de'i dus nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because that time itself does not exist.üîΩTherefore, it is an erroneous appearance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log tu snang ba yin no zhe na 'di la brjod pa /üîΩci ga snang ba log pa'am //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log tu snang ba yin no zhe na 'di la brjod pa / ci ga snang ba log pa'am //
translated: Here, we say:üîΩDo you assert that an erroneous appearance

original: yang na log pa snang ba 'dod //
analyzed: yang na log pa snang ba 'dod //
translated: or an error is an appearance?

original: gal te phyin ci log snang na //
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log snang na //
translated: If it is an erroneous appearance,

original: de la phyin ci log yod min //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log yod min //
translated: then it does not exist in error.

original: gal te phyin ci log snang ba yin na de la ni phyin ci log nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log snang ba yin na de la ni phyin ci log nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is an erroneous appearance, then it does not exist in error.

original: phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is error,

original: thams cad kyis de ltar 'dzin par thal /
analyzed: thams cad kyis de ltar 'dzin par thal /
translated: then it follows that everyone would apprehend it as such.

original: de dag kyang phyin ci log snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang phyin ci log snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is an erroneous appearance,

original: 'di ni mtshar po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshar po ma yin te /
translated: this is not surprising.

original: gal te thams cad log pa ni //
analyzed: gal te thams cad log pa ni //
translated: If everything is erroneous,

original: snang na log pa gang la ltos //
analyzed: snang na log pa gang la ltos //
translated: then what is the error that is seen?

original: 'khrul pa nyid du ltos nas ni //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du ltos nas ni //
translated: Error is seen in dependence on non-error,

original: 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba min //
translated: but error does not occur in non-error.

original: 'khrul pa nyid la ltos nas ni //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid la ltos nas ni //
translated: Error is seen in dependence on error,üîΩbut error does not occur in error.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de las gzhan pa dag kyang 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang / gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de las gzhan pa dag kyang 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin no // gzhan yang / gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa yi //
translated: But it is not said that those that are not like that are error.üîΩMoreover,üîΩThe erroneous appearance that is desired by others

original: log snang de ni gzhan la 'ongs //
analyzed: log snang de ni gzhan la 'ongs //
translated: comes from others.

original: 'dam du ltung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dam du ltung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not fall into the swamp.

original: mnyam pa de ni 'dam du ltung //
analyzed: mnyam pa de ni 'dam du ltung //
translated: The equal one falls into the swamp.

original: rmi lam gyi mthong ba phyin ci log snang ba yin par bsgrub par bya'o snyam pas sad pa phyin ci log pa snang bas bsgrubs so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi mthong ba phyin ci log snang ba yin par bsgrub par bya'o snyam pas sad pa phyin ci log pa snang bas bsgrubs so //
translated: Therefore, the dream-seer, who is the subject, is established as being the object.

original: ci ste snang ba phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste snang ba phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance is erroneous,

original: 'o na ni yang phyin ci log nyid 'di ni snang ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni yang phyin ci log nyid 'di ni snang ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: then the error itself is just the appearance,

original: don ni ma yin pas don de nyid kyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir phyin ci log par snang ba ci yod //
analyzed: don ni ma yin pas don de nyid kyi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir phyin ci log par snang ba ci yod //
translated: and it is not the object. Therefore, since the object appears as it is, what is there that appears erroneously?

original: phyin ci log ces bya ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni snang ba yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya ba gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin ni snang ba yin no //
translated: The nature of what is called ‚Äúerror‚Äù is appearance.

original: gang gis gzhan yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba snang ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ni gzhan gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba snang ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ni gzhan gyis ma yin te /
translated: And another appearance, which is not another, is the nature of that, by which one understands it to be that way.

original: shes pa rnams ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But the cognitions are different.

original: de lta na ni 'o na shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa @181b yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi mthong ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa @181b yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi mthong ba dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then since the cognition itself is understood to be that way, the dream-seer is not without an object.

original: 'di ltar / dus der don de yod min par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dus der don de yod min par //
translated: At that time, that object does not exist.

original: 'du byed las ni de ltar skyes //
analyzed: 'du byed las ni de ltar skyes //
translated: It arises in that way from the formative forces.

original: yod min mthong ba ma yin te //
analyzed: yod min mthong ba ma yin te //
translated: It is not seen as nonexistent.üîΩConsciousness itself is aware of itself.

original: shes pa kho nas rang nyid rig / yul gzhan na gnas pa yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba nyid rigs pa yin yang /
analyzed: shes pa kho nas rang nyid rig / yul gzhan na gnas pa yul gzhan du mthong ba zhes bya ba nyid rigs pa yin yang /
translated: It is reasonable to say that what exists in one place is seen in another place,

original: de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa dus gzhan dang 'brel pa go ci ltar mthong bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa dus gzhan dang 'brel pa go ci ltar mthong bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: but how could that which does not exist at that time be seen as related to another time?

original: de'i phyir sngon mthong ba las de ltar skyes pa'i shes pa kho na rig pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon mthong ba las de ltar skyes pa'i shes pa kho na rig pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only the consciousness that arises in that way from seeing the object previously that is aware of itself, not the object,

original: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: gal te dus gzhan yang dus de yin par mthong na ni //
analyzed: gal te dus gzhan yang dus de yin par mthong na ni //
translated: If you see another time as that time,

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi ka ba la sogs pa mthong ba thams cad du phyin ci log tu snang ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi ka ba la sogs pa mthong ba thams cad du phyin ci log tu snang ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then all the appearances of pillars and so on in the waking state would be mistaken appearances.

original: ma yin te de la gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te de la gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because there is no evidence to contradict them.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyang phyin ci log tu snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyang phyin ci log tu snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: And isn‚Äôt the absence of an object of harm also just an erroneous appearance?

original: don thob pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don thob pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not an erroneous appearance because it is obtained as an object,

original: don thob pa yang phyin ci log tu snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: don thob pa yang phyin ci log tu snang ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt the obtained object also just an erroneous appearance?

original: don yod pa la phyin ci log tu snang bar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don yod pa la phyin ci log tu snang bar ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be an erroneous appearance with respect to an existent object?

original: don mthong ba nyid la ji ltar thob par byed /üîΩde'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don mthong ba nyid la ji ltar thob par byed / de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is obtained by seeing the object,üîΩhow can it be obtained at that time, since it does not exist at that time?

original: med na ci ltar rig / gzhan gyi tshe na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: med na ci ltar rig / gzhan gyi tshe na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is known because it exists at another time,

original: 'o na ji ltar ma thob /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ma thob /
translated: how can it not be obtained?

original: gzhan gyi tshe nyid yod pa'i phyir te de ltar ni med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe nyid yod pa'i phyir te de ltar ni med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not obtained because it exists at another time,

original: 'o na ji ltar mthong /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mthong /
translated: how can it be seen?

original: de'i dus kyi rang bzhin gyis thob pa yang de'i dus su ci ste med /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi rang bzhin gyis thob pa yang de'i dus su ci ste med /
translated: If you say that it is seen because it exists at that time, how can it not exist at that time?

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not seen because it is not possible,

original: mthong bar ci ltar nus /
analyzed: mthong bar ci ltar nus /
translated: how can it be seen?

original: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen because it is seen,

original: ci zhig mthong ba de nyid mi shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci zhig mthong ba de nyid mi shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that one does not know what one sees?üîΩIt is seen, but it is not known.üîΩIt is known, but it is not seen.üîΩIt is not the case that one does not know what one sees.

original: ngo shes pa'i phyir mthong ba 'di ni sngon gyi yin no zhes nges so zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i phyir mthong ba 'di ni sngon gyi yin no zhes nges so zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: It is known that this seeing is of what was seen previously.

original: rmi lam dang skye ba gzhan mthong ba la ngo shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam dang skye ba gzhan mthong ba la ngo shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no recognition of what is seen in a dream or in another life.

original: ngo shes par gyur pa gzhan dang chos mthun pa las der yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ngo shes par gyur pa gzhan dang chos mthun pa las der yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that recognition occurs through similarity to what was seen previously,

original: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then recognition would not occur in regard to a city of gandharvas, etc.

original: de la ni ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Recognition does not occur in regard to that.

original: de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni /
translated: If that were so,

original: thams cad sngon ma mthong ba nyid ngo shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad sngon ma mthong ba nyid ngo shes par bya ba yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then everything would be recognized as what was seen previously,

original: da ltar ba mthong ba ni ma yin par 'gyur 'dis ni dran pa nyams pa yang bshad pa yin no //üîΩ'jig rten pa ma yin pa yang @182a * //
analyzed: da ltar ba mthong ba ni ma yin par 'gyur 'dis ni dran pa nyams pa yang bshad pa yin no // 'jig rten pa ma yin pa yang @182a * //
translated: and it would not be recognized as seen in the present. This also explains the case of impaired memory.

original: 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin te /
translated: This also explains the case of non-worldly recognition.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa ma yin pa gang yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa ma yin pa gang yin /
translated: For what is non-worldly recognition?

original: thun mong ma yin pa gzhan gyis blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa gzhan gyis blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not seen by another, because it is not common,

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: de ni shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is consciousness itself,

original: rung ba'i yul na 'dug pa gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na 'dug pa gzhan gyis mi shes pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not known by another who is in a suitable place, like the form of the object.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir don nyid yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir don nyid yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object itself, because it is grasped as the object, and not consciousness,

original: de la gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dzin pa ni med de /
analyzed: de la gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dzin pa ni med de /
translated: then we reply: There is no grasping of it as the object.

original: rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is grasped as its own nature.

original: don de ni rang gi ngo bor yin gyi gzung bar bya ba nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don de ni rang gi ngo bor yin gyi gzung bar bya ba nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the object as its own nature, but not as the object.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were the object,

original: gzung bar bya ba'i don du snang ba las gzhan med pa /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i don du snang ba las gzhan med pa /
translated: it would not be different from the appearance as the object.

original: yod pa ni de nyid yin pa'i phyir don zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: yod pa ni de nyid yin pa'i phyir don zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Since it exists as that, there would be no object called the object.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni don nye bar mtshon pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni don nye bar mtshon pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin na /
translated: The form of the object is the indication of the object, but it is not that itself.

original: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Because one thing is indicated by another, this is absurd.

original: don snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because a cognition that has an object arises.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: 'di ni skra shad la sogs don min te //
analyzed: 'di ni skra shad la sogs don min te //
translated: Because it is not an object, like the cognition of floating hairs, etc.

original: don du mos pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don du mos pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no belief in an object.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: 'dis ni ming la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ming la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of name, etc.

original: gzhan yang shes pa thams cad mdun na gnas par snang ba yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa thams cad mdun na gnas par snang ba yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since all cognitions appear as if they existed in the present,

original: 'di la ni phyin ci log par snang ba yin la 'di la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni phyin ci log par snang ba yin la 'di la ni ma yin no //
translated: how can one say that this one appears erroneously and that one does not?

original: 'di la ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa snang la de la ni ma yin no zhes gang las 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni 'jig rten pa ma yin pa snang la de la ni ma yin no zhes gang las 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: How can one say that this one appears as non-worldly and that one does not?

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo 'dod pa //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo 'dod pa //
translated: The cognition of eye, etc. is accepted.

original: de nyid don ldan gang gis 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid don ldan gang gis 'dod //
translated: By what is that accepted as having an object?

original: gal te don nus mthong phyir na //
analyzed: gal te don nus mthong phyir na //
translated: If it is because of seeing the capacity of the object,

original: gzhan pa don med can thob 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan pa don med can thob 'gyur //
translated: then the other, which is without an object, is established.

original: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i blo phyin ci ma log par snang ba gang yin pa de nyid don dang ldan pa don nye bas bskyed par gang gis 'dod de 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig la sogs pa'i blo phyin ci ma log par snang ba gang yin pa de nyid don dang ldan pa don nye bas bskyed par gang gis 'dod de 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: Moreover, what is the reason for asserting that the nonerroneous appearance of the eye consciousness and so on is generated by the object that is near to it?

original: snang ba nyid du ni khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba nyid du ni khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: There is no difference in the mere appearance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las don gyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las don gyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see the potency of the object through positive and negative concomitance.

original: 'di ltar don de sngar gzhan gyis mthong ba'am rang nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don de sngar gzhan gyis mthong ba'am rang nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas shes pa yin la /
translated: Thus, if the object was previously seen by another or known through inference,

original: phyis kyang thob pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyang thob pa yin te /
translated: it is obtained later.

original: des na don gyi nus pa mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na don gyi nus pa mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, we see the potency of the object.

original: gal te de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni /
translated: If that were so,

original: gzhan gang la de lta bu'i tshogs pa med pa'i shes pa de ni don med pa can 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gang la de lta bu'i tshogs pa med pa'i shes pa de ni don med pa can 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consciousness of one who lacks such a collection would obtain an object that does not exist.

original: 'di ltar 'di la ni don med pa 'di la ni yod do zhes bya @182b ba'i blo ni tha snyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la ni don med pa 'di la ni yod do zhes bya @182b ba'i blo ni tha snyad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the thought that this is without an object and that is with an object is conventional.

original: blo 'di ni mi slu ba yang yin te /
analyzed: blo 'di ni mi slu ba yang yin te /
translated: This thought is also nondeceptive.

original: 'di ltar bdag la ni shes pa tsam zhig skyes kyi 'di la don yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la ni shes pa tsam zhig skyes kyi 'di la don yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a mere cognition arises for me, but there is no object here.

original: 'dir bdag la 'di ltar snang ba ni sngon goms pa'i mthu las yin no snyam gyi /
analyzed: 'dir bdag la 'di ltar snang ba ni sngon goms pa'i mthu las yin no snyam gyi /
translated: I think that this appears to me in this way due to the power of prior habituation.

original: de bdag gis mthong ba'am bdag gis dran no zhe'am don 'di ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bdag gis mthong ba'am bdag gis dran no zhe'am don 'di ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: But I do not think, ‚ÄúI see this,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI remember this,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis object is not of the world.‚Äù

original: gnod par byed pa gang gis 'jig rten pa ma yin par rtogs pa de nyid kyis don med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa gang gis 'jig rten pa ma yin par rtogs pa de nyid kyis don med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the very fact that it is understood to be not of the world, it is understood to be meaningless.

original: 'jig rten pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is understood to be of the world, it is not not of the world.

original: de la phyin ci log tu snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would appear erroneously to it.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not of the world,

original: ma yin te /üîΩthug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te / thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so.üîΩBecause it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste thun mong ma yin pa nyid du rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste thun mong ma yin pa nyid du rtog pa yin te /
translated: If you think that it is not shared,

original: 'di gzhan gyis rtogs so snyam pa'i rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis rtogs so snyam pa'i rtog pa ni med do //
translated: then there is no thought, ‚ÄúOthers understand this.‚Äù

original: don gyi yul can mi shes pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa yin pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi yul can mi shes pa la ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa yin pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But when the object is not known, the conceptual thought is understood to be an inference.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'dir don gzhan med pa de nyid la rtogs pa 'di 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'dir don gzhan med pa de nyid la rtogs pa 'di 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If that is so, then this conceptual thought is about the mere absence of an object,

original: 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no snyam gyi don yin no snyam du rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no snyam gyi don yin no snyam du rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is a mere conceptual thought, not a conceptual thought that the object exists.

original: de'i phyir 'chad pa po dang nyam pa po dag dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'i ming la sogs pa snang bas dmigs pa dang bcas par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chad pa po dang nyam pa po dag dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'i ming la sogs pa snang bas dmigs pa dang bcas par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the conceptual thought has an object, since the name, etc. that are related to the speaker and the listener appear.

original: 'brel med na yang 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel med na yang 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: If there is no relation, there is no engagement.

original: gal te don dang 'brel ldan yin //
analyzed: gal te don dang 'brel ldan yin //
translated: If there is a relation with the object,

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs brjod bya min //
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs brjod bya min //
translated: the past and future are not objects of expression,

original: don dang de ni zad phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang de ni zad phyir ro //
translated: because the object and that [relation] have ceased.

original: gal te ming dang mtshan ma don dang 'brel par khas len na /
analyzed: gal te ming dang mtshan ma don dang 'brel par khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that the name and the sign are related to the object,

original: de'i tshe mi 'jug pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi 'jug pa kho na ste /
translated: then at that time there is no engagement,

original: gang gi phyir de ni don dang lhan cig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni don dang lhan cig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that [relation] has ceased together with the object.

original: 'brel pa med pa la ni shin tu yang 'jug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa la ni shin tu yang 'jug pa med pa yin no //
translated: But if there is no relation, there is no engagement at all.

original: gang la don dang 'brel kyang 'ba' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir mi 'jug par thal ba de la 'brel pa med na ni shin tu yang mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang la don dang 'brel kyang 'ba' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir mi 'jug par thal ba de la 'brel pa med na ni shin tu yang mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: If there is no relation, there is no engagement at all, even if the object is present, because of the absence of the object‚Äôs aspect.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the past and future do not exist.

original: gal te ming dang mtshan ma yod pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te ming dang mtshan ma yod pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if there is a name and a sign,

original: don la ni mi 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: don la ni mi 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: there is no engagement with the object,

original: don gyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspect of the object is absent.

original: gzhan rtogs pas gzhan du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pas gzhan du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And one does not engage one object on the basis of understanding another object.

original: lhag pa ni bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa ni bshad pa yin no //
translated: The rest is self-evident.

original: sgra yi spyi ni brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra yi spyi ni brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the universal of sound is expressed,

original: gal te thal bar mi 'dod na //üîΩde min spyi @183a * //
analyzed: gal te thal bar mi 'dod na // de min spyi @183a * //
translated: if you do not accept the consequence,

original: ni yan 'gar ba //
analyzed: ni yan 'gar ba //
translated: then the universal is not a universal,üîΩbecause it is not expressed separately.

original: brjod med phyir ro brjod na yang //
analyzed: brjod med phyir ro brjod na yang //
translated: If it is expressed,

original: de mtshungs min dang gsal ba min //
analyzed: de mtshungs min dang gsal ba min //
translated: it is not the same as that, nor is it a manifestation.

original: des na rtag tu dmigs 'gyur te //
analyzed: des na rtag tu dmigs 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore, it is always perceived,

original: rtag nyid phyir ro gal te yang //
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir ro gal te yang //
translated: because it is permanent. If you say that

original: gsal las mngon sum la gsal yin //
analyzed: gsal las mngon sum la gsal yin //
translated: The clear is the manifest.

original: bdag la shes pa bskyed pa la //
analyzed: bdag la shes pa bskyed pa la //
translated: The capacity to generate cognition

original: nus pa gang de nus nyid yin //
analyzed: nus pa gang de nus nyid yin //
translated: with regard to itself is its capacity.

original: gal te 'ga' tshe nus med na //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' tshe nus med na //
translated: If it is not capable at one time,

original: de ni kun tshe nus med 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni kun tshe nus med 'gyur //
translated: it will not be capable at any time.

original: gal te spyi sgra'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi sgra'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin na /
translated: If the universal is the object of a cognition of a word,

original: spyi de'i yan 'gar ba'am gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi de'i yan 'gar ba'am gzhan du 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: is the universal apprehended as separate from or as the same as the particular?

original: gal te 'ba' zhig 'dzin na ni gsal ba med par yang shes par ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig 'dzin na ni gsal ba med par yang shes par ni 'gyur na /
translated: If it is apprehended as separate, then cognition would occur even in the absence of the particular.

original: 'on kyang 'das pa la sogs pa ni rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'das pa la sogs pa ni rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not so.

original: spyi ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The universal is the nature of the past, etc.

original: gal te spyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs par tha dad du byed cing lhag par zhen par byed pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs par tha dad du byed cing lhag par zhen par byed pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: If the universal is endowed with the particular of the past, etc., then it is distinguished as past, etc., and is also conceived as such.

original: de lta yin na gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang lhan cig pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin na gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang lhan cig pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be apprehended as existing together with the particular, which has the nature of the present.

original: gsal ba 'das pa la sogs pa la ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal ba 'das pa la sogs pa la ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rtog par 'gyur //
translated: Since the nature of the manifest does not exist in the past, etc., how could the nature of the past, etc. be imagined in terms of the nature of the manifest, past, etc.?

original: de'i rang zhin yul du ma byas par ni gzhan de'i rang bzhin du 'dzin nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang zhin yul du ma byas par ni gzhan de'i rang bzhin du 'dzin nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And without taking its nature as an object, one cannot apprehend another as having that nature.

original: ci ste spyi 'ba' zhig gzung ba la yang tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe yang skyon gzhan yin te de de'i spyir mi 'gyur ba dang / des gsal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde med par rang dbang du gzung ba de ni 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste spyi 'ba' zhig gzung ba la yang tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe yang skyon gzhan yin te de de'i spyir mi 'gyur ba dang / des gsal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro // de med par rang dbang du gzung ba de ni 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the mere universal is apprehended, and there is designation, then there is another error: it would not be the universal of that, and it would not manifest that.

original: bsnyad pa'am des gsal bar bya ba yin par 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyad pa'am des gsal bar bya ba yin par 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is apprehended independently without that, then it would not be designated or manifested by that.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa'i snang ba ni rang shes pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa'i snang ba ni rang shes pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The illumination of a lamp, etc. is not a manifestor, since it is the cause of the cognition of itself.

original: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par spyi yan 'gar ba rtog pa med na ni gsal bas gsal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par spyi yan 'gar ba rtog pa med na ni gsal bas gsal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the universal is not apprehended without the apprehension of the particular, then the particular does not make the universal manifest.

original: des na 'di rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would always be apprehended,

original: gsal bas stong pa'i sa phyogs su yang spyi dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal bas stong pa'i sa phyogs su yang spyi dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: and the universal would be apprehended in a place devoid of the particular,

original: dper na sgra las gsal ba de med pa'i yul der yang dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra las gsal ba de med pa'i yul der yang dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the particular is apprehended in a place devoid of sound.

original: 'on te gsal bar byed pa'i gsal ba med na dbang pos 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byed pa'i gsal ba med na dbang pos 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the particular does not make the universal manifest, then it is not apprehended by the sense faculty.

original: spyi dbang pos gzung ba ni gsal @183b bas gsal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: spyi dbang pos gzung ba ni gsal @183b bas gsal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The universal is apprehended by the sense faculty, but the particular makes it manifest.

original: dper na sgra las bum pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa la mi ltos la /
analyzed: dper na sgra las bum pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa la mi ltos la /
translated: For example, the apprehension of a pot, etc., from a word does not depend on a lamp, etc.,

original: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ni ltos pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ni ltos pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: but the apprehension by the sense faculty does depend on it. Therefore there is no error.

original: de ni mi rigs te sgra las ni bum pa la sogs pa'i spyi nyid rtogs pa yin pa des na ji ltar de nyid dpe yin par 'gyur te spyi ni phyogs su byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te sgra las ni bum pa la sogs pa'i spyi nyid rtogs pa yin pa des na ji ltar de nyid dpe yin par 'gyur te spyi ni phyogs su byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the universal of a pot, etc. is understood from the word itself. Therefore, how could that be the example? Because the universal is the subject.

original: phyogs nyid ni dpe'i skyon med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs nyid ni dpe'i skyon med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows that the subject itself is not faulty as an example.

original: des na gal te sgra las spyi rang gi ngo bos rtogs na de la mngon sum gyi rtog pas ci bya /
analyzed: des na gal te sgra las spyi rang gi ngo bos rtogs na de la mngon sum gyi rtog pas ci bya /
translated: Therefore, if the universal is understood by the word itself, then what is the use of the understanding of it by direct perception?üîΩIf there is no object of direct perception, how is it understood from the word? Because there is no apprehension of the relation.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba med na ji ltar sgra las rtogs te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ci sgra las spyi'i rnam pa gang yin pa de nyid spyi yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba med na ji ltar sgra las rtogs te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ci sgra las spyi'i rnam pa gang yin pa de nyid spyi yin nam /
translated: Is the universal that is the aspect of the word itself the universal?

original: de ste rang bzhin gzhan yin /
analyzed: de ste rang bzhin gzhan yin /
translated: Or is it of a different nature?

original: gal te de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is of that very nature,

original: 'o na ni gsal bas gsal bar byas pa de nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal bas gsal bar byas pa de nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin te /
translated: then it is that very thing that is made manifest by the manifestor, which is understood by direct perception.

original: rang bzhin de nyid kyis shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid kyis shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is that very nature, consciousness arises.

original: 'on te gang zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de spyi'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /üîΩde ltar yin na de la brdar btags pas /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de spyi'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na / de ltar yin na de la brdar btags pas /
translated: But if you say that what is understood through direct perception is a universal,

original: ci ltar gzhan du rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan du rtogs pa yin /
translated: then how can there be the understanding of something else through theüîΩlinguistic sign?

original: sgra'i shes pa la yang mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho nar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa la yang mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho nar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of the cognition of a word, only the nature of what is directlyüîΩperceived appears, because that nature is not perceived as the nature of anything

original: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa gzhan la yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa gzhan la yang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: else.

original: spyi ni rtag tu de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas thams cad kyi tshe snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi ni rtag tu de'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas thams cad kyi tshe snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the universal is always just that nature, it would always appear.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de'i nus pa'am nus med pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de'i nus pa'am nus med pa //
translated: Whether it is or is not a potentiality,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis gang gnas pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gang gnas pa //
translated: it is essentially something that exists.

original: rtag phyir bcos su yod min na //
analyzed: rtag phyir bcos su yod min na //
translated: Since it is permanent, it cannot be changed.

original: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang //
analyzed: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang //
translated: What is the point of a potentiality for its cessation?

original: spyi yi rnam par shes de la'ang //üîΩrjes 'brel sngon po la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: spyi yi rnam par shes de la'ang // rjes 'brel sngon po la sogs pa'i //
translated: In the case of the cognition of a universal,

original: rnam pa'i cha ni rnam nges gang //
analyzed: rnam pa'i cha ni rnam nges gang //
translated: what is the relation between the subsequent cognition of the aspects ofüîΩblueness, etc., and the determination of the universal?

original: de ni de la gnag gis sprul //
analyzed: de ni de la gnag gis sprul //
translated: By what is it produced?

original: gal te sgra las spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs na spyi'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te sgra las spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs na spyi'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one understands only the universal from a word, then it would appear as the aspect of the universal alone.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha'i skabs yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha'i skabs yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be an occasion for the aspect of blue, etc.?

original: gsal ba las so zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba las so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is from the manifest,

original: gsal ba mi snang na ga las gsal bas bskyed pa'i phyir zhes ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gsal ba mi snang na ga las gsal bas bskyed pa'i phyir zhes ni mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable to say that because it is generated by the manifest, when the manifest does not appear.

original: spyi med par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi med par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that there would be no universal,

original: de las tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear as different from that.

original: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa nyid kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And the aspect that is pervaded is not different from the aspect of blue, etc.

original: de spyi'i rnam pa @184a * //
analyzed: de spyi'i rnam pa @184a * //
translated: Even though it is the aspect of the universal,

original: yin yang don rnams kyi spyi zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin yang don rnams kyi spyi zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not the universal of objects.

original: gnyi ga yang snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that both appear,

original: ma yin te dbang pos gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yin te dbang pos gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: that is not so, because it would be apprehended by the sense faculty.

original: dbang pos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gsal ba dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gsal ba dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: Because the manifest that is realized by the sense faculty is the object of the sense faculty, it is not tenable.

original: dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be apprehended by the sense faculty.

original: dbang pos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gsal ba dbang po'i gzung ba yin no zhes ni mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gsal ba dbang po'i gzung ba yin no zhes ni mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be illogical to say that the manifestation that is realized by the sense faculty is the object of the sense faculty.

original: sgra las rtogs pa spyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra las rtogs pa spyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: The general is not realized from the word.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i spyi yod do zhes rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i spyi yod do zhes rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: There is no realization that ‚Äúsuch and such a general thing exists.‚Äù

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir dang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir dang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no confidence in that and because the appearances are different.

original: de'i phyir gsal ba las tha dad pa sgras rtogs par bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba las tha dad pa sgras rtogs par bya ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the general that is different from the manifestation is not to be realized by the word.

original: des na gsal ba nyid sgras rtogs na dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gsal ba nyid sgras rtogs na dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the manifestation itself is realized by the word, then the collection of sense faculties would be meaningless,

original: don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be purposeless.

original: gal te mngon sum shes don nyid //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum shes don nyid //
translated: If the object of direct perception is the thing itself,

original: phyir na dbang po don med min //üîΩde dngos gcig phyir sgra sogs las //
analyzed: phyir na dbang po don med min // de dngos gcig phyir sgra sogs las //
translated: then the sense faculties are not meaningless.

original: tha dad snang blo ga las yin //
analyzed: tha dad snang blo ga las yin //
translated: Because it is the same thing, how could there be a cognition that appears as different from sound and so on?

original: mngon sum nyid ni don gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni don gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Direct perception is the realization of the thing itself.

original: de yod na dbang po rnams don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yod na dbang po rnams don med pa nyid do //
translated: If it does exist, then the sense faculties are useless.

original: mngon na gnas pa nyid du rtogs pa mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon na gnas pa nyid du rtogs pa mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: If it is manifest, then the cognition of the presence of the object is perception.

original: mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the manifestation of the object.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: sgra ni rnam pa gzhan du yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam pa gzhan du yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word is understood in another way.

original: sgra ni mdun na gnas par rtogs pa ma yin pa des ni mngon sum gnyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra ni mdun na gnas par rtogs pa ma yin pa des ni mngon sum gnyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word is not understood as present in front of the hearer, so it is not perception.

original: bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the word is understood in its entirety,

original: sgra las kyang de nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra las kyang de nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: then the word itself is understood,

original: de nyid la brda gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la brda gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention is grasped in relation to it.

original: yongs su tshim pa'i don gyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshim pa'i don gyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is for the purpose of complete satisfaction,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, it is not.

original: khyod kyis yongs su tshim pa ni 'di 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa las yongs su tshim pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis yongs su tshim pa ni 'di 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa las yongs su tshim pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because complete satisfaction is also present when the word ‚Äúcomplete satisfaction‚Äù is heard.

original: byung bar gyur to zhes rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byung bar gyur to zhes rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not because of the application ‚Äúit has come into existence.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'das pa las byung nas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa las byung nas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expression ‚Äúhaving arisen from the past, it endures‚Äù is possible.

original: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar ba chod pa kho na la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar ba chod pa kho na la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But even so, the expression ‚Äúsound‚Äù would apply only to what is past and future, and to what is present but interrupted.

original: ma chod par snang ba nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma chod par snang ba nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: It would not apply to what is present and not interrupted,

original: de la sbyor ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the application would be fruitless.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa dang / chod pa ltar mi rung ba ni yongs su tshim pa'i rgyu ma yin pa des na dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa dang / chod pa ltar mi rung ba ni yongs su tshim pa'i rgyu ma yin pa des na dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not right that what is past and what is obstructed, like form, etc., are the cause of satisfaction. Therefore the sense faculties have a result.

original: de ni mi bden @184b te ;
analyzed: de ni mi bden @184b te ;
translated: This is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bos mthong ba gang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mthong ba gang //
translated: What is seen by intrinsic nature

original: de ni 'das sogs ci ltar yin //
analyzed: de ni 'das sogs ci ltar yin //
translated: how can that be past, etc.?

original: snang ba med las 'das sogs kyis //
analyzed: snang ba med las 'das sogs kyis //
translated: From what is not seen, the past, etc.,

original: ngo bo gzhan ni rtogs pa med //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan ni rtogs pa med //
translated: another nature is not understood.

original: mig la sogs pas mthong ba yang //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas mthong ba yang //
translated: What is seen by the eye, etc.,

original: rang gi ngo bos mthong ba kho nas ma chod pa dang yongs su tshim pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos mthong ba kho nas ma chod pa dang yongs su tshim pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: is seen only by intrinsic nature. It is not obstructed and is the cause of satisfaction.

original: rang gi ngo bos gzung ba'i glu sgra ni chod kyang yongs su tshim pa sgrub par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos gzung ba'i glu sgra ni chod kyang yongs su tshim pa sgrub par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The sound of the song is not heard by the ear, but the pleasure of lovemaking is not absent.

original: chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ongs pa'i phyi rma chod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ongs pa'i phyi rma chod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sound is heard as if it were nearby because it is reflected,

original: de la yang snying po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang snying po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so, because

original: nye bar len pa rtog yang ring zhing //üîΩde ni rgang ring yul nyid du //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rtog yang ring zhing // de ni rgang ring yul nyid du //
translated: the reflection is far away.üîΩHow can it be that the sound is heard

original: rtogs phyir 'ongs pa ga la yin //üîΩha cang thal ba 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtogs phyir 'ongs pa ga la yin // ha cang thal ba 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: as if it were nearby, when the reflection is far away?üîΩIt follows, absurdly, that

original: gal te yul rgyang ring por rtogs kyang /
analyzed: gal te yul rgyang ring por rtogs kyang /
translated: if the sound is heard as if it were nearby, even though it is far away,

original: lus la gnas pa dang phrad pa yin na gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na sgra dang rjes su dpag pa las sam /
analyzed: lus la gnas pa dang phrad pa yin na gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro // des na sgra dang rjes su dpag pa las sam /
translated: then form and so on would also be perceived as if they were in contact with the body, even though they are not.üîΩTherefore, it would follow, absurdly, that one could understand the meaning of a sound from far away, just as one does from nearby,

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi don rtogs pa la yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi don rtogs pa la yang rung ste /
translated: and that one could understand the meaning of a sound from a reflection, just as one does from the original sound.üîΩIt would also follow, absurdly, that one could touch a low-caste person by touching a reflection of him,

original: rigs ngan la reg pa dang // bgrod par mi bya ba la bgrod pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs ngan la reg pa dang // bgrod par mi bya ba la bgrod pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: that one could have sexual intercourse with a forbidden woman by having sexual intercourse with a reflection of her, and so on.

original: des na gal te sgra las don rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs na /
analyzed: des na gal te sgra las don rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs na /
translated: Therefore, if the meaning is understood by virtue of its own nature from the sound,

original: 'das pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be past, etc.

original: snang bzhin pa yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa kho na las 'das pa la sogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa yang rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa kho na las 'das pa la sogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: And it is only the present that is understood by virtue of its own nature, not the past, etc.

original: mi slu ba yang mi slu ba la sogs pa'i sgra las yod pa nyid do //üîΩci ste dbang pos rtogs pa nyid yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang mi slu ba la sogs pa'i sgra las yod pa nyid do // ci ste dbang pos rtogs pa nyid yod pa yin gyi /
translated: And nondeceptive is the existence from the sound of nondeceptive, etc.

original: rtog pa tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: But if it is the case that the object is understood by the sense faculty and not by mere conception,

original: sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin pa la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin pa la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then the conception of sound, etc. is not existent, because it is seen to engage with the nonexistent.

original: gal te dbang pos rtogs pa ni //üîΩyod nyid ce na sbrang bu sogs //
analyzed: gal te dbang pos rtogs pa ni // yod nyid ce na sbrang bu sogs //
translated: If the object is understood by the sense faculty,üîΩthen it is existent.

original: ci phyir yod min nyams phyir na //
analyzed: ci phyir yod min nyams phyir na //
translated: But why is it not existent for flies, etc.?üîΩBecause of the impairment of their sense faculties.

original: ji lta bur na nyams par 'dod //
analyzed: ji lta bur na nyams par 'dod //
translated: But how is impairment of the sense faculties conceived?

original: gal te de lta ma yin par //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin par //
translated: If it is not so conceived,

original: rtogs phyir sbrang sogs med ce na //üîΩde ltar 'o na ngo bo yis //
analyzed: rtogs phyir sbrang sogs med ce na // de ltar 'o na ngo bo yis //
translated: then flies, etc. do not exist because they do not understand.üîΩBut if it is so conceived,

original: rtogs phyir yod par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: rtogs phyir yod par 'dod pa yin //
translated: then it is existent because it is understood by virtue of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa kho na yod pa nyid dang mngon sum nyid dang ma chod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa kho na yod pa nyid dang mngon sum nyid dang ma chod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it is only the intrinsically real that exists, is direct perception, and is not obstructed,

original: sgra dang dbang po'i rtogs pa gnyis khyad med pas dbang po rnams mngon sum du rtogs pa nyid kyi dgos pa dang ldan pa ma yin te des na 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgra dang dbang po'i rtogs pa gnyis khyad med pas dbang po rnams mngon sum du rtogs pa nyid kyi dgos pa dang ldan pa ma yin te des na 'bras bu med pa nyid do //
translated: the two, the cognition of sound and the cognition of the sense faculty, are not different. Therefore, the sense faculties are not endowed with the purpose of being direct perception. Thus, they are pointless.

original: 'di'i phyir yang spyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang spyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also, the universal is not a thing.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / rigs ldan rigs @185a * //üîΩmin gang gi phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rigs ldan rigs @185a * // min gang gi phyir //
translated: whether it is endowed with a type or not,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan rten med //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan rten med //
translated: the nature of the manifestation is not dependent on another.

original: gal te tha dad grub ce na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad grub ce na //
translated: If you say that it is established as different,

original: ltos phyir 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
analyzed: ltos phyir 'bras bu nyid du brjod //
translated: because it depends on it, it is called the effect.

original: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is established from its own cause,

original: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
analyzed: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
translated: the effect is not independent.

original: rtog pa yis ni 'brel par byed //
analyzed: rtog pa yis ni 'brel par byed //
translated: Imagination connects it.

original: 'bras min ci ltar yang ci zhig / gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
analyzed: 'bras min ci ltar yang ci zhig / gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
translated: If it is not the effect, what is it? If it is different, it is not connected.

original: de phyir rang bzhin med par grub //
analyzed: de phyir rang bzhin med par grub //
translated: Therefore, it is established as essenceless.

original: rigs dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa'i dngos po nyid //
translated: The thing that is endowed with the type

original: rigs su brjod dam /
analyzed: rigs su brjod dam /
translated: Are they of the same type or are they different?

original: gzhan yin / de la re zhig gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni spyi'i dngos po'i ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin / de la re zhig gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni spyi'i dngos po'i ma yin te /
translated: First, the nature of manifestation is not a universal entity,

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba rnams gzhan la brten pa med pa ste ma 'dres par mngon sum du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba rnams gzhan la brten pa med pa ste ma 'dres par mngon sum du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: because manifestations are directly perceived individually, without depending on anything else.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pas gzhan du rtogs pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pas gzhan du rtogs pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: A non-erroneous consciousness does not conceive of something else as something else.

original: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med par so sor rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa ni gzhan la ltos pa med par so sor rtog pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, a multicolored object is individually conceived without depending on anything else.

original: 'on te gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa ni phyis snga ma snga ma la ltos nas ;üîΩ'di ni de dang mtshungs so zhe'am /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa ni phyis snga ma snga ma la ltos nas ; 'di ni de dang mtshungs so zhe'am /
translated: But if a second manifestation and so on is later conceived in dependence on the first,üîΩit is conceived as ‚Äúthis is similar to that‚Äù

original: de ni 'di nyid do zhes rtog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'di nyid do zhes rtog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: or ‚Äúthat is just this.‚Äù
