original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is also not tenable.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ji snyed pa yang rtogs pas rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ji snyed pa yang rtogs pas rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Whatever effects are perceived, such as sprouts, are related to their causes,

original: grub zin pas gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub zin pas gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are already established and do not depend on anything else.

original: de ltar ci srid ma grub pa de srid du ni 'dir rtogs pa 'ba' zhig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ci srid ma grub pa de srid du ni 'dir rtogs pa 'ba' zhig yin no //
translated: As long as it is not established, it is only a conception.

original: grub pa'i dus na yang de dang lhan cig tu yod pas gzhan la rag mi las pa'am /
analyzed: grub pa'i dus na yang de dang lhan cig tu yod pas gzhan la rag mi las pa'am /
translated: Even at the time of establishment, it is not dependent on another, because it exists simultaneously with it,

original: rgyu zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams kyang rtog pa kho nas rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnams kyang rtog pa kho nas rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa yin na /
translated: or because the cause has ceased, the effects are connected with the cause only by conception.

original: shes ldan ci bzlog pa la ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes ldan ci bzlog pa la ma yin nam /
translated: What intelligent person would not reject that?

original: de'i phyir gsal ba las gsal ba gzhan nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba las gsal ba gzhan nam /
translated: Therefore, if the individual is different from the universal,

original: spyi tha dad pa yin na de 'brel pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa yin na de 'brel pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: or if the universal is different from the individual, they are unrelated.

original: de'i phyir spyi ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the universal is essenceless.

original: 'brel pa med par rtogs pa la ni spyi yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par rtogs pa la ni spyi yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not exist in the cognition of the unrelated.

original: 'o na ni 'brel pa med par rtogs pa'i dngos po med pa yang spyi thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'brel pa med par rtogs pa'i dngos po med pa yang spyi thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But in that case, the nonexistence of the unrelated cognition would also follow as the universal,

original: ngo bo nyid med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are similar in being essenceless.

original: med pa rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
translated: Nonexistence does not follow as a possibility,

original: de la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is not dependent on that.

original: ri bong gi gi rva ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas spyir 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi gi rva ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas spyir 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúrabbit horn‚Äù is a universal only in relation to its own particular, i.e., the particular rabbit horn.

original: gzhan gyi gsal ba ma yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gsal ba ma yin pa //
translated: It is not a universal in relation to other particulars.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: spyi dngos por smra ba la yang ba lang nyid @185b rta dang ba lang la sogs pa'i ma yin pa /
analyzed: spyi dngos por smra ba la yang ba lang nyid @185b rta dang ba lang la sogs pa'i ma yin pa /
translated: Even for those who maintain that universals are real entities, cowness is not a universal in relation to horses, cows, etc.

original: ci'i phyir ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because it is not dependent on others.

original: de ni rta dang ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rta dang ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not something that is made evident by the particulars, i.e., horses, cows, etc.

original: de lta na ni 'o na bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la yang khra bo la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bong bu'i rva la sogs pa la yang khra bo la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the universals of variegated color, etc., would not be the nature of the particular, i.e., the rabbit horn, etc., because they are not dependent on the rabbit horn, etc.

original: ba lang nyid ni de la brten nas 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
analyzed: ba lang nyid ni de la brten nas 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
translated: But cowness is dependent on that, i.e., the particular cow, because it is produced in dependence on that and because it is manifested in that. Thus, there is no fault in maintaining that the relation between a universal and its particular is a relation characterized by dependence.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de rnams la yod pa ma yin la de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de rnams la yod pa ma yin la de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: The nature of those does not exist in those, and there is no relation of identity.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu las de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir ngo bo la brten nas //
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu las de ltar 'gyur ba yin no // de'i phyir ngo bo la brten nas //
translated: Nevertheless, it is so by the power of beginningless predispositions.üîΩTherefore,

original: ngo bo med pa'i rigs brtags pa //üîΩkhyad par de la 'jug don can //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i rigs brtags pa // khyad par de la 'jug don can //
translated: the non-nature is imputed in dependence on the nature.üîΩThe words

original: sgra rnams kyis ni rab tu bstan //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis ni rab tu bstan //
translated: clearly teach that the nature is the basis,üîΩand the non-nature is the object of engagement in the distinction.

original: rigs ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The nature does not exist essentially,

original: 'on kyang brgyad nas skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams la brten pa tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang ldan par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brgyad nas skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams la brten pa tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang ldan par rtog pa yin no //
translated: but it is merely imputed to have a nature in dependence on the natures characterized by arising and cessation.

original: de las skyes pa de nyid kyi phyir dang / der lhag par zhe na pa yin pa'i phyir na rigs de rtog pa na khyad par la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de nyid kyi phyir dang / der lhag par zhe na pa yin pa'i phyir na rigs de rtog pa na khyad par la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the nature is imagined, the non-nature is engaged in the distinction.

original: des na khyad par de la 'jug par bya ba'i don can gyi sgra rnams kyis de nyid bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na khyad par de la 'jug par bya ba'i don can gyi sgra rnams kyis de nyid bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the words that have the meaning of engaging in that distinction should teach just that.

original: gzhan dang tha dad med pa ni ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang tha dad med pa ni ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is not the case that there is no difference from the other.

original: rigs rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang gsal ba dang / gcig tu lhag par zhe na pa ga las yin /
analyzed: rigs rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang gsal ba dang / gcig tu lhag par zhe na pa ga las yin /
translated: Even if the universal had the aspect of the essence of the particular, how could it be that the particular is more strongly adhered to than the universal?

original: ngo bo nyid ni mthong ba yin gyi ma mthong bar gcig tu lhag par zhen pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mthong ba yin gyi ma mthong bar gcig tu lhag par zhen pa /
translated: The essence is seen, but the particular is not seen. How could there be strong adherence to it?

original: ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di la brjod pa /üîΩde la ngo bor snang ba'am //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa / de la ngo bor snang ba'am //
translated: Here it is said:üîΩThe appearance as the essence

original: don la de nyid du 'dzin pa //
analyzed: don la de nyid du 'dzin pa //
translated: Or the apprehension of it as just that

original: gang de 'khrul pa thog med pa'i //
analyzed: gang de 'khrul pa thog med pa'i //
translated: Is the beginningless error

original: dus can mthong goms kyis sprul yin //
analyzed: dus can mthong goms kyis sprul yin //
translated: Generated by seeing and familiarity.

original: de kho na mthong ba nyid kyis de'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs par ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba nyid kyis de'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs par ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there superimposition of the essence by just seeing reality,

original: 'khrul pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: There is also a succession of errors from one to another.

original: dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the conception of ƒ™≈õvara and so on.

original: mi gsal bar snang ba yang gsal bar snang ba las ci ltar zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'khrul pa brgyud pa nyid skyabs yin no //
analyzed: mi gsal bar snang ba yang gsal bar snang ba las ci ltar zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'khrul pa brgyud pa nyid skyabs yin no //
translated: And how could an unclear appearance be a clear appearance?

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa ni 'khrul pa'i mthong ba gzhan la rag las pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa ni 'khrul pa'i mthong ba gzhan la rag las pa yin la /
translated: Thus, error is the basis for the error of seeing another.

original: de yang @186a * //
analyzed: de yang @186a * //
translated: And that

original: gzhan las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is due to another.

original: 'khrul pa thog ma med pa nyid legs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa thog ma med pa nyid legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is best that error is beginningless.üîΩThus, there is no need to see its nature.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ni mthong ba ni dgos pa med do //
translated: Moreover,

original: yang na / don rnams kyi ni spyi gang yin //
analyzed: yang na / don rnams kyi ni spyi gang yin //
translated: What is the universal of objects?

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: It is defined as the exclusion of other.

original: sgra 'di dag gis gang brjod pa ;üîΩ/ de la ngo bo cung zad med //
analyzed: sgra 'di dag gis gang brjod pa ; / de la ngo bo cung zad med //
translated: What is expressed by these wordsüîΩhas no nature at all.

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi las ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi las ni rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal that is defined as the exclusion of other does not exist.

original: sgras ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa tsam nyid med pa nyid byed pa yin la ldog pa yang sgra de las 'jug pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sgras ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa tsam nyid med pa nyid byed pa yin la ldog pa yang sgra de las 'jug pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: The word does not function to negate the mere opposite of that dissimilar class which is not intended. The opposite is only the non-occurrence of that word.

original: gal te 'jug par yang byed pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'jug par yang byed pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it that it does function to negate?

original: ldog pa tsam gyis ni su yang don du gnyer ba med do //üîΩbum pa khyer shog ces bya ba snam bu la sogs pa khyer nas mi 'ongs ba nyid don du gnyer ba ni ma yin no zhe na de ni med do //
analyzed: ldog pa tsam gyis ni su yang don du gnyer ba med do // bum pa khyer shog ces bya ba snam bu la sogs pa khyer nas mi 'ongs ba nyid don du gnyer ba ni ma yin no zhe na de ni med do //
translated: No one is interested in mere negation.üîΩWhen one says, Bring the pot, one does not come bringing a cloth, etc.

original: khyer shog bya ba 'di khyer nas mi 'ong ba 'gog pa yin la de las ni rang nyid khyer nas 'ong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyer shog bya ba 'di khyer nas mi 'ong ba 'gog pa yin la de las ni rang nyid khyer nas 'ong par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not so. The statement Bring negates the non-coming while bringing. From that, one comes bringing oneself.

original: de yang bum pa ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang bum pa ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de 'gog pa yin te /
translated: That also would follow for a non-pot, so that is negated.

original: dgag pa la ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa la ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The negation does not have an intrinsic nature.

original: gal te sgra dang po'i sgra'i don sgrub pa yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra dang po'i sgra'i don sgrub pa yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it that the meaning of the first word is established?

original: de la ni dgag ba srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni dgag ba srid pa ma yin te /
translated: There, the negation is not possible,

original: thal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no absurd consequence.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: btang snyoms las ni gzhan min pa'i //üîΩlen pa mi byed pa nyid 'dir //
analyzed: btang snyoms las ni gzhan min pa'i // len pa mi byed pa nyid 'dir //
translated: because it is not different from equanimity,üîΩthis non-appropriation is

original: thal yin 'di ni 'gog byed de //
analyzed: thal yin 'di ni 'gog byed de //
translated: the absurd consequence that is to be refuted here.

original: de la thal ba gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: de la thal ba gzhan ci yod //
translated: What other absurd consequence is there?

original: 'dir ni sbyor ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyor ba med pa nyid //
translated: Here, the very non-existence of application

original: mi len pa yin pas thal ba de nyid sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: mi len pa yin pas thal ba de nyid sgro 'dogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: is non-appropriation. Therefore, that very absurd consequence is the refutation of superimposition.

original: gal te de dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If the negation is not just the establishment of another,

original: de ci ltar na de la ngo bo nyid med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na de la ngo bo nyid med pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that there is no intrinsic reality in that?

original: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad brjod de /
translated: Here, this is said:

original: de yi ngo bo bkag pa na //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo bkag pa na //
translated: The negation of its intrinsic reality

original: gzhan ni rang nyid rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang nyid rtogs pa yin //
translated: is the realization of another by itself.

original: sgra yi byed pa de la med //
analyzed: sgra yi byed pa de la med //
translated: That is not the function of the word,

original: don gnyer yin phyir rang gis rtogs //üîΩgzhan yod pa nyid gzhan med pa //
analyzed: don gnyer yin phyir rang gis rtogs // gzhan yod pa nyid gzhan med pa //
translated: because it is for the sake of the object, it is realized by itself.üîΩHow could the existence of another

original: yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: be the non-existence of another?

original: gzhan rtogs na der rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs na der rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: When the other is realized, the realization of that arises.

original: de skad bshad pa ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan sel ba'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de skad bshad pa ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan sel ba'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: This statement is faultless, because it is the position of the exclusion of other that is the nature of the realization.

original: rang gi blo nyid des dben par nyams su myong ba dag med do zhes rtogs pa'i phyir @186b ro ;
analyzed: rang gi blo nyid des dben par nyams su myong ba dag med do zhes rtogs pa'i phyir @186b ro ;
translated: Because they realize that their own mind is experienced as devoid of those, they are not nonexistent.

original: / gal te re zhig spyi'i blo ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: / gal te re zhig spyi'i blo ni yod pa yin no //
translated: If, on the one hand, the cognition of universals exists,

original: de la don gyi rnam pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni spyi yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la don gyi rnam pa yod pa gang yin pa de ni spyi yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: then the existence of the aspect of the object is the existence of the universal.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir de la don gyi ngo bo nyid med du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir de la don gyi ngo bo nyid med du chug mod /
translated: If you say that the nature of the object does not exist because it appears in another aspect,

original: de spyi tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de spyi tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable to say that the universal is not different.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: ngo po med can spyi blo la //
analyzed: ngo po med can spyi blo la //
translated: The cognition of a universal that has no natureüîΩsees a universal.

original: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir dang // don la 'khrul pa'ang med na ni //
analyzed: spyi nyid du ni mthong phyir dang // don la 'khrul pa'ang med na ni //
translated: If there is no error regarding the object,üîΩthen the assertion of a universal is reversed.

original: spyir 'dod de yang slar phyir dang // de nyid du na don dngos su //
analyzed: spyir 'dod de yang slar phyir dang // de nyid du na don dngos su //
translated: Because the object does not exist in reality,

original: med phyir ngo bo can ma yin //
analyzed: med phyir ngo bo can ma yin //
translated: it does not have a nature.

original: spyi'i blo la snang ba ni spyir 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i blo la snang ba ni spyir 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The appearance to the general cognition is the universal.

original: gal te ngo bo med pa can te /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo med pa can te /
translated: If it is established that it is without a nature,

original: rnam pa med pa nyid du grub na de tshe nges par de blo las gzhan du 'gyur dgos pa'i phyir spyir 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid du grub na de tshe nges par de blo las gzhan du 'gyur dgos pa'i phyir spyir 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then it must definitely be different from cognition, and therefore it is a universal,

original: de spyi'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spyi'i ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen as the nature of a universal.

original: 'on kyang de ni don la 'khrul pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni don la 'khrul pa yang yin te /
translated: However, it is also mistaken with regard to the object,

original: de ni ci ltar spyir mthong ba de bzhin du 'khrul pa yin no zhes kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar spyir mthong ba de bzhin du 'khrul pa yin no zhes kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: because it is understood that it is mistaken in the way that it sees the universal.

original: de yang rang gi rnam pa ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang gi rnam pa ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, its own aspect is not a universal,

original: rang gi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a particular characteristic that is the ultimate of its own aspect.

original: 'on kyang de tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: However, it is different from that,

original: don la bslad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la bslad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a mistake with regard to the object.

original: de kho na nyid du don gyi rang bzhin du med do zhes kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du don gyi rang bzhin du med do zhes kyang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is understood that it does not exist as the nature of the object in reality.

original: spyi 'di ni ci ltar de'i mthar thug par rtogs pa zhes zer /
analyzed: spyi 'di ni ci ltar de'i mthar thug par rtogs pa zhes zer /
translated: How can this universal be said to be ultimately known?

original: de la brten par rtogs pa bzhin du don la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la brten par rtogs pa bzhin du don la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist in reality as it is known to inhere in something.

original: des na rang bzhin des dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ni ngo bo dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin des dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ni ngo bo dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not endowed with an essence because it is not endowed with an intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not endowed with an intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na ser po la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na ser po la sogs pa yang /
translated: Because it cannot withstand such an examination.

original: dung dkar po la sogs pa la yod par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dung dkar po la sogs pa la yod par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, yellow and so on would exist in a white conch and so on.

original: de'i phyir spyi ni dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a universal is not a real entity.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yang spyi ni dngos po ma yin no /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yang spyi ni dngos po ma yin no /
translated: A universal is not a real entity because it is not an object of expression.

original: spyi de dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin /
analyzed: spyi de dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin /
translated: A universal is not an object of expression in terms of itself or in terms of something else.

original: yang dngos par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dngos par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a real entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo med pas brjod bya min //
analyzed: ngo bo med pas brjod bya min //
translated: It is not an object of expression because it does not exist.

original: gal te brjod pa 'ga' zhig las //
analyzed: gal te brjod pa 'ga' zhig las //
translated: If it were an object of expression,

original: dngos 'dod dngos rnams ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: dngos 'dod dngos rnams ci ltar 'dod //
translated: How can one desire a thing that is not an object of desire?

original: brjod bya min pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: brjod bya min pa nyid ma yin //
translated: It is not the case that it is not an object of expression.

original: gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo med pa yin te /
translated: That which is not an object of expression as identical with or different from something else is devoid of its own nature.

original: dngos po nyid du gyur pa ni gdon mi za bar de nyid dam gzhan du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩci @187a * //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du gyur pa ni gdon mi za bar de nyid dam gzhan du brjod par bya ba yin par 'gyur ro // ci @187a * //
translated: For if it is a thing, then it must be an object of expression as identical with or different from something else.üîΩBut if it is not an object of expression, then it is not a thing.

original: ste spyi gzhan las gzhan du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du nges par gyur pa ni spyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ste spyi gzhan las gzhan du brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid du nges par gyur pa ni spyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is a thing because it is an object of expression as different from other things, then it is definitely different.

original: gal te dngos po yin no gsal ba las kyang de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yin no gsal ba las kyang de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is a thing, then it must be an object of expression as identical with or different from the particulars.üîΩBut it is not an object of expression as identical with or different from the particulars, so it is not a thing.üîΩIf you say that it is not an object of expression as identical with or different from the particulars because it is related to them,

original: de nyid las brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //üîΩde dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir de las brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid las brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //üîΩde dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir de las brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not a thing because it is not a substance.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni tha dad pa nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni tha dad pa nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The relation of cause and effect is a relation of difference.

original: des na 'bras bu thams cad rgyu la ltos nas rjod par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu thams cad rgyu la ltos nas rjod par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all effects are not described in dependence on a cause.

original: du ba ni me las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba ni me las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that smoke is not to be described as the same or different from fire.

original: yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba las brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba las brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is not to be described as different from the particular because the object is not different,

original: yul zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //üîΩtha mi dad par snang na ji ltar tha dad pa med pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po las gzhan yod pa ma yin no // tha mi dad par snang na ji ltar tha dad pa med pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: an object is not ultimately different from a thing.üîΩIf it appears as nondifferent, how could it not be nondifferent?

original: tha dad snang na gang gis na tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: tha dad snang na gang gis na tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: If it appears as different, how could it be nondifferent?

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan dag las gzhan gyi dngos po ni med do //
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan dag las gzhan gyi dngos po ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no entity that is different from the same or different.

original: gang las kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not to be described as anything, it is nonexistent.

original: de ni spyi gzhan las kyang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni spyi gzhan las kyang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be said that it is different from other universals,

original: spyi gzhan yang dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi gzhan yang dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other universals are not established as things.

original: ci ste kun brtags pa las tha dad par brjod par bya bas dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste kun brtags pa las tha dad par brjod par bya bas dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is a thing because it is to be said to be different from the imagined,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even the horns of a rabbit, etc., would be things, because they are different from each other.

original: gal te de dag gis nye bar len pa tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis nye bar len pa tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that they are different because they are different from the different appropriated aggregates,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately,

original: ri bong gi mgo la sogs pa tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa can gyi blo nyid de ltar tha dad pa yin gyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ri bong gi mgo la sogs pa tha dad pa'i nye bar len pa can gyi blo nyid de ltar tha dad pa yin gyi ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the cognition that has different appropriated aggregates, such as the head of a rabbit, etc., is different in that way, but the horns of a rabbit, etc., are not.

original: 'di la yang de ltar brjod na ci 'gal /
analyzed: 'di la yang de ltar brjod na ci 'gal /
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that in this case also?

original: 'dir yang nye bar len pa gsal ba tha dad pas blo tha dad pa nyid du zad kyi dngos por ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang nye bar len pa gsal ba tha dad pas blo tha dad pa nyid du zad kyi dngos por ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin na ni /
translated: Here also, the difference of the cognition is just due to the difference of the different appropriated aggregates, but there is no difference of things.

original: de bshad pa ni /üîΩnyer len tha dad phyir gzhan du //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni / nyer len tha dad phyir gzhan du //
translated: The explanation of that is as follows:

original: brjod par bya min nyer btags phyir //
analyzed: brjod par bya min nyer btags phyir //
translated: Because the appropriated are different, they are not said to be different.üîΩBecause the general is imputed to the appropriated.

original: gal te spyi'am gsal ba sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'am gsal ba sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the general or the particular were the referent of words,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: then the past and future would not be referents.

original: de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩ'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i //üîΩdon la'ang spyi yi rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i // don la'ang spyi yi rgyu can gyi //
translated: BecauseüîΩThe listener engages in the general cause

original: mnyan pa @187b dag ni 'jug 'gyur na //
analyzed: mnyan pa @187b dag ni 'jug 'gyur na //
translated: Even in regard to the object of the past and future.

original: yod pa med chos ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa med chos ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could the existent be a phenomenon of the nonexistent?

original: gal te dngos po 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa brjod pa la yang spyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa brjod pa la yang spyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the general is understood in regard to the expression of a past or future thing,

original: 'o na ni spyi yod pa de /
analyzed: 'o na ni spyi yod pa de /
translated: then the existent general

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po med pa'i chos su ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po med pa'i chos su ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: would be a phenomenon of the nonexistent past and future.

original: yod pa ni med pa'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: yod pa ni med pa'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin no ;
translated: But the existent cannot be a phenomenon of the nonexistent.

original: / gsal ba gzhan yod pa nyid kyi chos yin no zhe na /üîΩde yi chos su ma rtogs na //
analyzed: / gsal ba gzhan yod pa nyid kyi chos yin no zhe na /üîΩde yi chos su ma rtogs na //
translated: If the particular is a phenomenon of the existent,üîΩthen how could the general be a phenomenon of the particular?

original: 'das pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be past?

original: spyi ni gsal ba 'das pa'i dbang gis 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal ba 'das pa'i dbang gis 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal is past by virtue of the fact that it is related to the particular that is past, but not by virtue of its own nature.

original: des na spyi ni 'das pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na spyi ni 'das pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis 'das pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the universal is past only by virtue of its relation to the past,

original: yang gdon mi za bar spyi med pa'i chos su 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: yang gdon mi za bar spyi med pa'i chos su 'gyur dgos so //
translated: it must be a nonexistent phenomenon.

original: med pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is a nonexistent phenomenon does not exist.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva nyid dam /üîΩdngos po med pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva nyid dam / dngos po med pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a rabbit,üîΩor non-entity.

original: yod pa yin na yang med pa'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yin na yang med pa'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, it is not a nonexistent phenomenon.

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the potency to produce the effect of a sprout, etc.

original: ci 'gal zhe na 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci 'gal zhe na 'brel pa med pa nyid do //
translated: What is the contradiction? It is the fact that they are unrelated.

original: med pa dang ni 'brel par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa dang ni 'brel par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: A nonexistent cannot be related.

original: de ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so,

original: spyi yang med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi yang med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then the universal would be understood to be nonexistent.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: dper na gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the manifest.

original: 'o na gsal ba yang yod pa nyid du rtogs te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gsal ba yang yod pa nyid du rtogs te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if the manifest exists, then existence is established, because the past and future exist.

original: gal te yod na 'das par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yod na 'das par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it exists, how can it be past?

original: shes pa 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the cognition is past.

original: shes pa de yang rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa de yang rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: But that cognition is also established.

original: mngon sum nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not perceived as direct perception.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa la mngon sum ma yin pa nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa la mngon sum ma yin pa nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because there is no non-direct perception in the cognition of one's own nature, it has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir spyi de ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i med pa'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi de ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i med pa'i chos ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that generality is not a non-existent phenomenon of the past, etc.

original: gal te nyer btags las 'di 'dod //
analyzed: gal te nyer btags las 'di 'dod //
translated: If you accept it as imputed,

original: gang zhig snam sogs la med pa //üîΩda ltar ba yi bum pa yi //
analyzed: gang zhig snam sogs la med pa // da ltar ba yi bum pa yi //
translated: What does not exist in cloth, etc.üîΩIs the present thing,

original: dngos po med dang ni nye ba gang //
analyzed: dngos po med dang ni nye ba gang //
translated: The non-existence of the pot, and what is near.

original: med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma grub ste /
translated: The reason called non-existent phenomenon is not established.

original: med pa'i chos nyid ni nye bar btags pa las 'dod pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir na med pa'i chos kyi gtan tshigs ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: med pa'i chos nyid ni nye bar btags pa las 'dod pa yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir na med pa'i chos kyi gtan tshigs ni ma grub bo //
translated: The reality of nonexistence is asserted to be a mere designation, not ultimately. Therefore the reason of the nonexistence of a phenomenon is not established.

original: gang zhig nye bar btags pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar btags pa de ni /
translated: Whatever is a mere designationüîΩdoes not exist ultimately.

original: de la don dam par ni med pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de la spyi don dam par @188a * //
analyzed: de la don dam par ni med pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de la spyi don dam par @188a * //
translated: Therefore, since the generality of the past and future does not exist ultimately, the reason is not established.

original: yod pa nyid ma yin pas gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //üîΩ'dir len ni 'das pa la sogs pa de la spyi nye bar btags sam /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin pas gtan tshigs yod pa nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no // 'dir len ni 'das pa la sogs pa de la spyi nye bar btags sam /
translated: This is the idea.üîΩHere, there are three possibilities: the generality of the past and so on is designated in dependence on the sound,

original: sgra'am 'on te gsal ba zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: sgra'am 'on te gsal ba zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum mo //
translated: or it is designated in dependence on the manifestation of the sound,üîΩor it is designated in dependence on the object itself.üîΩIf it is designated in dependence on the sound,üîΩthat is not tenable because the sound of the presentüîΩis not the same as the sound of the past and future.

original: gal te spyi'i chos nye bar 'dogs so zhe na /üîΩde ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i chos nye bar 'dogs so zhe na / de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If it is designated in dependence on the manifestation of the sound,

original: da ltar ba'i bum pa la /üîΩyod pa'i spyi de /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i bum pa la / yod pa'i spyi de /
translated: that is not tenable because the manifestation of the sound of the present

original: 'das pa la 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: 'das pa la 'dra ba'am /
translated: is not the same as the manifestation of the sound of the past and future.

original: 'brel pas nye bar 'dogs grangs /
analyzed: 'brel pas nye bar 'dogs grangs /
translated: If it is designated in dependence on the object itself,üîΩthat is not tenable because the object itself does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin na nye ba med par 'dod pas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nye ba med par 'dod pas na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be absurd to maintain that the non-existent is the referent of a word.

original: med pa dang ni 'dra ba'am 'brel par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa dang ni 'dra ba'am 'brel par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the non-existent is related to a word,

original: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would exist.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa yang dngos po yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa yang dngos po yin no //
translated: The past, etc. are also entities.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni bkag zin to //
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni bkag zin to //
translated: The so-called cognition has already been refuted.

original: 'on te sgra nye bar 'dogs na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra nye bar 'dogs na /
translated: If you claim that the word is applied to the object,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is also untenable.

original: don med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a word does not apply to a non-existent object.

original: 'jug na ni med pa la yang 'jug go zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'jug na ni med pa la yang 'jug go zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it did, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would apply to non-existent objects.

original: de yang spyi yin pa des na dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang spyi yin pa des na dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that would be a universal, and so it would not be a non-existent.

original: 'on te gsal ba nye bar 'dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba nye bar 'dogs so zhe na /
translated: If you claim that the word is applied to the manifestation,

original: de la yang nye bar yod dgos te /
analyzed: de la yang nye bar yod dgos te /
translated: then it must be present,

original: nye bar med par 'dogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar med par 'dogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable to apply a word to something that is not present.

original: sgra nye bar 'dogs pa la yang 'di nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra nye bar 'dogs pa la yang 'di nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: This same argument can be applied to the application of the word to the object.

original: 'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du gcig yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'dra bas nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du gcig yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'dra bas nye bar 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Or, because the past, future, and present are the same, they are figuratively designated as having the same nature.

original: 'das pa ni de nyid yin te 'on kyang don byed pa med par zad do //
analyzed: 'das pa ni de nyid yin te 'on kyang don byed pa med par zad do //
translated: The past is just that, but it is exhausted because it does not perform its function.

original: des na don byed par nye bar 'dogs pas de la spyi lta bur rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na don byed par nye bar 'dogs pas de la spyi lta bur rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is designated as performing a function, it is understood to be like a universal.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not like anything else.

original: 'o na ni de thams cad yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'o na ni de thams cad yod pa yin pas /
translated: But if it exists,

original: ji ltar 'das pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: how can it be past?

original: des don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not perform its function.

original: gal te de med na de nyid 'das par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de med na de nyid 'das par 'gyur mod /
translated: If it does not exist, it is past.

original: ji ltar dngos po yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yin te /
translated: But how can it be a thing?

original: de dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang 'das pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang 'das pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The thing that possesses it is past.

original: de dang ldan par cis shes she na ni dngos po med la yang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan par cis shes she na ni dngos po med la yang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: How do you know it possesses it? You know it exists even though it is nonexistent.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / thams cad yod ces lta ba la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad yod ces lta ba la //
translated: if you maintain that everything exists,

original: de yi don byed pa yang yod //
analyzed: de yi don byed pa yang yod //
translated: then the function of that thing exists.

original: de yod pa na dngos po yi //
analyzed: de yod pa na dngos po yi //
translated: If it exists, then the thing exists.

original: med pa ci ltar bden par mar 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa ci ltar bden par mar 'gyur //
translated: How can a non-existent be a truth?

original: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
translated: But if you say that the past, etc. are conventional,

original: don dam par ni thams cad yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then all things are existent in the ultimate sense.

original: kun rdzob 'di ci gal te don dmigs pa nyid ni yin zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di ci gal te don dmigs pa nyid ni yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the conventional is the object of the ultimate,

original: @188b don dam pa nyid 'gyur mtha' dag ni //
analyzed: @188b don dam pa nyid 'gyur mtha' dag ni //
translated: then the ultimate itself will be all things,

original: kun rdzob bden par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: and how will the conventional be a truth?

original: med pa'i rang bzhin gyi don dmigs pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i rang bzhin gyi don dmigs pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
translated: The conventional is the object of the non-existent nature,

original: de kho na sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obscures reality.

original: de kho na snang ba ni kun rdzob ces bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na snang ba ni kun rdzob ces bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of reality is not called the conventional.

original: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa yang kun rdzob yin na ni don dam pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa la sogs pa yang kun rdzob yin na ni don dam pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the past, etc. are conventional, then the ultimate does not exist,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir de kho na 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir de kho na 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is no entity other than the nature of the past, etc. and therefore there is no reality at all.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob yin gyi don dam par ma yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob yin gyi don dam par ma yin la /
translated: The past, etc. are conventional, not ultimate,üîΩand the ultimate is not conventional.

original: da ltar bar ni don dam par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar bar ni don dam par yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is in the present, then it is ultimately real.

original: spyi dngos po med par grub bo //
analyzed: spyi dngos po med par grub bo //
translated: The universal is established as unreal.

original: da ltar tsam gyi dngos po la spyi med pas thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar tsam gyi dngos po la spyi med pas thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since the universal does not exist in the thing that is present, everything is well established.

original: de'i phyir dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, if the thing is to be expressed, there is no such thing as the designation.

original: 'on te med pa btags pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nye bar btags pa yin la 'das pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyi don du gyur ba'i spyi rang gsal ba yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te med pa btags pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nye bar btags pa yin la 'das pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i sgra rnams kyi don du gyur ba'i spyi rang gsal ba yang med pa yin no //
translated: But if the designation of the nonexistent is itself the designation, and the universal is the object of the words that express the thing of the past, then the universal is nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig mthong ba de ni gdags par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig mthong ba de ni gdags par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, that which is seen is to be designated.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: But that is not true.

original: ngo bo gang du de mthong ba //
analyzed: ngo bo gang du de mthong ba //
translated: The essence in which it is seen

original: de nyid kyis ni sgro gdags min //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni sgro gdags min //
translated: is not the superimposition by that.

original: gang gi de dngos mthong min pa //
analyzed: gang gi de dngos mthong min pa //
translated: That which does not see that thing

original: des kyang sgro gdags bya ba min //
analyzed: des kyang sgro gdags bya ba min //
translated: is also not the superimposition.

original: 'on te shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa 'jug pa na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa 'jug pa na /
translated: But if the cognition of the past, etc., is engaged,

original: de'i yul dang dus la sogs pa dang 'brel par rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i yul dang dus la sogs pa dang 'brel par rtogs te /
translated: and it is related to its object, time, etc.

original: des na da ltar 'das kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin de nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na da ltar 'das kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin de nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though the past has ceased, it is reified as just the nature of the past.

original: dper na khur bu ba la sngon mthong ba'i ba lang sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na khur bu ba la sngon mthong ba'i ba lang sgro 'dogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like reifying a cow in a drawing of a cow.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then

original: de 'das kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'das kyang sngon gyi rang bzhin du sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: even though the past has ceased, it is reified as the nature of the past.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: If that were not so, it would not be possible to understand it even through inference.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du nye bar btags pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du nye bar btags pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, it would be only a designation in all cases.

original: don dam par ni spyi med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par ni spyi med par 'gyur te /
translated: But ultimately there would be no universals,

original: thams cad du btags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du btags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would have the character of being designations in all cases.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyi spyi yod pa nyid 'dzin pa yin te des na don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyi spyi yod pa nyid 'dzin pa yin te des na don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the existence of a universal that is apprehended by direct perception is maintained, then it would be ultimate.

original: 'o na ni de rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi de dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi de dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not perceived by inference, etc., then that universal would be a non-thing.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang snga ma dang thun mong pa mi @189a * //
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang snga ma dang thun mong pa mi @189a * //
translated: Or, if it is perceived by direct perception, then it is not the case that the universal is not perceived by direct perception.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa rtogs la de ni sgra'am rjes su dpag pas kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa rtogs la de ni sgra'am rjes su dpag pas kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That which is the nature of the appearance of the indistinct is perceived, and that is perceived in just that way by direct perception or inference.

original: gsal ba nyid de ni mngon sum kho nas rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid de ni mngon sum kho nas rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But the very distinctness is perceived only by direct perception.

original: des na gal te khyad par gyi chal 'jug pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: des na gal te khyad par gyi chal 'jug pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, even if there is no engagement with the particular part,

original: spyi'i cha la ni sgra'am rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i cha la ni sgra'am rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: there is certainly engagement with the universal part by direct perception or inference.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: But that is not correct.

original: spyi de la ni mngon sum nyid //
analyzed: spyi de la ni mngon sum nyid //
translated: That universal does not exist as direct perception.

original: yod min dbang po med phyir dang // mngon du byas pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod min dbang po med phyir dang // mngon du byas pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no sense faculty, and because there is no manifestation.

original: 'di ni phyi nas brjod par bya //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi nas brjod par bya //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: snga ma dang thun mong ba nyid la ni mngon sum yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang thun mong ba nyid la ni mngon sum yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that there is perception of what is common to both.

original: khyad par sngar zhig kyang de dang thun mong du rtogs pa ni ji ltar dngos po yin te /
analyzed: khyad par sngar zhig kyang de dang thun mong du rtogs pa ni ji ltar dngos po yin te /
translated: And how can there be a thing that is understood as common to both when the difference has been destroyed?

original: yod pa med chos ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa med chos ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be a non-existent thing?

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i thun mong yin na ji ltar dngos po med pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it is common to both, how can it be a non-existent thing?

original: dngos por yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos por yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would be a thing.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: da ltar bar snang ba ni 'das par snang ba dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar bar snang ba ni 'das par snang ba dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: What appears as present is not understood as one with what appears as past.

original: du ma nyid du snang na yang thun mong ba zhes bya ba gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: du ma nyid du snang na yang thun mong ba zhes bya ba gzhan ci yod //
translated: And even if it appears as multiple, what else is there that is called common?

original: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba'i phyir sgra'i yul ni med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po snang ba'i phyir sgra'i yul ni med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because things such as the past appear, the object of sound is certainly non-existent.

original: 'dir nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is also not a designation.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of non-erroneous consciousness.

original: 'di ltar / blo ni 'khrul pa med 'jug pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo ni 'khrul pa med 'jug pa //
translated: The mind engages without error

original: rtag tu dngos dang sgro 'dogs la //üîΩseng ge bram ze'i khye'u la //
analyzed: rtag tu dngos dang sgro 'dogs la // seng ge bram ze'i khye'u la //
translated: With respect to the real and the imagined.üîΩThe lion is imputed

original: de ltar brjod pa'ang 'jig rten yod //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'ang 'jig rten yod //
translated: To the young brahmin by the world.

original: blo 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa dang / cig shos ni dngos dang btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no ;
analyzed: blo 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa dang / cig shos ni dngos dang btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no ;
translated: The mind engages without error with respect to the real and the imagined.

original: / bram ze'i khye'u la shes pa 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: / bram ze'i khye'u la shes pa 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The consciousness of the young brahmin is in error.

original: des na seng ge nyid nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na seng ge nyid nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the lion is imputed to him.

original: gzhan du ni seng ge nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni seng ge nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po yin no //
translated: But in another case, it is real, because it is a lion.

original: 'dir ni gnyi ga yang blo 'khrul pa med pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyi ga yang blo 'khrul pa med pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Here, both are objects of the mind without error.

original: des na nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not an imputation.

original: med pa'i don nye bar btags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa'i don nye bar btags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is an imputation of a nonexistent object,

original: gal te med pa'i don can gyi shes pa'i yul yin pa de ltar na spyi de kho na nyid du med par 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te med pa'i don can gyi shes pa'i yul yin pa de ltar na spyi de kho na nyid du med par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: if it is the object of a consciousness that has a nonexistent object, then it is established that that universal does not exist in reality.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / don med na yang 'gro ba yis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / don med na yang 'gro ba yis //
translated: Even without an object, the world

original: gang la grags pas sgra bkod pa //üîΩde la de dngos de mtshungs phyir //üîΩ'khrul rtogs gzhan @189b la phal pa yin //
analyzed: gang la grags pas sgra bkod pa // de la de dngos de mtshungs phyir // 'khrul rtogs gzhan @189b la phal pa yin //
translated: The term ‚Äúwell known‚Äù is usedüîΩbecause it is similar to that thing.üîΩOther mistaken thoughts are ordinary.üîΩ

original: med pa'i sgra ni med pa la dngos yin te 'khrul par rtog pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: med pa'i sgra ni med pa la dngos yin te 'khrul par rtog pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: The word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used in the sense of nonexistence, because there is no misconception of existence.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir gzhan du la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid la ni med pa'i sgra phal pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa la rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir gzhan du la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid la ni med pa'i sgra phal pa yin no zhes 'jig rten pa la rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used in the sense of other things, such as ‚Äúnonexistent pot,‚Äù because there is no purpose in using the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù in the sense of nonexistence.

original: des na dngos dang dngos po med pa la mtshungs pa'o phyir 'das pa la sogs pa la ni spyi dngos por yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos dang dngos po med pa la mtshungs pa'o phyir 'das pa la sogs pa la ni spyi dngos por yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, because of the equivalence of existence and nonexistence, the universal does not exist as a real entity in the past, etc.,

original: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste dngos po med pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nye bar btags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // ci ste dngos po med pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di nyid nye bar btags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is apprehended by a cognition that is of the same aspect as the cognition of a nonentity.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of the past, etc., is a designation,üîΩthen how can the universal be said to be nonexistent?

original: spyi'i rnam pa la med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di gang las yin /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa la med pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di gang las yin /
translated: If you say that the cognition of the past, etc., is a designation, then how can the universal be said to be nonexistent?

original: rtog pa nyid las de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa nyid las de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is just conceptualization that is like that.

original: zhig par ma shes pa la rtog pa tha dad pa yang med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhig par ma shes pa la rtog pa tha dad pa yang med pa nyid yin la /
translated: But when one does not understand destruction, there is no difference in conceptualization.

original: gang la 'di zhig go zhes bya bar rtogs pa de yang ma zhig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang la 'di zhig go zhes bya bar rtogs pa de yang ma zhig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: And is it not the case that that which is understood as ‚Äúthis is destroyed‚Äù is not destroyed?

original: the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩgal te dngos po snang ba yin na the tshom du yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhe na / gal te dngos po snang ba yin na the tshom du yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: One would have doubt.üîΩIf an entity appears, there would not be doubt.

original: snang yang 'dra ba las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: snang yang 'dra ba las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is doubt because of similarity, even though it appears,

original: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa dag ni 'dra'o zhes brjod par nus kyi /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa dag ni 'dra'o zhes brjod par nus kyi /
translated: if one can say that the conceptualizations are different, they are similar.

original: tha dad par ma rtogs pa ni de nyid du 'gyur gyi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par ma rtogs pa ni de nyid du 'gyur gyi 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if one does not understand them to be different, they are the same, not similar.

original: ci ste dus tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste dus tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say they are different because of being different times,üîΩthat is not good.

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: For,

original: 'di ltar / dus tha dad pas tha dad gang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dus tha dad pas tha dad gang //
translated: How can they be different because of being different times?

original: de dang de las gzhan ga las //
analyzed: de dang de las gzhan ga las //
translated: How can they be different from that and from each other?

original: yod don nyid la'ang dus tha dad //
analyzed: yod don nyid la'ang dus tha dad //
translated: Even if they exist, they are different times.

original: shes pa yod pa min nam ci //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa min nam ci //
translated: But is there not consciousness?

original: di ltar khyod kyis yod pa'i don nyid la yang /
analyzed: di ltar khyod kyis yod pa'i don nyid la yang /
translated: In this way, you say that the object exists,

original: snga ma dang ni phyi ma'i shes pa dus tha dad pa dag yin pa de bzhin du med pa'i don la yang yin pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa'i phyir don yod pa dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma dang ni phyi ma'i shes pa dus tha dad pa dag yin pa de bzhin du med pa'i don la yang yin pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa'i phyir don yod pa dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: but the earlier and later consciousnesses are different times. In the same way, the object does not exist, but it is also different times. How could there be a distinction between the existent object and the other?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa la don yod pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa la don yod pa nyid yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the object exists for inference, that is not so.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yod pa nyid do /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yod pa nyid do /
translated: Inference also exists for the past and future.

original: rtags kyi khyad par gyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par gyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The distinction of the past and so on is due to the difference in the reason.

original: 'di ltar rtags 'ga' zhig ni 'das pa nyid kyis yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags 'ga' zhig ni 'das pa nyid kyis yin la /
translated: In this way, some reasons are due to the past,

original: kha cig ni da ltar ba nyid kyis yin zhing /
analyzed: kha cig ni da ltar ba nyid kyis yin zhing /
translated: some are due to the present,

original: gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir blo mtshungs pa nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis yin pa'i phyir blo mtshungs pa nyid med do zhe na /
translated: and others are due to the future. Therefore there is no equality of the mind.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: gal te rtags las skyes na yang //
analyzed: gal te rtags las skyes na yang //
translated: If it arises from a sign,

original: de ni dngos la 'jug @190a * //
analyzed: de ni dngos la 'jug @190a * //
translated: then it would engage the real thing,

original: 'gyur na // rnam gzhan the tshom med 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'gyur na // rnam gzhan the tshom med 'gyur te //
translated: but it would be uncertain about another aspect,

original: rnam pa thams cad gzung phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad gzung phyir ro //
translated: because all aspects are apprehended.

original: de'i phyir de la yang rnam pa de dngos po med par yin par rigs te the tshom gyi yul yin pa'i phyir sgra'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang rnam pa de dngos po med par yin par rigs te the tshom gyi yul yin pa'i phyir sgra'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is uncertain about that aspect, because it is the object of doubt, like the aspect of sound.

original: rtogs pa nyid la ni the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid la ni the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not uncertain about the very cognition itself.

original: rnam pa gzhan la the tshom za'o zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan la the tshom za'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it is uncertain about another aspect,

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: we reply:

original: de la rnam pa gzhan de ni rtogs sam 'on te de lta min /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gzhan de ni rtogs sam 'on te de lta min /
translated: Is that other aspect cognized or not?

original: gal te rtogs na the tshom med //
analyzed: gal te rtogs na the tshom med //
translated: If it is cognized, there is no doubt.

original: gzhan du'ang the tshom ga las yin //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang the tshom ga las yin //
translated: How can there be doubt about another?

original: gal te de rtogs pa nyid the tshom med do //
analyzed: gal te de rtogs pa nyid the tshom med do //
translated: If it is cognized, there is no doubt.

original: ma rtogs na yang mi snang ba nyid yin pas de la the tshom ci yod /
analyzed: ma rtogs na yang mi snang ba nyid yin pas de la the tshom ci yod /
translated: If it is not cognized, it is not manifest, so what doubt is there about it?

original: gal te ma rtogs pa nyid la the tshom za na mi snang ba thams cad la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rtogs pa nyid la the tshom za na mi snang ba thams cad la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you doubt the non-apprehension itself, then you doubt all non-apprehensions.

original: gal te rtogs pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: If you doubt the apprehension itself,

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because another conception arises, moving or unmoving,

original: gal te rtogs na rnam par rtog pa g-yo ba ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rtogs na rnam par rtog pa g-yo ba ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: if there is apprehension, how can there be a moving conception?

original: gzhan yang ci rang gi ngo bo nyid g-yo ba yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci rang gi ngo bo nyid g-yo ba yin nam /
translated: Moreover, does the nature itself move,

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i gzhal bya g-yo ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i gzhal bya g-yo ba yin /
translated: or does the object of apprehension move?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo g-yo bas ni gzhal bya la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo g-yo bas ni gzhal bya la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of conception does not move, so it does not doubt the object of apprehension.

original: 'on te gzhal bya g-yo ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhal bya g-yo ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object of apprehension moves,

original: ma yin te rtogs pa la ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rtogs pa la ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because there is no movement in apprehension.

original: 'on te 'di la the tshom za ba yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te 'di la the tshom za ba yin te ;
translated: But if you doubt this,

original: ci 'di mthong bar 'gyur ram ma yin zhes mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di mthong bar 'gyur ram ma yin zhes mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
translated: you doubt whether you see it, thinking, ‚ÄúDo I see this or not?‚Äù

original: de yang snang ba ma 'on te ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang snang ba ma 'on te ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the object is not manifest, it is not manifest.

original: gal te mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du mthong na the tshom ci yod /
analyzed: gal te mthong bar 'gyur ba nyid du mthong na the tshom ci yod /
translated: If it is manifest, then what is the doubt?

original: ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is not manifest,

original: yang the tshom ci yod ces /
analyzed: yang the tshom ci yod ces /
translated: then what is the doubt?

original: phyogs gnyis pa de nyid ma god par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa de nyid ma god par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the second position is not avoided.

original: 'on te spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par dran pa las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par dran pa las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because the universal is manifest, the particular is not manifest, and doubt arises from the memory of the particular,

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / khyad par mngon sum min gang de'i //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / 'di ltar / khyad par mngon sum min gang de'i //
translated: that is not so.üîΩThus:üîΩThat which is not manifest in the particular

original: mngon sum min pa nyid gang yin //üîΩmed dang ma yin pa dag las //
analyzed: mngon sum min pa nyid gang yin // med dang ma yin pa dag las //
translated: is not manifest.üîΩThere is no other negation

original: dgag pa gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dgag pa gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: than nonexistence and nonbeing.

original: gal te ma yin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin pa yin na /
translated: If it is not manifest,

original: mngon sum las gzhan rig pa mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan rig pa mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then, because it is not manifest in the particular, it would not be manifest.

original: de'i tshe rig pa gzhan yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar the tshom du 'gyur /üîΩ'on te ci dmigs pa dang bcas pa @190b yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig pa gzhan yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar the tshom du 'gyur / 'on te ci dmigs pa dang bcas pa @190b yin nam /
translated: At that time, since awareness would also have an object, how could it be doubt?üîΩOr, if it is not known whether it has an object,

original: 'on te ma yin zhes mi shes pa de'i phyir na the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes mi shes pa de'i phyir na the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then because of that, it would be doubt.

original: de la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid snang ngam ma yin zhes de nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid snang ngam ma yin zhes de nyid du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would engage in that very object, wondering whether it has an object or not.

original: ci ste de ni dmigs pa med pa yang srid la bzlog pa yang yin pa'i phyir the tshom za'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de ni dmigs pa med pa yang srid la bzlog pa yang yin pa'i phyir the tshom za'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is doubt because it is possible that it does not have an object and it is also the opposite of that,üîΩthen it is mere appearance, but it is not the appearance of an object, and therefore inference would have an existent object.

original: 'o na ni snang ba tsam kho nar zad kyi don snang ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i khyad par yang don med de /
analyzed: 'o na ni snang ba tsam kho nar zad kyi don snang ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i khyad par yang don med de /
translated: The distinction ‚Äúbecause the universal is directly perceived‚Äù is also meaningless,

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt about what is understood by inference.

original: khyad par gang la mngon sum med pa de ci de nyid yin nam gzhan yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: khyad par gang la mngon sum med pa de ci de nyid yin nam gzhan yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: In particular, when there is no direct perception, there are two alternatives: is it that or is it something else?

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the nature of that,

original: ci ltar mngon sum nyid ma yin /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum nyid ma yin /
translated: why is it not direct perception?

original: gzhan yin no zhe na /üîΩde mthong bas de la the tshom du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yin no zhe na / de mthong bas de la the tshom du 'gyur /
translated: If it is something else,üîΩthen there would be doubt about that, because of seeing it.

original: de de la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de de la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is seen in that,

original: gal te mthong du chug pa de lta na yang mthong ngo snyam du dran par 'gyur mod ci ltar the tshom du 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te mthong du chug pa de lta na yang mthong ngo snyam du dran par 'gyur mod ci ltar the tshom du 'gyur /
translated: then even if it is seen, it is remembered as seen, so how could there be doubt?

original: ris 'ga' ma mthong ba'i yang phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ris 'ga' ma mthong ba'i yang phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because of not seeing a part of it,

original: gzhan gyi tshe ma mthong ngo //
