analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ma mthong ngo //
translated: it is not seen at another time.

original: de ltar yang dran par 'gyur gyi the tshom ci yod /
analyzed: de ltar yang dran par 'gyur gyi the tshom ci yod /
translated: In that case, it is remembered as it is, so what is the doubt?

original: gnyi gar ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir the tshom nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi gar ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir the tshom nyid do zhe na /
translated: Because it is not tenable as either, there is doubt.

original: ji ltar gnyi ga ltar mthong /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyi ga ltar mthong /
translated: How is it seen as both?

original: dus tha dad par ro zhe na /
analyzed: dus tha dad par ro zhe na /
translated: At different times.

original: dran pa yang de kho na ltar 'gyur gyi ci ltar the tshom yin /
analyzed: dran pa yang de kho na ltar 'gyur gyi ci ltar the tshom yin /
translated: In that case, memory would be just like that, so how could there be doubt?

original: 'dir da ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir the tshom za ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir da ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir the tshom za ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that you doubt because you do not see it now,

original: 'o na ma mthong bas the tshom za ba'i phyir spyi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'o na ma mthong bas the tshom za ba'i phyir spyi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi 'thad do //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that you see the universal because you see its possessor.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa srid pa'i phyir the tshom spyi yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa srid pa'i phyir the tshom spyi yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is possible to have a cognition without an object, doubt is a universal.

original: ci ste the tshom zhes bya ba'i don de lta bur gyur pa zhig snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste the tshom zhes bya ba'i don de lta bur gyur pa zhig snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object called doubt appears in that way,

original: ma yin te don du mos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te don du mos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: no, because there is no belief in an object.

original: de la 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no zhes mos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no zhes mos pa yin no //
translated: For you believe that it is merely a cognition.

original: 'jig rten pa ma yin pa dang rang rig pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ma yin pa dang rang rig pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And it has already been explained that there is no difference between worldly and nonworldly reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir snang ba med pas the tshom za ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba med pas the tshom za ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, doubt is due to the absence of an appearance, not otherwise.

original: des na gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul dngos por yod na the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul dngos por yod na the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the object of inference exists as a real entity, there would be no doubt.

original: yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang yin te /
translated: But it does exist.

original: des na dngos po ma yin no /
analyzed: des na dngos po ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is not a real entity.

original: 'on te re zhig de la dngos po ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te re zhig de la dngos po ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: But if you say that the object of inference is a real entity,

original: de yang rjes su dpag pas nges par byas pa yin te /üîΩde'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul dngos po ma yin par ji ltar @191a * //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pas nges par byas pa yin te / de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul dngos po ma yin par ji ltar @191a * //
translated: and that it is ascertained by inference,

original: 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can the object of inference not be a real entity?

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: We reply:üîΩIf it is a real entity,

original: gal te der ni dngos po dang // reg na g-yo bar ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te der ni dngos po dang // reg na g-yo bar ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can it be moved when touched?

original: rtag ltar snang bar rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: rtag ltar snang bar rtogs pa ni //
translated: The cognition that appears to be permanent

original: rtogs pa de ni g-yo ba nyid //
analyzed: rtogs pa de ni g-yo ba nyid //
translated: is moved by that cognition.

original: bden pa'i du ba las me rtogs na yang gang gi tshe sbrang ma'i tshogs yin no snyam du 'khrul pa skyes pa de'i tshe me rtogs pa g-yo bar 'gyur zhing gzhan skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i du ba las me rtogs na yang gang gi tshe sbrang ma'i tshogs yin no snyam du 'khrul pa skyes pa de'i tshe me rtogs pa g-yo bar 'gyur zhing gzhan skye ba yin no //
translated: When fire is inferred from real smoke, if a cognition arises that is mistaken, thinking it is a swarm of bees, then the cognition of fire is moved and another arises.

original: mngon sum gyi rtogs pas ni de ltar g-yo ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rtogs pas ni de ltar g-yo ba ma yin no //
translated: But a cognition of direct perception is not moved in that way.

original: rab rib kyis nyams par dogs pa ni de la yang mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib kyis nyams par dogs pa ni de la yang mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition is moved by doubt about whether the eye is impaired by cataracts, that is the same in the case of inference.

original: ma yin te rang gi ngo bo snang ba la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rang gi ngo bo snang ba la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because that is not present in the appearance of its own nature.

original: mig btsums nas g-yo ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mig btsums nas g-yo ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that it moves when the eyes are closed, no.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ma skyes par zad do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ma skyes par zad do //
translated: Because there is no cause, it is exhausted as unborn.

original: rjes su dpag pas yang rgyu rtags med pa'i phyir ma skyes par zad do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yang rgyu rtags med pa'i phyir ma skyes par zad do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that it is exhausted as unborn because there is no cause of inference, no.

original: de na du ba yod kyang gzhan du dogs pas rnam par g-yo bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na du ba yod kyang gzhan du dogs pas rnam par g-yo bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though there is smoke there, movement is seen due to doubt about something else.

original: 'on te gzhan du dogs pa med pa nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yod par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du dogs pa med pa nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yod par ga la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the absence of doubt about something else is the cause, how can there be a cause?

original: de ni mi 'thad de de mthong na gzhan du dogs pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de de mthong na gzhan du dogs pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not tenable, because when that is seen, doubt about something else is eliminated.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa ni g-yo ba yin pas dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa ni g-yo ba yin pas dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, inference is movement, not the apprehension of an entity.

original: de'i phyir / mthong ba nyid ni bstan pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mthong ba nyid ni bstan pa yis //
translated: Thus:üîΩThe statement ‚Äúit moves‚Äù

original: g-yo zhes bya ba bab col yin //üîΩmngon sum la ni g-yo ba med //
analyzed: g-yo zhes bya ba bab col yin // mngon sum la ni g-yo ba med //
translated: is rash,üîΩbecause there is no movement in perception.

original: g-yo ba yin na mthong ba min //
analyzed: g-yo ba yin na mthong ba min //
translated: If there were movement, it would not be seen.

original: mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba ma yin no //
translated: The object of the visual perception is not a non-fire.

original: gzhan du rnam par brtags pas ni dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par brtags pas ni dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by the imagination of something else, there is no change in the nature of the thing.

original: ci ste mthong ba la 'di ni me ma yin no zhes bya bas g-yo ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste mthong ba la 'di ni me ma yin no zhes bya bas g-yo ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But, if it is argued that the perception is of a non-fire because of the statement, ‚ÄúThis is not a fire,‚Äù that is not so.

original: me ni mngon sum yul ma yin //
analyzed: me ni mngon sum yul ma yin //
translated: Fire is not the object of direct perception.

original: mig gi rig bya rig ma yin //üîΩ'byung 'gyur rang bzhin dbang po yis //
analyzed: mig gi rig bya rig ma yin // 'byung 'gyur rang bzhin dbang po yis //
translated: The object of visual perception is not a cognition.

original: rig pa gang na'ang yod ma yin //üîΩci 'di me ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'am /üîΩ'on te 'di dro ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rig pa gang na'ang yod ma yin // ci 'di me ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'am / 'on te 'di dro ba'i reg pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: The cognition of the elements is not found anywhere by the senses.üîΩIs it that this is not a fire because of the statement, ‚ÄúThis is not a fire,‚Äù or is it that it is not a fire because it is not associated with the contact of heat, or is it that it is not a fire because it is not the object of the cognition of the elements?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig rig pa'i yul ma yin pa zhes rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang lhan cig rig pa'i yul ma yin pa zhes rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three alternatives.

original: gal te 'di nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is that this is not a fire,

original: de ltar ni mi nus te mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not possible, because it is seen.

original: mthong yang ma yin na ni thams cad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong yang ma yin na ni thams cad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not seen, then it is not all.

original: 'on te gzugs dang reg pa 'dus pa me yin pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang reg pa 'dus pa me yin pa des na /
translated: If it is fire that is the combination of form and touch,

original: gzugs @191b 'di ni reg pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par brtags pa yin na /
analyzed: gzugs @191b 'di ni reg pa dang lhan cig spyod pa ma yin no zhes rnam par brtags pa yin na /
translated: then this form is not concomitant with touch.

original: 'o na ni de mig gis 'dzin pa ma yin te /üîΩdes na ma mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni de mig gis 'dzin pa ma yin te / des na ma mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: But then it is not apprehended by the eye,üîΩand therefore it is not seen.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba kho na g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba kho na g-yo ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only the unseen that moves.

original: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin g-yo ba yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin g-yo ba yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the nature of the future that moves.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba ni dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba ni dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since seeing does not touch the thing, it is not reasonable to imagine it.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ni dngos po la reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ni dngos po la reg pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, inferential cognition does not touch the thing.

original: gal te mthong yang rnam gzhan gyis //üîΩthe tshom la lar yod ce na //
analyzed: gal te mthong yang rnam gzhan gyis // the tshom la lar yod ce na //
translated: If it is seen but doubted due to another aspect,

original: the tshom de ni dpag bya la //
analyzed: the tshom de ni dpag bya la //
translated: doubt is about what is to be inferred.

original: 'byung 'gyur mthong nyid dpag bya min // snang ba la ni slu med dang // mngon sum nyid du mngon sum dang // cig shos dag mtshungs phyi rol gyi//
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur mthong nyid dpag bya min // snang ba la ni slu med dang // mngon sum nyid du mngon sum dang // cig shos dag mtshungs phyi rol gyi//
translated: In the case of appearances, there is no deception, and direct perception is direct perception.

original: dngos la ltos nas tha dad nyid //
analyzed: dngos la ltos nas tha dad nyid //
translated: The distinction between the two is made in terms of external objects.

original: des na snang ba 'ga' zhig gam //
analyzed: des na snang ba 'ga' zhig gam //
translated: Therefore, some appearancesüîΩare direct perception, and some are not.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: Inferences are not direct perception,

original: mngon sum ltar snang nyid ces pa'i //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang nyid ces pa'i //
translated: but they are like direct perception.üîΩThe distinction between direct perception and seeming direct perception

original: dbye ba'ang phyi rol dngos la yin //
analyzed: dbye ba'ang phyi rol dngos la yin //
translated: is made in terms of external objects.

original: yang na gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa la yang mi snang na /
analyzed: yang na gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa la yang mi snang na /
translated: Moreover, if a future thing does not appear in an inference,

original: de bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be true?

original: 'gyur te / de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur te / de ni skyes bu gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is true because it is understood by another person.

original: gal te des kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs na ji ltar de bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te des kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs na ji ltar de bden par 'gyur te /
translated: If that person understands it as having a future nature, how could it be true?

original: rab rib can gyi snang ba bzhin du mi bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi snang ba bzhin du mi bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be just like the appearance of floaters; it would not be true at all.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis rtogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas ji ltar de nyid kyis de bden par rtogs te /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis rtogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas ji ltar de nyid kyis de bden par rtogs te /
translated: Also, when other persons understand it, it is inference. So how could it be understood to be true by that?

original: ma grub pas ni ma grub par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pas ni ma grub par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: For if it is not established, it does not establish something else that is not established.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin srid na yang rjes su dpag pa ni yul de la lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin srid na yang rjes su dpag pa ni yul de la lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even if the nature of the future exists, inference is the mere adherence to that object.

original: de ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur /
translated: Since it does not exist at that time, how could inference be an object that exists?

original: mngon sum yang de nyid la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang de nyid la tshad ma yin te /
translated: Also, direct perception is a valid cognition in regard to that.

original: 'di ltar de la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid bden pa yin gyi de ltar ma yin na ni mi bden pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid bden pa yin gyi de ltar ma yin na ni mi bden pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: In this way, the understanding of the nature of the future is true, but if it is not like that, it is not true.

original: de ni de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ni de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: That is exactly how it is.

original: de ltar yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: We will demonstrate that.

original: des ni rjes su dpog pa'i blo ni med pa la yang mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpog pa'i blo ni med pa la yang mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: In that case, the mind that infers is the same in regard to a nonexistent object.

original: mngon sum gyi blo ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo ni dngos po med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the direct perception does not become a non-entity.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, inference does not have an entity for its object.
But if

original: dngos po ni med pa'i yul can nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ni med pa'i yul can nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: you say that an entity is not an entity because it has a non-entity for its object,

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good,

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid do zhes 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid do zhes 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that all inferences have a non-entity for their object.

original: 'di ni dngos po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not the definition of a non-entity,

original: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in a distorted way.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar dngos po nus med la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar dngos po nus med la //
translated: Just as one says that an entity is powerless,

original: med ce'am rtogs pa ci bzhin du //
analyzed: med ce'am rtogs pa ci bzhin du //
translated: nonexistent, or understood,

original: nus la'ang gtso bo la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: nus la'ang gtso bo la sogs pa'i //
translated: so also with regard to the powerful,

original: mnyan po skye bos byas pa yin //
analyzed: mnyan po skye bos byas pa yin //
translated: people create the idea of a primary cause, etc.

original: dngos po la yang rung ba nyid dam rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug par byed pa de ni phal pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la yang rung ba nyid dam rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug par byed pa de ni phal pa yin no //
translated: It is common knowledge that the words ‚Äúprimary cause,‚Äù etc., are applied to an entity in accordance with its suitability or unsuitability.

original: khyod kyi 'dod pa ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dngos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pa ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dngos su 'gyur ro //
translated: Your assertion is a real entity because it has a real object.

original: gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa ni khyod kyi 'dod pas grangs can gyi skyes bu la sogs pa'i sgra gang yin pa de dag gi tha snyad dang rnam par rtog pa dag dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu la sogs pa ni khyod kyi 'dod pas grangs can gyi skyes bu la sogs pa'i sgra gang yin pa de dag gi tha snyad dang rnam par rtog pa dag dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The pradhƒÅna, puru·π£a, etc., are not real entities because the terms pradhƒÅna, puru·π£a, etc., as you assert them, are mere conventions and concepts that have real objects.

original: dngos po ma yin par 'gyur na de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin par 'gyur na de ltar ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: ci ste gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir bu la sogs pa la gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra dngos ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan sgro btags pa'i phyir bu la sogs pa la gtso bo la sogs pa'i sgra dngos ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the terms pradhƒÅna, etc., are not real entities because they are applied to something else, i.e., to sons, etc.,üîΩthen the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.

original: 'o na dngos po dang cig shos kyi yul can nyid sgra dngos po dang cig shos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde la sgro btags pas na de nyid kyi rang bzhin du med pa nyid de des na mtshan nyid de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po dang cig shos kyi yul can nyid sgra dngos po dang cig shos kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde la sgro btags pas na de nyid kyi rang bzhin du med pa nyid de des na mtshan nyid de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the terms real entity and non-real entity are not real entities because they are applied to something else, then the terms real entity and non-real entity cannot be defined as having real and unreal objects, respectively.üîΩIf you say

original: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang dpe la mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang dpe la mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: But then, since inference also superimposes a nature that is seen in the example, it is established that inference does not have a real object.

original: de'i phyir / zhig pa sgra las blo ci 'dra ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / zhig pa sgra las blo ci 'dra ;
translated: Therefore: What kind of cognition is there of destruction from a sound?

original: / snang ba de 'dra ba zhig la'ang //
analyzed: / snang ba de 'dra ba zhig la'ang //
translated: It is like the appearance of that.

original: rna ba la sogs rnam par shes //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs rnam par shes //
translated: The consciousnesses of the ear and so on

original: don yod can la de dag med //
analyzed: don yod can la de dag med //
translated: do not have a real object.

original: spyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir //üîΩsems gnyis dag ni mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: spyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir // sems gnyis dag ni mtshungs pa yin //
translated: Because it apprehends a mere generality,üîΩthe two minds are similar.

original: de 'ba' zhig ni 'dzin byed pa //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig ni 'dzin byed pa //
translated: The mind that apprehends only that

original: sngar ni rnam par bzlog zin to //
analyzed: sngar ni rnam par bzlog zin to //
translated: has already been refuted.

original: spyi tsam zhig 'dzin na 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi tsam zhig 'dzin na 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it apprehends a mere generality, there would be no distinction of past and so on.

original: 'ba' zhig gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa yang yin no //
translated: It has already been explained that it is not apprehended as only that.

original: 'on te gsal ba de dag nyid khyad par med par gzung ba ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba de dag nyid khyad par med par gzung ba ni spyi yin te /
translated: But if the apprehension of those individual things without distinction is a generality,üîΩthen it is not a real object.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, inference would have a real object.

original: 'di @192b la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di @192b la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: khyad par med par 'dzin pa de gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par 'dzin pa de gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that apprehension of the absence of difference is the nature of cognition, then inference would not have a real object.

original: 'on te rang bzhin de dngos po nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin de dngos po nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if that nature is a real entity,

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / phan tshun khyad par can rnams ni //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / 'di ltar / phan tshun khyad par can rnams ni //
translated: that also is not so.üîΩThus:üîΩHow could those that have mutual differences

original: khyad med ngo bo ci ltar 'gyur ;
analyzed: khyad med ngo bo ci ltar 'gyur ;
translated: have an undifferentiated nature?

original: / ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
translated: Even if there were two natures,

original: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be one real entity?

original: khyad par can gyi ngo bo rnams ngo bo khyad par med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi ngo bo rnams ngo bo khyad par med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Those that have different natures do not have an undifferentiated nature,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that those that are mutually exclusive are one.

original: ba lang ba lang zhes gcig nyid ldog pa dang rjes su song bar mngon sum du dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang ba lang zhes gcig nyid ldog pa dang rjes su song bar mngon sum du dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is directly perceived that the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the basis of the exclusion of non-cow and the basis of the inclusion of cow.

original: rjes su song ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ba lang ba lang zhes rjes su zhugs pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su song ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / ba lang ba lang zhes rjes su zhugs pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is the cognition that the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù conforms to the cow.

original: ci rjes su song ba la yang rjes su song ba yod dam /
analyzed: ci rjes su song ba la yang rjes su song ba yod dam /
translated: But does conformity exist in conformity?

original: de lta'o zhe na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does, there is an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that it does not, then the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù would not conform to the cow.
